dmv_test_1.question: In which of the following scenarios should your wheels not be pointed straight ahead?

options.text: When waiting to make a left turn at a traffic light.
When parked on a hill or sloping driveway.
options.explanation: While waiting to turn left, keep your wheels pointed straight ahead until it is safe to start your turn. If a vehicle hits you from behind, this will prevent you from veering into oncoming traffic. When parked facing either uphill or downhill, turn the wheels so the vehicle will not roll into traffic if the brakes fail.

options.text: When parked on the side of a level roadway where there is no curb.

dmv_test_1.question: When driving in fog, rain, or snow, use:

options.text: Low beams.
options.explanation: Low beam headlights should be used in fog, rain, and snow. The light from high beams will reflect back to the driver under these weather conditions, causing a glare that will make it difficult to see ahead.

options.text: High beams.
Fog lights only.

dmv_test_1.question: When you see this sign, you:

options.text: Are approaching a railroad crossing and should prepare to stop.
options.explanation: This sign indicates that you are approaching a railroad crossing. You must look, listen, slow down, and prepare to stop. Wait for any trains to pass before you proceed.

options.text: Will always stop at the upcoming railroad crossing.
Should stop and wait for a signal before crossing the railroad tracks.

dmv_test_1.question: If a truck or bus is making a right turn where you also need to make a right turn, you should:

options.text: Quickly turn before the truck or bus is able to.
Wait until the truck or bus turns before you turn.
options.explanation: If you try to insert your vehicle between a turning truck or bus and a curb, you may suffer a serious crash. To avoid a collision, do not turn until the truck or bus has completed its turn.

options.text: Squeeze between the truck or bus and the curb.

dmv_test_1.question: You should increase the distance between your vehicle and the vehicle ahead when you:

options.text: Are following a small passenger vehicle.
Are being tailgated by another driver.
options.explanation: When being tailgated, create extra space in front of your vehicle and do not brake suddenly. Slow down gradually or merge into another lane to prevent a collision with the tailgater.

options.text: Are driving more slowly than the posted speed limit.

dmv_test_1.question: When driving under snowy or icy conditions:

options.text: It is safe to use your cruise control.
Make speed and directional changes more gradually than you would otherwise.
options.explanation: When driving under snowy or icy conditions, you should make speed and directional changes gradually. Never use cruise control when driving on snow or ice because your tires may lose contact with the road and you will lose control of your vehicle.

options.text: Drive as you would under normal conditions.

dmv_test_1.question: A broken yellow centerline means that:

options.text: Passing is not permitted.
Passing on the right is permitted when the way ahead is clear.
Passing on the left is permitted when the way ahead is clear.
options.explanation: A broken yellow centerline means that a driver may cross the centerline to pass another vehicle on the left as long as there is no oncoming traffic. Drivers should never cross a solid yellow centerline in order to pass.

dmv_test_1.question: Which of these statements is true about changing lanes?

options.text: You only need to turn and look over your right shoulder for lane changes to the right or left.
Look over your right shoulder for a right lane change and your left shoulder for a left lane change.
options.explanation: Before changing lanes, signal, look in all your mirrors, and look over your left or right shoulder to make sure the lane next to you is clear. Looking over your shoulder is a way to check your blind spot to be sure there is no vehicle, motorcycle, or bicycle traffic in the next lane.

options.text: Vehicles with two outside mirrors do not have blind spots.

dmv_test_1.question: When being followed by a tailgater, which of the following will help you avoid being hit from behind?

options.text: Merging into another lane
options.explanation: When being closely followed by a tailgater, you should slow down gradually or merge into another lane to prevent a collision with them.

options.text: Decreasing your following distance
Changing lanes frequently

dmv_test_1.question: If you approach a traffic light with a red signal and a police officer directs you to go through the intersection without stopping, you should:

options.text: Stop until the light turns green.
Go through the intersection without stopping.
options.explanation: Instructions given by police officers directing traffic always override posted traffic signals and signs. Follow the officer's instructions.

options.text: Come to a complete stop before proceeding.

dmv_test_1.question: Which of the following factors affect an individual's absorption of alcohol?

options.text: Weight
options.explanation: Factors affecting a person's absorption of alcohol include the person's weight, their biological sex, the amount of food in their digestive tract, and the number of alcoholic beverages they have consumed. The only thing to do to remove alcohol from a person's system is to wait.

options.text: Height
Intelligence

dmv_test_1.question: This white sign means:

options.text: You should slow down and move to the right lane.
Stay in the right lane if you are driving more slowly than other traffic.
options.explanation: A white, rectangular sign indicates that you must obey important rules. This sign means that drivers should allow the left lane to remain open, when possible, for passing and for faster traffic.

options.text: Slower traffic must exit on the right.

dmv_test_1.question: An orange and red triangular sign on a vehicle always means:

options.text: The vehicle has the right-of-way.
Slow-moving vehicle.
options.explanation: Slow-moving vehicles, such as farm tractors, road maintenance vehicles, and animal-drawn carts, display an orange and red triangle on the back.

options.text: Shoulder work ahead.

dmv_test_1.question: Fatigue increases the risk of:

options.text: Missing an exit.
Being late for an appointment.
Falling asleep behind the wheel and crashing.
options.explanation: Fatigue causes errors related to speed and distance, increases your risk of being in a crash, and causes you to take more time to make decisions. When you are fatigued, you could fall asleep behind the wheel and crash, injuring or killing yourself or others.

dmv_test_1.question: This sign means:

options.text: Cars on the right move first.
You have the right-of-way.
Let cross traffic pass before proceeding.
options.explanation: When approaching this sign, you must yield the right-of-way. Slow down and let vehicles and pedestrians crossing your path pass before you proceed. If necessary, stop before going ahead.

dmv_test_1.question: Which of the following blocks the smooth flow of traffic?

options.text: Slowing down to look at collision scene.
options.explanation: Rubbernecking (the practice of slowing down to look at collisions or other out-of-the-ordinary things) contributes to traffic congestion and should be avoided.

options.text: Avoiding unnecessary lane changes.
Using public transportation instead of your vehicle.

dmv_test_1.question: You want to make a right turn at an upcoming intersection. You should slow down and:

options.text: Move toward the left side of your lane.
Avoid driving in the bicycle lane.
Signal for 100 feet before turning.
options.explanation: When making a right turn, you should begin signaling about 100 feet before the turn.

dmv_test_1.question: When driving in work zones, you should:

options.text: Increase your speed to get through the zone as quickly as possible.
Reduce your speed and be prepared to stop suddenly.
options.explanation: When entering and driving through a work zone, slow down and be prepared to stop. Obey posted speed limits and be alert to conditions around you. Workers could be present.

options.text: Maintain your normal speed the whole way through the zone.

dmv_test_1.question: When backing up:

options.text: Look through the rear window.
options.explanation: When backing up, place your right arm on the back of the passenger seat and look directly through the rear window. Do not depend on your rearview or side mirrors as mirrors do not show directly behind your vehicle. Only drive in reverse at a low speed.

options.text: Press hard on the gas pedal.
Rely only on your rearview mirror.

dmv_test_1.question: You are approaching an intersection at the posted speed limit when the signal turns yellow. You should:

options.text: Slow down and proceed through the intersection without caution.
Speed up to cross the intersection before the light turns red.
Stop before entering the intersection, if you can do so safely.
options.explanation: A solid yellow light means "caution" and signals that the light will soon turn red. You should stop at a solid yellow light if you can do so safely; otherwise, you should cautiously cross the intersection.

dmv_test_1.question: A person may legally ride in the back of a pickup truck when:

options.text: The sides of the pickup bed are at least 24 inches high.
The back of the pickup is covered with a camper shell.
In a secured seat and while using an approved safety belt.
options.explanation: Do not allow a person to ride in the back of a pickup or other truck unless the vehicle is equipped with seats and the person uses both the seat and a safety belt.

dmv_test_1.question: Which of these statements is true about drugs and driving?

options.text: Any prescription drug is safe to use if you don't feel drowsy.
Even over-the-counter drugs can impair your driving.
options.explanation: Legal prescription and over-the-counter drugs can impair your ability to drive, including drugs taken for colds, hay fever, allergies, or to calm nerves or muscles. It is illegal to drive while under the influence of any drug that impairs your ability to drive safely; this law does not differentiate between illegal, prescription, or over-the-counter drugs.

options.text: Only illegal drugs can impair your driving.

dmv_test_1.question: When you are behind a motorcycle, you should:

options.text: Be ready to use your horn.
Drive more slowly.
Allow a larger following distance.
options.explanation: When following a motorcyclist, allow for at least a three- to four-second following distance. Motorcycles can stop quickly and following them too closely endangers your life and that of the motorcyclist. If the motorcyclist should fall, you need extra distance to avoid the rider. The chances of a fall are greatest on wet and icy roads, gravel roads, and metal surfaces such as bridges, gratings, and streetcar or railroad tracks.

dmv_test_1.question: When driving at night on a dimly lit street, you should:

options.text: Drive slowly enough that you can stop within the area illuminated by your headlights.
options.explanation: You should drive more slowly at night than during the day because it is not possible to see as far ahead at night. You should make sure that you can stop within the area illuminated by your headlights.

options.text: Turn on your high beam headlights to better see the vehicles ahead of you.
Keep the instrument panel lights bright to be more visible to other drivers.

dmv_test_1.question: This sign means:

options.text: Pedestrians walking along the road ahead.
Pedestrian crossing ahead.
options.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign alerts drivers to where pedestrians may be crossing. If a pedestrian is crossing in a crosswalk marked with this sign, drivers must stop and remain stopped until the pedestrian is no longer in the crosswalk.

options.text: Pedestrians must not cross here.

dmv_test_1.question: You are approaching a green traffic light and traffic is blocking the intersection. What is the best thing to do?

options.text: Partially enter the intersection to establish your right-of-way.
Don't enter the intersection until you can get completely across.
options.explanation: Even if your light is green, you must not enter an intersection unless you can get completely through the intersection before the light turns red. If you block the intersection, you can be cited.

options.text: Continue into the intersection and wait for traffic to clear.

dmv_test_1.question: When being passed by another vehicle:

options.text: Brake hard.
Maintain a constant speed.
options.explanation: When being passed, you must yield to the passing vehicle and not increase your speed. Allow the vehicle to safely merge back into your lane.

options.text: Speed up.

dmv_test_1.question: There are two traffic lanes moving in your direction. You are driving in the left lane and many vehicles are passing you on the right. If the driver behind you wishes to drive faster, you should:

options.text: Stay in your lane so you don't impede the flow of traffic.
Drive onto the left shoulder to let the other vehicles pass.
Move into the right lane when it is safe.
options.explanation: To drive quickly, pass, or turn left, use the left lane. Use the right lane when driving more slowly than surrounding traffic, entering the road, or turning right.

dmv_test_1.question: This sign means:

options.text: Yield the right-of-way.
options.explanation: A triangular red and white sign indicates that you must yield the right-of-way.

options.text: No passing zone.
Reduction in lanes.

dmv_test_1.question: Yellow lines separate:

options.text: Traffic lanes on one-way streets.
Traffic moving in opposite directions on two-way roads.
options.explanation: Yellow lines mark the center of a road used for two-way traffic. A solid yellow centerline indicates that drivers may not cross the line to pass. A broken yellow centerline indicates that drivers may cross the line to pass, but only if passing would not interfere with traffic.

options.text: All carpool lanes from regular traffic lanes.

dmv_test_1.question: From top to bottom, the following is the proper order for traffic lights:

options.text: Red, yellow, green.
options.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. This sign warns drivers about the presence of traffic signals at an intersection ahead.

options.text: Red, green, yellow.
Green, red, yellow.

dmv_test_1.question: This sign means:

options.text: Side road.
options.explanation: This sign indicates that there is an intersection with a side road ahead.

options.text: Merge.
Yield the right-of-way.

dmv_test_1.question: The driver ahead of you stops at a crosswalk. What should you do?

options.text: Cautiously pass the vehicle at 10 mph or slower.
Stop, proceeding only when all the pedestrians have crossed.
options.explanation: You must not pass a vehicle that is stopped at a crosswalk. There may be pedestrians crossing the street that you cannot see. Instead, stop, proceeding only after all pedestrians have crossed.

options.text: Change lanes, look carefully, and pass the stopped vehicle.

dmv_test_1.question: If you are about to be hit from the rear, you should not:

options.text: Release your seat belt.
options.explanation: If your vehicle is hit from the rear while you are in forward motion, your body will be thrown backward. Brace yourself by pressing against the back of your seat and putting your head against the head restraint to prevent whiplash. Maintain a firm grip on the steering wheel and be ready to apply your brakes to avoid being pushed into another vehicle.

options.text: Brace yourself.
Press your head against the head restraint.

dmv_test_1.question: Drivers must use their seat belt:

options.text: Unless they are driving a vehicle built before 1978.
Unless they are driving a limousine.
And failure to do so will result in a traffic ticket.
options.explanation: Drivers must always wear seat belts and may be cited for failure to do so.

dmv_test_1.question: If you park facing uphill on a street with a curb, set the parking brake and:

options.text: Turn the front wheels toward the curb.
Turn the front wheels away from the curb.
options.explanation: When parking uphill on a road that has a curb, your wheels should be turned away from the curb. When parking uphill on a street without a curb or when parking downhill, your wheels should be turned toward the curb or edge of the road.

options.text: Leave the front wheels straight.

dmv_test_2.question: Which child would require a child passenger restraint system?

options.text: A 9-year-old who is 4 feet 10 inches tall
A 10-year-old who is 5 feet 3 inches tall
A 7-year-old who is 4 feet 8 inches tall
options.explanation: Children who are eight years old or older, or who have reached at least 4 feet 9 inches in height, may use a properly secured safety belt meeting federal standards. Other children must be seated in a child passenger restraint system.

dmv_test_2.question: When you tailgate other drivers (drive closely to their rear bumper):

options.text: You can frustrate the other drivers and make them angry.
options.explanation: Most rear-end collisions are caused by tailgating. To avoid tailgating, use the “Three Second Rule.” When the vehicle ahead of you passes a certain point, such as a sign, count “one-thousand-one, one-thousand-two, one-thousand-three.” If you pass the same point before you finish counting, you are following too closely.

options.text: Your actions cannot result in a traffic citation.
You help reduce traffic congestion.

dmv_test_2.question: If your cell phone rings while you are driving and you do not have a hands-free device, you should:

options.text: Answer the call because it may be an emergency.
Let the call go to voicemail.
options.explanation: Drivers should not use a cell phone without a hands-free device. For minors, it is illegal to use any cell phone while driving, except in an emergency. Even if you do have a hands-free device, it is recommended that you let calls go to voicemail while driving in order to avoid distractions.

options.text: Check the incoming number before answering the call.

dmv_test_2.question: Should you always drive more slowly than other traffic?

options.text: No, you can block traffic when you drive too slowly.
options.explanation: You must drive more slowly than usual when there is heavy traffic or bad weather. However, if you block the normal and reasonable movement of traffic by driving too slowly, you may be cited.

options.text: Yes, it is a good defensive driving technique.
Yes, it is always safer than driving faster than other traffic.

dmv_test_2.question: If you must park your vehicle in an area not usually used for parking:

options.text: Park with your reverse lights on.
Make sure your vehicle is visible to drivers approaching from any direction.
options.explanation: Drivers are responsible for making sure their vehicles do not become hazards after they have been parked. Wherever you park, make sure your car is visible to drivers approaching from any direction.

options.text: Park five feet from the curb.

dmv_test_2.question: This sign means:

options.text: Do not enter.
Stop ahead.
Roadwork or maintenance is present.
options.explanation: Orange, diamond-shaped signs are used to mark construction, maintenance, survey, and utility work areas. These signs help direct drivers and pedestrians safely through dangerous zones. Fines for traffic convictions may double in areas marked by these signs.

dmv_test_2.question: This road sign means:

options.text: Intersection ahead.
Steep grade ahead.
options.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign indicates that there is a steep hill ahead. Slow down and be ready to shift to a lower gear to control your speed and protect your brakes from damage.

options.text: Winding road.

dmv_test_2.question: When a school bus is stopped on the road ahead to load or unload children, you must:

options.text: Come to a complete stop until all the children have left the bus.
Come to a complete stop until the red lights stop flashing and the stop arm is withdrawn.
options.explanation: When a school bus is stopped on the road ahead with its lights flashing and its stop arm extended, you must come to a complete stop and wait to proceed until the lights have stopped flashing and the stop arm is withdrawn. Even after the bus begins to move again, do not proceed until you are sure there are no children crossing the road ahead of you.

options.text: Change lanes, drive slowly, and pass the bus cautiously.

dmv_test_2.question: This sign means:

options.text: No left turn can be made here.
options.explanation: Signs with a red circle and diagonal line over a black symbol indicate that the action represented by the symbol is prohibited. In this case, the sign indicates that left turns are prohibited.

options.text: A left turn can be made only after stopping.
All traffic must turn right at the next intersection.

dmv_test_2.question: You must notify the DMV within five days if you:

options.text: Sell or transfer your vehicle.
options.explanation: If you sell or transfer a vehicle, you must report the sale or transfer to the DMV within five days.

options.text: Fail a smog test.
Get a new prescription for lenses or contacts.

dmv_test_2.question: Unless otherwise posted, the speed limit in a residential area is:

options.text: 20 mph.
25 mph.
options.explanation: Unless otherwise posted, the speed limit in business and residential districts is 25 mph.

options.text: 30 mph.

dmv_test_2.question: Which of these statements is true about drinking alcohol and driving?

options.text: If you can walk in a straight line after drinking, it is safe to drive.
If you are under the legal blood alcohol concentration limit, your driving isn't impaired.
Alcohol affects judgement, which is needed to drive safely.
options.explanation: Being under the influence of alcohol affects your judgment. Good judgement is necessary to react appropriately to things that you see or hear while on the road. Even if you are below the legal blood alcohol limit, consuming any amount of alcohol is likely to affect your ability to drive safely.

dmv_test_2.question: Vehicles stopped behind a school bus with its red lights flashing must remain stopped until:

options.text: All students are off the bus.
The stop arm is retracted.
The stop arm is retracted and the bus resumes motion.
options.explanation: When a school bus is flashing its red lights and has its stop arm extended, motorists must come to a full stop until the lights are turned off, the stop arm is withdrawn, and the bus begins moving again.

dmv_test_2.question: You are driving in the far right lane of a four-lane freeway and notice thick broken white lines on the left side of your lane. You are driving in:

options.text: The carpool lane and must merge into the next lane.
A special lane for slow-moving vehicles.
An exit lane.
options.explanation: Freeway lanes that are ending will usually be marked by large broken lines painted on the pavement. If you are driving in a lane marked with these broken lines, be prepared to exit the freeway or for the lane to end.

dmv_test_2.question: You see a flashing yellow traffic signal at an upcoming intersection. The flashing yellow light means:

options.text: Stop before entering the intersection, as long as you can do so safely.
Stop. Yield to all cross traffic before crossing the intersection.
Slow down and cross the intersection carefully.
options.explanation: A flashing yellow traffic signal light warns you to proceed with caution. Slow down and be alert before entering the intersection. Yield to any pedestrians, bicyclists, or vehicles in the intersection.

dmv_test_2.question: If you drive more slowly than the flow of traffic, you will most likely:

options.text: Interfere with traffic and receive a ticket.
options.explanation: You must drive more slowly than usual when there is heavy traffic or bad weather. However, if you block the normal and reasonable movement of traffic by driving too slowly, you may be cited. You should match the speed of traffic, unless the speed of traffic exceeds the legal speed limit.

options.text: Improve traffic flow.
Demonstrate defensive driving techniques.

dmv_test_2.question: This yellow sign means:

options.text: Controlled railroad ahead.
Be prepared to stop if the light is flashing.
There is a traffic signal ahead.
options.explanation: A yellow sign with a traffic signal pictured indicates that there is a traffic signal is ahead. Be prepared to respond to the upcoming traffic signal.

dmv_test_2.question: You may drive a motor vehicle in a bike lane:

options.text: If you drive more slowly than 15 mph.
No more than 200 feet before making a right turn.
options.explanation: If making a right turn, you may enter the bicycle lane no more than 200 feet before the corner or driveway. Drivers of motor vehicles should not enter a bicycle lane at any other time.

options.text: Whenever bicyclists are not present.

dmv_test_2.question: Give the right-of-way to any pedestrian who is:

options.text: In a marked crosswalk.
In any crosswalk or intersection.
Crossing any street.
options.explanation: Drivers must yield the right-of-way to pedestrians who are crossing the street in any marked or unmarked crosswalk. In the interest of safety, drivers should yield the right-of-way to people crossing any street.

dmv_test_2.question: California's "Basic Speed Law" says you must:

options.text: Keep your speed close to that of other traffic.
Never drive faster than is safe for current conditions.
options.explanation: The "Basic Speed Law" states that you may never drive faster than is safe for current conditions. For example, if you drive at 45 mph in a 55 mph zone during a dense fog, even though you are below the posted limit, you may be cited for driving "too fast for conditions."

options.text: Always drive at the posted speed limit.

dmv_test_2.question: You should allow an extra cushion of space:

options.text: When following a station wagon.
When following a driver who cannot see the rear of their vehicle.
options.explanation: Drivers of trucks, buses, vans, or any vehicles pulling campers or trailers may not be able to see you if you are driving directly behind them. Increase your following distance when driving behind one of these vehicles. Additionally, large vehicles can block your view of the road, so increase your following distance to look around the sides of the vehicle and see the road ahead.

options.text: When following a small passenger car.

dmv_test_2.question: When driving on a multilane street with two-way traffic:

options.text: Drive alongside other vehicles so the drivers can see you.
You should drive ahead of or behind the other vehicles.
options.explanation: Driving directly alongside another vehicle could create a collision if the other driver crowds your lane or tries to change lanes without looking. To avoid this, you should drive ahead of or behind vehicles in other lanes rather than alongside them.

options.text: It is safest to drive in the lane next to the centerline.

dmv_test_2.question: This road sign means:

options.text: Intersection ahead.
Merging traffic.
Steep hill ahead.
options.explanation: Warning signs provide notice to road users of a situation that might not be readily apparent and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns drivers of an upcoming steep hill. Drivers should adjust their speed accordingly to avoid collisions and brake damage.

dmv_test_2.question: Never make a U-turn:

options.text: in residential districts.
at or on a railroad crossing.
options.explanation: Never make a U-turn where a No U-turn sign is posted, at or on a railroad crossing, on a divided highway by crossing a dividing section, curb, strip of land, or two sets of double yellow lines, when you cannot see clearly for 200 feet in each direction, on a one-way street, in front of a fire station, never use a fire station driveway to turn around, in business districts (the part of a city or town where most offices and businesses are).

options.text: where there isn't a "No U-turn" sign posted.

dmv_test_2.question: Which of these vehicles must always stop before crossing railroad tracks?

options.text: Tank trucks marked with hazardous materials placards.
options.explanation: Trucks transporting hazardous loads must stop before they cross railroad tracks.

options.text: Motor homes or pickup trucks towing a boat trailer.
Any vehicle with three or more axles and weighing more than 4,000 pounds.

dmv_test_2.question: You may cross a double yellow line to pass another vehicle if the yellow line next to:

options.text: The other side of the road is a solid line.
Your side of the road is a broken line.
options.explanation: Double yellow lines in the center of the road indicate that you may pass if a broken line is next to your driving lane.

options.text: The other side of the road is a broken line.

dmv_test_2.question: If you encounter an aggressive driver, you should:

options.text: Challenge them.
Get out of their way.
options.explanation: Drivers must respect and cooperate with all other road users and conform to specific rules in order to maintain order and to avoid crashes. When encountering an aggressive driver, it is safest to just get out of their way. Always avoid competing with other drivers.

options.text: Speed up.

dmv_test_2.question: Water on the road can cause a vehicle to hydroplane. Your car may hydroplane at speeds as low as:

options.text: 45 miles per hour.
35 miles per hour.
options.explanation: Hydroplaning occurs when there is standing water on a roadway. At speeds up to 35 mph, most tires will channel water away from the tire. As your speed increases past 35 mph, tires cannot channel the water as well and your tires may start to lose contact with the road and ride over the water like a set of water skis.

options.text: 40 miles per hour.

dmv_test_2.question: This sign means:

options.text: Do not enter.
options.explanation: This sign is posted on one-way streets and other roadways where a driver is not allowed to enter. A driver may see this sign if attempting to enter an expressway ramp in the wrong direction.

options.text: Yield the right-of-way.
Reserved parking for persons with disabilities.

dmv_test_2.question: This sign means:

options.text: Railroad ahead.
options.explanation: A round yellow sign indicates that there is a railroad crossing ahead.

options.text: No passing zone.
School zone.

dmv_test_2.question: If you are convicted of driving with an excessive blood alcohol concentration (BAC), you may be sentenced to serve:

options.text: Up to six months in jail.
options.explanation: If you are convicted of DUI for the first time and you have an excessive BAC level, you may be sentenced to serve up to six months in jail and may be required to pay a fine between $390 and $1,000. Your vehicle may be impounded and is subject to storage fees.

options.text: Up to 12 months in jail.
No jail time, but you must pay a fine of $500.

dmv_test_2.question: You may not park your vehicle:

options.text: On the side of the freeway in an emergency.
Next to a red painted curb.
options.explanation: No stopping, standing, or parking is permitted next to a red painted curb. However, buses may stop in a red curb zone marked for buses.

options.text: Within 100 feet of an elementary school.

dmv_test_2.question: If you have trouble seeing other vehicles because of dust or smoke blowing across the roadway, you should drive more slowly and turn on your:

options.text: Emergency flashers.
Parking lights.
Headlights.
options.explanation: You must turn on your headlights any time conditions prevent you from seeing other vehicles. Other drivers may have trouble seeing you, too.

dmv_test_2.question: While driving, you should look 10 to 15 seconds ahead of you:

options.text: And focus on the middle of the road.
Because it is a legal requirement.
To see potential hazards early.
options.explanation: To avoid last-minute moves, scan the road 10 to 15 seconds ahead of your vehicle so you can see hazards early. Constantly staring at the road right in front of your vehicle is dangerous.

dmv_test_2.question: This sign means:

options.text: No right turn.
options.explanation: Signs with a red circle and diagonal line over a black symbol indicate the the action represented by the symbol is prohibited. In this case, the sign indicates that right turns are prohibited.

options.text: Right turn on red light permitted with caution.
All traffic must turn right at next intersection.

dmv_test_2.question: To see vehicles in your blind spots, you should check:

options.text: The inside rearview mirror.
The outside rearview mirror.
Over your shoulders.
options.explanation: By definition, blind spots are areas that cannot be seen using your mirrors. To check your blind spots, you should look over your shoulders.

dmv_test_3.question: Which of these statements is true about driving and taking medications?

options.text: Most cold medications can make a person drowsy.
options.explanation: Remember that all medications, prescription or over-the-counter, are potentially dangerous and could impair your driving. Over-the-counter medicines that you take for colds and allergies can make you drowsy and affect your driving ability. It is your responsibility to know how your medication affects your ability to drive.

options.text: Over-the-counter medications cannot impair driving ability if taken in the recommended dosages.
Medications are safe to take at any time, if prescribed by a doctor.

dmv_test_3.question: As you approach an intersection with a flashing yellow light:

options.text: Stop before crossing the intersection.
Slow down and proceed with caution.
options.explanation: A flashing yellow light means that you should slow down, check for cross traffic, and proceed with caution.

options.text: Wait for a green light before proceeding.

dmv_test_3.question: You may pass a vehicle when:

options.text: You are on a hill or curve.
You are on a road with a solid line next to your lane.
You are on a road with a broken line next to your lane.
options.explanation: A single broken line indicates that drivers may cross from either lane to change lanes. Dashed yellow lines alongside solid yellow lines indicate that passing is permitted from the lane next to the broken line, but not from the lane next to the solid line. Only change lanes when it is safe to do so.

dmv_test_3.question: When using a roundabout, drivers should:

options.text: Stop in the middle of the roundabout.
Yield to traffic already in the roundabout.
options.explanation: A roundabout is a circular intersection that usually does not include a traffic signal and flows in a counterclockwise direction around a central island. Motorists must enter from the right, yielding to traffic already in the roundabout, and follow the circle to the right until the desired roadway is reached.

options.text: Yield to entering traffic.

dmv_test_3.question: If your vehicle starts to lose traction because of water on the road, you should:

options.text: Drive at a constant speed to gain better traction.
Apply the brakes firmly to prevent your vehicle from sliding.
Slow down gradually and not apply the brakes.
options.explanation: When driving in heavy rain at speeds as low as 30 mph, your tires may lose all contact with the road and instead ride up on a layer of water above the surface of the road. This is called "hydroplaning." If your vehicle starts to hydroplane, slow down gradually and do not apply the brakes.

dmv_test_3.question: This sign shows one type of:

options.text: Right turn.
Intersection.
options.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns that your current road ends at an intersection straight ahead. Slow down and prepare to yield or stop before turning right or left.

options.text: Lane change.

dmv_test_3.question: You want to park uphill on a two-way road and there is no curb. Which direction do you turn your front wheels?

options.text: Straight ahead
Right, toward the side of the road
options.explanation: When parking either uphill or downhill on a road that has no curb, you should turn your wheels so that the vehicle will roll away from the center of the road if the brakes fail.

options.text: Left, toward the center of the road

dmv_test_3.question: What is the difference between traffic lights with red arrows and those with solid red lights?

options.text: Red arrows are only used to stop traffic which is turning.
Red arrows are only used for protected turn lanes.
You cannot turn on a red arrow, even if you stop first.
options.explanation: You may sometimes turn right when stopped by a solid red light. You may never turn left or right when stopped by a traffic light with a red arrow.

dmv_test_3.question: When entering the interstate, check for a gap in traffic in the nearest lane, adjust your speed to match traffic, signal, and:

options.text: Expect traffic to allow you to proceed into the lane, since you have the right-of-way.
Merge carefully into the gap.
options.explanation: Before merging into interstate traffic, you should identify a gap, accelerate to the speed of traffic, and signal. Merge into the gap when it is safe to do so. Be alert to other traffic and do not expect other drivers to clear the lane.

options.text: Wait for the lane to clear before merging.

dmv_test_3.question: This sign means:

options.text: No right turn.
options.explanation: This sign indicates that turns in the direction of the arrow (in this case, to the right) are prohibited.

options.text: Stop sign ahead.
Divided highway.

dmv_test_3.question: It is illegal to park your vehicle:

options.text: In an unmarked crosswalk.
options.explanation: It is illegal to park your car on a marked or unmarked crosswalk. You may park in a bicycle lane if there is not a "No parking" sign posted and your vehicle does not block a bicyclist.

options.text: Within three feet of a private driveway.
In a bicycle lane.

dmv_test_3.question: Extra space in front of a large truck is needed for:

options.text: Other drivers to merge onto the freeway.
The truck driver to stop the vehicle.
options.explanation: Because they are larger, trucks take longer to stop than cars traveling at the same speed. Other drivers should not pull in front of a truck and then slow down or stop.

options.text: Other drivers when they want to slow down.

dmv_test_3.question: On a multilane road, a dashed yellow line next to a solid yellow line means:

options.text: Passing is prohibited from both directions.
Passing is permitted from both directions.
Passing is permitted only from the direction next to the dashed line.
options.explanation: Where there are both solid and dashed yellow lines between lanes of traffic, only traffic directly next to the dashed line may cross the centerline to pass. Drivers next to the solid line may not pass.

dmv_test_3.question: Tailgating other drivers (driving too closely to their rear bumper):

options.text: Can frustrate other drivers and make them angry.
options.explanation: Tailgating is a common behavior that can lead to aggressive driving, and so it should be avoided. Drivers may face legal consequences for driving unsafely.

options.text: Cannot result in a traffic citation.
Reduces collisions by preventing being "cut off."

dmv_test_3.question: If you are continually being passed on the right and the left while driving in the center lane of an expressway, you should:

options.text: Stay in the center lane.
Move to the lane on your right.
options.explanation: If a road has four or more lanes with two-way traffic, drive in the right lanes unless you are passing or turning left. If you are on an interstate highway and are driving below the speed of the flow of traffic, use the right lane.

options.text: Move to the lane on your left.

dmv_test_3.question: Sudden wind gusts on highways:

options.text: Generally affect only the movement of large vehicles.
Only cause visibility problems.
Can cause problems for all vehicles.
options.explanation: While it can create special problems for large vehicles, strong wind can cause problems for all drivers. Wind can lower visibility by blowing dirt and dust into the roadway, but it can sometimes also physically move a vehicle.

dmv_test_3.question: When passing another vehicle, you should return to your original lane when:

options.text: You can see both headlights of the passed vehicle in your rearview mirror.
options.explanation: When passing another vehicle, move back into your original lane only when you can see the passed vehicle’s headlights in your rearview mirror. This ensures that you will have enough room to safely pull back in front of the other vehicle.

options.text: You have cleared the front bumper of the passed vehicle.
You are 50 feet in front of the passed vehicle.

dmv_test_3.question: What should you do at an intersection with a flashing yellow signal light?

options.text: Maintain your speed but watch for other vehicles.
Stop before crossing the intersection.
Slow down and cross the intersection carefully.
options.explanation: Slow down and be alert before entering the intersection. Yield to any pedestrians, bicyclists, or vehicles in the intersection. You do not need to stop for a flashing yellow traffic signal light.

dmv_test_3.question: When parking your vehicle on any hill:

options.text: One of your rear wheels should touch the curb.
Use your parking brake and leave the vehicle in "park."
options.explanation: When parking on a hill, you should always leave your vehicle in gear or in the "park" position. If there is no curb, you should turn your front wheels so that the vehicle will roll away from the center of the road if the brakes fail. If there is a curb, the front wheels should be turned toward it (if headed downhill) or away from and gently touching it (if headed uphill).

options.text: Your front wheels should be parallel to the road, if there is no curb.

dmv_test_3.question: It is more dangerous to drive at night than during the day because:

options.text: You cannot see as far ahead at night.
options.explanation: With decreased visibility and the glare of oncoming headlights, you cannot see as far ahead at night as you can during the day. Always use headlights and exercise caution when driving in the dark.

options.text: The road is always more slippery at night.
Your reaction time is slower at night.

dmv_test_3.question: At dawn or dusk and in rain or snow, it can be hard to see and be seen. A good way to let other drivers know you are there is to turn:

options.text: Up the instrumental panel lights.
On your parking lights.
On your headlights.
options.explanation: You must use your headlights at any time when conditions prevent you from seeing other vehicles and when it may be difficult for other drivers to see you. Always use your low beam headlights if weather conditions require you to use your windshield wipers.

dmv_test_3.question: Large trucks turning onto a street with two lanes in each direction:

options.text: May complete the turn in either of the two lanes.
Often have to use the left lane to complete the turn.
options.explanation: Large trucks must often swing wide to complete a right turn. A truck making a right turn may initially appear to be turning left because of the need to swing wide. When behind a turning truck, you should pay attention to the truck's turn signal to be aware of which way the trucker actually intends to turn.

options.text: Must stay in the right lane at all times while turning.

dmv_test_3.question: You should not start across an intersection if you know you will block the intersection when the light turns red:

options.text: Under any circumstances.
options.explanation: Even if the signal is green, you must not enter an intersection unless you can get completely across before the light turns red. If you block the intersection, you can be cited.

options.text: Unless you entered the intersection on a yellow light.
Unless you entered the intersection on a green light.

dmv_test_3.question: When turning left at an intersection:

options.text: You should always yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.
options.explanation: When turning left at an intersection, yield the right-of-way to oncoming traffic and pedestrians. Once the intersection is clear and applicable signals allow, you may complete the turn.

options.text: Oncoming traffic and pedestrians should yield to you.
You should never yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.

dmv_test_3.question: This sign shows one type of:

options.text: Intersection.
options.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. This sign warns drivers that another road crosses the highway ahead.

options.text: Road curve.
Right turn.

dmv_test_3.question: This road sign means:

options.text: Cars in the right lane must slow down.
No left turn.
Merge.
options.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign indicates that there could be traffic merging from the right, so drivers should prepare to allow traffic to safely merge.

dmv_test_3.question: If you are being followed too closely on a two-lane road:

options.text: Reduce your speed slowly to encourage the tailgater to drive around you.
options.explanation: If you are being followed too closely by another driver, merge into a different lane. If there is no lane available for merging, wait until the road ahead is clear and slowly reduce your speed. This will encourage the tailgater to drive around you.

options.text: Speed up to increase the distance between you and the other car.
Apply your brakes to slow down, then resume your original speed.

dmv_test_3.question: A flashing yellow traffic signal at an intersection means:

options.text: You should treat the signal like a stop sign.
Stop. Yield to all cross traffic before crossing in the intersection.
Slow down and be alert at the upcoming intersection.
options.explanation: A flashing yellow signal means "proceed with caution." You should slow down and be alert before entering the upcoming intersection and must yield to any pedestrians, bicycles, or vehicles in the intersection; however, you do not have to stop.

dmv_test_3.question: Which lane must you be in before making a left turn from a one-way street?

options.text: The lane nearest the left curb.
options.explanation: When making any turn, turn from the lane closest to the direction you wish to travel into the first available legal lane. If you are making a left turn from a one-way street, this means that you would make the turn from the lane nearest to the left curb.

options.text: The lane nearest the center of the street.
The lane nearest the right curb.

dmv_test_3.question: Stopping distances and the severity of collisions:

options.text: Decrease as a vehicle's speed increases.
Are not affected by a vehicle's speed.
Increase as a vehicle's speed increases.
options.explanation: Excessive vehicle speed can have disastrous effects. As a vehicle's speed increases, the potential impact of a collision also increases, elevating the possibility of serious injury and death. Increase your following distance as your speed increases to ensure that you will be able to stop safely if needed.

dmv_test_3.question: Blocking an intersection during "rush hour" traffic is not permitted:

options.text: Unless you entered the intersection on a green light.
Under any circumstances, even if your light is green.
options.explanation: Even if your light is green, you should not enter an intersection unless you can get completely across before the light turns red. You can be cited if you block the intersection.

options.text: Unless you have the right-of-way or a green light.

dmv_test_3.question: On a freeway, you should look farther ahead than you would on a city street:

options.text: In order to see potential hazards early.
options.explanation: On the freeway, be ready for changes in traffic conditions. Watch for signals from other drivers. Expect merging vehicles at on-ramps and interchanges and be prepared for rapid changes in road conditions and traffic flow.

options.text: Because it takes a quarter of a mile to stop your vehicle completely.
Because it helps you keep up with traffic.

dmv_test_3.question: At an uncontrolled intersection where you cannot see cross traffic until you are just about to enter the intersection, the speed limit is:

options.text: 15 mph.
options.explanation: The speed limit for a blind intersection is 15 mph. An intersection is considered “blind” if there are no stop signs on any corner and you cannot see for 100 feet in either direction during the last 100 feet before crossing.

options.text: 25 mph.
20 mph.

dmv_test_3.question: If you come to an intersection controlled by a flashing yellow light, you must:

options.text: Wait for the green light before proceeding.
Slow down and cross the intersection carefully.
options.explanation: A flashing yellow traffic light means drivers must slow down, be more aware, and proceed with caution. Be alert to crossing traffic and pedestrians.

options.text: Stop before crossing the intersection.

dmv_test_3.question: You are on the freeway and traffic is merging into your lane. You should:

options.text: Make room for the merging traffic, if possible.
options.explanation: When traffic permits, you should make room to allow vehicles to merge into your lane.

options.text: Assert your right-of-way by driving faster.
Always maintain your position.

dmv_test_3.question: The speed limit in any alley is:

options.text: 20 mph.
15 mph.
options.explanation: The speed limit in any alley is 15 mph. This is always the speed limit, whether or not it is posted.

options.text: 25 mph.

dmv_test_4.question: Excessive speed:

options.text: Does not increase the chance of a crash.
Increases your ability to react to a hazard.
Often leads to high-risk decision-making.
options.explanation: Excessive speed is one of the most common contributing factors to vehicle crashes. Excessive speed does not save time and often leads to high-risk decision-making.

dmv_test_4.question: Alcohol is:

options.text: A stimulant.
An antihistamine.
A depressant.
options.explanation: Alcohol is a depressant that dulls your judgment and makes your reflexes unreliable.

dmv_test_4.question: You can drive off the road to pass another vehicle:

options.text: If the vehicle ahead is turning left.
If there are two or more lanes traveling in your direction.
Under no circumstances.
options.explanation: You may never drive off the paved or main-traveled portion of the road and onto the shoulder to pass another vehicle.

dmv_test_4.question: Using a cell phone while operating a motor vehicle is considered a distraction because:

options.text: It causes the driver to be concerned about the cost of the call.
It occupies the driver's hands, eyes, and mind.
options.explanation: Using a cell phone while driving is dangerous because it occupies the user's eyes, hands, and mind. Even the most skilled drivers increase their risk of being involved in a crash by using a cell phone on the road.

options.text: It is an activity that draws the attention of other drivers.

dmv_test_4.question: Before you change lanes, you should check your mirrors and:

options.text: Never look over your right shoulder.
Always slow down in your traffic lane.
Glance over your shoulder.
options.explanation: Before changing lanes, it is very important to check behind you. You should look over your shoulder to ensure that you are not getting in the way of vehicles in the lane you want to enter. Before changing lanes, you should also ensure that no drivers are attempting to drive into the same spot from a different lane.

dmv_test_4.question: Dim your headlights for oncoming vehicles or when you are within 300 feet of a vehicle:

options.text: That you are approaching from behind.
options.explanation: You are required to dim your headlights to low beams within 500 feet of a vehicle that is coming toward you and within 300 feet of a vehicle that you are following.

options.text: Approaching you from behind.
That you have already passed.

dmv_test_4.question: You are driving on the freeway behind a large truck. You should drive:

options.text: Closer behind the truck than you would if following a passenger vehicle.
Farther behind the truck than you would if following a passenger vehicle.
options.explanation: It is necessary to follow farther behind a large truck than you would if following a passenger vehicle because trucks have larger blind spots.

options.text: To the right side of the truck and wait to pass.

dmv_test_4.question: Increase your following distance when driving behind a large vehicle:

options.text: To better see around the sides of the vehicle.
options.explanation: Drivers of trucks, buses, vans, and any vehicles pulling campers or trailers may not be able to see you if you are driving directly behind them. Increase your following distance when driving behind one of these vehicles. Additionally, large vehicles can block your view of the road, so increase your following distance to look around the sides of the vehicle and see the road ahead.

options.text: Because other drivers tend to pull behind large vehicles before trying to pass them.
Because following too closely will get you caught in the vehicle's slipstream.

dmv_test_4.question: This white sign means:

options.text: The railroad crossing is controlled. Continue at your regular speed.
Look, listen, and prepare to stop at the crossing if necessary.
options.explanation: When approaching a railroad crossing, you must look, listen, slow down, and prepare to stop. Let any trains pass before you proceed.

options.text: Stop at the railroad tracks and wait for a signal before crossing.

dmv_test_4.question: Smoking inside a vehicle with a person younger than 18 years of age is:

options.text: Legal, if it is your child.
Illegal at all times.
options.explanation: In California, it is illegal to smoke in a vehicle at any time when a minor is present.

options.text: Not restricted by law.

dmv_test_4.question: A distraction when driving is:

options.text: Anything that causes evasive action while driving.
Anything that takes your attention away from driving.
options.explanation: A distraction when driving is anything that takes your attention away from driving. Driver distractions may occur anytime and anywhere. Distracted driving can cause collisions, resulting in property damage, injury, and death.

options.text: Anything that causes you to pay more attention to driving.

dmv_test_4.question: You must notify the DMV within five days if you:

options.text: Are cited for a traffic violation.
Sell or transfer your vehicle.
options.explanation: You are required by law to contact the DMV within five calendar days from the date you sell or transfer the title of a vehicle to another owner. They must be notified of every title transfer.

options.text: Paint your vehicle a different color.

dmv_test_4.question: Adjust your rearview and side mirrors:

options.text: Before you start driving.
options.explanation: Your safety and the safety of other drivers and pedestrians depends a lot on what you do before driving. Before moving your vehicle, you should adjust your seat, adjust your mirrors, fasten your safety belt, and secure items in and on your vehicle. Do not wait until your vehicle is moving to adjust your mirrors.

options.text: Whenever you need to use them.
Before you get into the car.

dmv_test_4.question: Night driving presents unique problems because:

options.text: The speed limit is increased at night.
There are fewer cars on the roads at night.
Distance and vehicle speed are difficult to judge in the dark.
options.explanation: Night driving creates a unique set of problems for drivers. Due to the reduced visibility, it can be difficult to judge distance and the traveling speeds of other vehicles when driving at night. Drivers can see only as far as their headlights allow.

dmv_test_4.question: Which of the following driving skills is/are affected by the use of alcohol and/or drugs?

options.text: Alertness.
Coordination.
Both of the above.
options.explanation: Alcohol and other drugs can negatively effect a number of skills needed for safe driving, including a driver's reaction time, coordination, alertness, and ability to concentrate.

dmv_test_4.question: If you miss your exit on the freeway, you should not:

options.text: Continue on the freeway and find an alternate route to your destination.
Proceed to the next exit, leave the freeway, and return to your proper exit.
Back up on the road or shoulder.
options.explanation: If you miss your turn or exit, do not back up in the travel lane or on the shoulder. Continue to drive to the next exit or crossroad. Drivers do not expect a vehicle to be backing toward them on the roadway and doing so will likely cause a collision.

dmv_test_4.question: A pedestrian starts to cross the street after the "Don't Walk" signal begins to flash. The pedestrian is in the middle of the street when your signal light changes to green. You should:

options.text: Proceed if you have the right-of-way.
Proceed if the pedestrian is not in your lane.
Wait until the pedestrian crosses the street before proceeding.
options.explanation: At a green light, you must give the right-of-way to any vehicle, bicyclist, or pedestrian in the intersection. If a pedestrian begins crossing the street after the traffic signal light starts flashing, wait until they have crossed the street before proceeding.

dmv_test_4.question: What is an important step in turning?

options.text: Check traffic in all directions.
options.explanation: When turning, you should look to the rear and both sides of your vehicle to ensure it is safe to proceed before making the turn. Adjust your speed to safely complete the turn.

options.text: Increase your speed.
Always move to the left lane.

dmv_test_4.question: When changing lanes on a freeway, you should:

options.text: Signal for at least five seconds.
options.explanation: Signal at least five seconds prior to a changing lanes on a freeway. Always signal when turning left or right, changing lanes, slowing down, or stopping to let other drivers, motorcyclists, bicyclists, and pedestrians know your intentions.

options.text: Slow down before you start to change lanes.
Assume there is enough space in the next lane for your vehicle, if you signal first.

dmv_test_4.question: If a child is riding a bicycle near your vehicle:

options.text: Beep your horn.
Expect the child to be in total control of the bicycle.
Expect the unexpected.
options.explanation: Children on bicycles are sometimes unpredictable. Young bicyclists are especially likely to make surprising changes in direction. Remember that children and bicycles are both small in stature and may become difficult to see.

dmv_test_4.question: If you are driving on a highway next to a single broken white line marking:

options.text: You cannot cross the line to pass.
You may cross the line to pass and change lanes.
options.explanation: White lines separate lanes of traffic moving in the same direction. You may cross a dashed white line to pass or change lanes if it is safe to do so.

options.text: You may only cross the line to change lanes if you are in the left lane.

dmv_test_4.question: Always carefully look for motorcycles before you change lanes because:

options.text: Their small size can make them hard to see.
options.explanation: You should check carefully for motorcycles when changing lanes because their small size makes it easy for them to disappear into your blind spots.

options.text: They usually have the right-of-way at intersections.
It is illegal for motorcycles to share traffic lanes.

dmv_test_4.question: The safest precaution that you can take when using cellular phones while driving is:

options.text: To use hands-free devices so you can keep both hands on the steering wheel.
options.explanation: Minors may not use a cellular phone while driving, except for certain emergencies. Cell phones are allowed to be used by drivers over age 18, but a hands-free device should be used.

options.text: To keep your phone within easy reach so you won't need to take your eyes off the road.
To review the number before answering a call.

dmv_test_4.question: You are approaching an intersection where a traffic signal is displaying a steady yellow light. If you have not already entered the intersection, you should:

options.text: Speed up to beat the red light.
Reduce you speed and proceed carefully through the intersection.
Come to a safe stop.
options.explanation: At an intersection controlled by a steady yellow light, you should bring your vehicle to a safe stop. If you are already within the intersection when the light changes from green to yellow, continue through the intersection at a safe speed.

dmv_test_4.question: If oncoming headlights are blinding you while you are driving at night, you should:

options.text: Look toward the right edge of the road.
options.explanation: If the headlights of an oncoming vehicle are blinding, glance toward the right edge of the road instead of looking directly ahead. This should keep your vehicle safely on the road until you pass the oncoming vehicle.

options.text: Switch your lights to high beams.
Turn your lights on and off.

dmv_test_4.question: A pentagon-shaped sign is a:

options.text: Stop sign.
Regulatory sign.
School zone or school crossing sign.
options.explanation: A five-sided sign is used to alert drivers to a school zone. Some pentagonal signs specifically indicate crosswalks within school zones where children or other pedestrians may be present.

dmv_test_4.question: A broken yellow line between two lanes of traffic means:

options.text: Both lanes of traffic are going in the same direction.
Passing is permitted when it's safe.
options.explanation: Dashed yellow lines separate single lanes of traffic moving in opposite directions. Passing is allowed when there is no oncoming traffic in the passing lane.

options.text: Passing is not permitted.

dmv_test_4.question: You are driving on the freeway. The vehicle in front of you is a large truck. You should drive:

options.text: Closely behind the truck in bad weather because the driver can see farther ahead than you can.
Farther behind the truck than you would when following a passenger vehicle.
options.explanation: When you follow so closely behind a truck that you cannot see the truck driver’s side view mirrors, the trucker cannot see you and has no way of knowing you are there. Tailgating a truck, or any vehicle, is dangerous because you take away your own cushion of safety if the vehicle in front of you stops quickly.

options.text: No more than one car length behind the truck so the driver can see you.

dmv_test_4.question: When parking next to a curb, you should use your turn signals:

options.text: Only when pulling away from the curb.
When pulling next to, but not away from, the curb.
When pulling next to or away from the curb.
options.explanation: Drivers should signal when pulling next to a curb or away from a curb.

dmv_test_4.question: A blood alcohol concentration of 0.02 percent:

options.text: Won't have any effect on your driving.
Won't put other drivers at risk.
Will double your chances of having an accident.
options.explanation: Every 0.02 percent increase in blood alcohol concentration nearly doubles a driver's risk of being in a fatal crash.

dmv_test_4.question: When you want to change lanes, you should never:

options.text: Move into another lane while within an intersection.
options.explanation: You should never change lanes within an intersection. Before changing lanes, always look over your shoulder to check your blind spot. Be alert to other drivers moving into the same lane.

options.text: Check your blind spot by looking over your shoulder.
Check for other drivers moving into the same lane.

dmv_test_4.question: It is very foggy. You should slow down and:

options.text: Turn on your emergency flashers.
Turn your lights to their high beam setting.
Turn your lights to their low beam setting.
options.explanation: Use your low beams when driving in fog, snow, rain, or mist. Light from high beams will reflect off of precipitation, causing a glare and making it even more difficult to see. Some vehicles are equipped with fog lights that should be used in addition to low beam headlights.

dmv_test_4.question: After passing a vehicle, it is safe to return to your driving lane when:

options.text: The driver you passed signals for you to return to your lane.
You signal your intention for three seconds.
You see the headlights of the passed vehicle in your rearview mirror.
options.explanation: Before you return to your driving lane, be sure you are not dangerously close to the vehicle you have just passed. One way to do this is to look for the vehicle in your inside rearview mirror. When you can see both headlights in your rearview mirror, you may have enough room to return to your driving lane.

dmv_test_4.question: You have stopped for a train at a railroad crossing. After the train passes, you should:

options.text: Wait for signal lights to stop flashing.
Look for a second train.
Both of the above.
options.explanation: Even after a train passes, watch out for a second train approaching on any track. Do not proceed until all gates have been lifted and all warning signals have stopped flashing.

dmv_test_4.question: It is illegal to leave a child age ____ or younger alone in a vehicle.

options.text: Eight
Seven
Six
options.explanation: It is never a good idea to leave a child unattended in a car. It is illegal to leave a child who is age six or younger unattended in a vehicle. A child may be left in a car if they are under the supervision of a person age 12 or older.

dmv_test_4.question: If you want to pass a bicyclists riding on the right edge of your lane:

options.text: You must honk your horn before passing the bicyclist.
You must not squeeze past the bicyclist.
options.explanation: When passing a bicyclist, you must allow at least three feet of space between your vehicle and the bicycle whenever possible. You must not squeeze the bicyclist off the road.

options.text: You may not pass the bicyclist for any reason.

dmv_test_5.question: At a red traffic light with a green arrow, you may proceed in the direction of the arrow if:

options.text: You first come to a complete stop.
You wait until the light changes.
You are in the proper lane and the roadway is clear.
options.explanation: If you are in a lane corresponding to a signal displaying a green arrow, you may proceed in the direction of the arrow when the way is clear. This is true whether the arrow is displayed alone or together with another signal.

dmv_test_5.question: The amount of alcohol in the blood is referred to as:

options.text: Implied consent (IC).
Blood alcohol concentration (BAC).
options.explanation: Blood alcohol concentration (BAC) is a measurement of the percentage of alcohol in the blood. The higher the BAC number, the more impaired a person is.

options.text: Rate of alcohol consumption (RAC).

dmv_test_5.question: With a Class C driver license, a person may drive:

options.text: A three-axle vehicle if the Gross Vehicle Weight is less than 6,000 pounds.
options.explanation: A person with a Class C license may drive a three-axle vehicle if it weighs 6,000 pounds or less.

options.text: Any three-axle vehicle, regardless of the weight.
A vehicle pulling two trailers.

dmv_test_5.question: Safely backing your vehicle requires all of the following, except:

options.text: Looking over your right shoulder as you back up.
Checking your vehicle's surroundings.
Tapping your horn before you back up.
options.explanation: Backing up is always dangerous because it is hard to see behind your vehicle. Prior to entering your vehicle, check your surroundings to be aware of any potential hazards. When you are backing out of a parking space, look over your shoulder to maintain awareness of your surroundings.

dmv_test_5.question: For which of the following traffic lights must you always stop your vehicle?

options.text: Solid red lights, flashing red lights, and blacked out traffic signals.
options.explanation: You must stop at a solid or flashing red light, or at a signal light that is blacked out (not working). A solid yellow light means that the signal is about to turn red and you must stop if you can do so safely; otherwise, proceed cautiously. A flashing yellow light means that you should proceed with caution, but you do not need to stop.

options.text: Solid red lights, red arrows, and flashing yellow lights.
Solid red lights, flashing red lights, and yellow lights.

dmv_test_5.question: To turn left from a multilane one-way street onto a one-way street, you should start your turn from:

options.text: Any lane (as long as it is safe).
The lane closest to the left curb.
options.explanation: When turning left from a one-way street onto another one-way street, you should begin the turn from the far left lane.

options.text: The lane in the center of the road.

dmv_test_5.question: This yellow signs means:

options.text: The road ahead has many curves.
There is a sharp curve in the road ahead.
The road ahead may be slippery.
options.explanation: This sign indicates that the road ahead may be slippery when wet.

dmv_test_5.question: This sign means:

options.text: Winding road ahead.
options.explanation: This sign warns of a winding road ahead.

options.text: Do not enter.
Pedestrian crossing.

dmv_test_5.question: You must yield to a pedestrian using a white cane or guide dog:

options.text: Only when the guide dog is leading the person across the street.
At all times.
options.explanation: Pedestrians who use guide dogs or white canes (with or without a red tip) must be given the right-of-way at all times.

options.text: Only if a crossing guard is present.

dmv_test_5.question: Roads are slippery after it first starts to rain. When the road is slippery, you should:

options.text: Avoid making turns and stops while driving at high speeds.
options.explanation: A wet, slippery road does not allow your tires the traction they need, so it is necessary to drive more slowly on a wet road than you would on a dry road. To reduce the risk of skidding, you should avoid fast turns or stops.

options.text: Test your tires' traction while going uphill.
Decrease the distance you look ahead of your vehicle.

dmv_test_5.question: This road sign means:

options.text: Do not enter.
Roundabout ahead.
No U-turns.
options.explanation: Regulatory signs provide notice to road users of traffic laws that must be obeyed. This sign tells drivers that it is prohibited to make a U-turn.

dmv_test_5.question: Always use your seat belt:

options.text: Unless the vehicle was built before 1978.
Unless you are in a limousine.
When the vehicle is equipped with seat belts.
options.explanation: Use of seat belts is required for the driver and all passengers, including children who are over 8 years old or are at least 4 feet 9 inches tall. You must wear seat belts and shoulder harnesses even if the vehicle has airbags. If your vehicle is equipped with separate lap and shoulder belts, you must use both.

dmv_test_5.question: In rainy weather, you should be most careful when turning or stopping:

options.text: After it has been raining all day.
One half hour after it stops raining.
During the first half hour of rain.
options.explanation: You should be extra careful when turning and stopping during the first half hour of rain. At this point, the oil from cars has not yet washed off the pavement and could be forming a slippery mixture with the rain.

dmv_test_5.question: Two sets of solid double yellow lines that are two or more feet apart:

options.text: May be crossed to enter or exit a private driveway.
May not be crossed for any reason.
options.explanation: Two sets of solid double yellow lines spaced two or more feet apart are considered a barrier. You may not drive on or over this barrier, or make a left turn or U-turn across it, except at designated openings.

options.text: Should be treated as a separate traffic lane.

dmv_test_5.question: If you come to an intersection and your view to the side is blocked, you should:

options.text: Slow down and look both ways.
Maintain your speed and look both ways.
Stop, then inch forward until you can see clearly in both directions.
options.explanation: Drivers must slow down when approaching an intersection. If a clear view of cross traffic is obscured, a driver should come to a stop and inch forward until they can see clearly in both directions.

dmv_test_5.question: To improve visibility lowered by rain or fog, drivers should use their:

options.text: Low beam headlights.
options.explanation: Low beam headlights should be used when driving in rainy or foggy weather. Even if they do little to help you see, low beams will make it easier for others to see you.

options.text: High beam headlights.
Parking lights.

dmv_test_5.question: This road sign means:

options.text: Sharp right turn ahead.
A road joins from the right.
The road ahead turns sharply right then sharply left.
options.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign indicates that the road ahead will turn sharply to the right and then sharply to the left.

dmv_test_5.question: When passing another vehicle, it is safe to return to your lane if you:

options.text: Cannot see the vehicle directly to your right.
See the vehicle’s headlights in your rearview mirror.
options.explanation: Before returning to your original lane after passing, you must make sure you are not dangerously close to the vehicle you have just passed. When you can see both of the vehicle's headlights in your rearview mirror, you may have enough room to return to the lane.

options.text: Have passed the other vehicle’s front bumper.

dmv_test_5.question: You are driving on a city street and see an emergency vehicle with flashing lights behind you. What should you do?

options.text: Drive to the right edge of the road and slow down.
Drive to the right edge of the road and stop.
options.explanation: You must yield the right-of-way to any emergency vehicle that is using its siren and lights. Drive to the right edge of the road and stop until the emergency vehicle has passed. If you are within an intersection, drive through the intersection first and then stop.

options.text: Stay in your lane, slow down, and let it pass.

dmv_test_5.question: It is legal to drive with an alcoholic beverage container that has been opened only if the container is:

options.text: Under the front seat.
In the glove department.
In the trunk.
options.explanation: Any opened alcoholic beverage container must be kept in the trunk of the vehicle, or in another place where passengers do not sit. Keeping an opened alcoholic drink in the glove compartment is specifically prohibited. However, in a bus, taxi, camper, or motor home, these restrictions do not apply to non-driving passengers.

dmv_test_5.question: You should not use your horn:

options.text: When visibility ahead is limited.
If you might hit another vehicle.
Near blind pedestrians.
options.explanation: When driving near a blind pedestrian, using your horn may be dangerous. Yield to the pedestrian and proceed when it is safe to do so.

dmv_test_5.question: When driving in work zones, you should:

options.text: Follow the driver in front of you closely.
Pass the driver in front of you as soon as you can.
Avoid tailgating and keep a safe following distance.
options.explanation: When driving in a work zone, keep a safe distance between your vehicle and traffic barriers, trucks, construction equipment, workers, and other vehicles. Increase your following distance and do not tailgate.

dmv_test_5.question: Which of these statements is true about roadwork zones?

options.text: Fines are the same for violations committed in work zones as they are under normal traffic conditions.
You must "Slow for the Cone Zone."
options.explanation: Reduce your speed and be prepared to slow down or stop for highway equipment. Driving carefully through work zones improves safety for drivers, pedestrians, bicyclists, and road workers.

options.text: Slow down only if you think workers are present.

dmv_test_5.question: When passing on the left of a vehicle, it is safe to move back into the right lane:

options.text: After about three seconds.
When you can no longer see the vehicle over your right shoulder.
When you can see the front of the vehicle in your rearview mirror.
options.explanation: When passing another vehicle on its left, you may move back into the right lane when the headlights of the passed vehicle can be seen in your rearview mirror. Always signal before changing lanes.

dmv_test_5.question: Before switching on the ignition, you should:

options.text: Buckle your safety belt.
Be sure all passengers have buckled their safety belts.
Both of the above.
options.explanation: Develop a routine for entering and leaving your car. Before switching on the ignition, buckle your safety belt and see that all passengers do likewise.

dmv_test_5.question: When driving in fog or mist, never put your headlights on the high beam setting because:

options.text: The light will reflect back into your eyes.
options.explanation: In foggy or misty conditions, you should not use your headlights on their high beam setting because the light will be reflected back into your eyes.

options.text: Approaching vehicles might not see you.
Vehicles behind you may follow too closely.

dmv_test_5.question: To turn left from a one-way street onto a one-way street, start from:

options.text: The lane closest to the left curb.
options.explanation: When turning left from a one-way street onto a one-way street, start the turn from the far left lane. Watch for pedestrians, motorcyclists, and bicyclists between your vehicle and the curb because they may also legally use the left turn lane for their left turns. Turn into any lane that is safely open.

options.text: The center lane.
Any lane, as long as it seems safe to do so.

dmv_test_5.question: If you find yourself in a skid:

options.text: Brake lightly.
Stay off the brakes.
options.explanation: If your vehicle begins to skid, do not use the brakes. Braking could make the skid worse.

options.text: Brake abruptly.

dmv_test_5.question: If you see orange construction signs and cones on a freeway, you must:

options.text: Slow down because the lane ends ahead.
Be prepared for workers and equipment ahead.
options.explanation: As you enter a work zone, signs and message boards will warn you of workers, slow-moving equipment, and/or closed lanes ahead. You should reduce your speed and be prepared to slow down or stop.

options.text: Change lanes and maintain your current speed.

dmv_test_5.question: Which of the following roadways freeze first when wet?

options.text: Bridges and overpasses
options.explanation: Bridges and overpasses tend to freeze before the rest of the road does.

options.text: Intersections
Tunnels

dmv_test_5.question: You should always travel:
