options.text: At the speed of vehicles surrounding you.
At the speed limit.
At a speed appropriate for road and weather conditions.
options.explanation: The speed at which you should drive your vehicle depends on road conditions, the weather, and the legal speed limit. You may never drive above the legal speed limit. Decrease your speed when anything makes conditions less than ideal.

dmv_test_5.question: This sign means:

options.text: Stop sign ahead.
Railroad crossing ahead.
options.explanation: A round sign always indicates that you are approaching a railroad crossing.

options.text: Construction ahead.

dmv_test_5.question: When turning left from a two-way street onto a one-way street, you should:

options.text: Turn into any lane.
Turn into first lane.
options.explanation: When making any turn, turn from the lane closest to the direction you wish to travel into the first available legal lane. On a turn from a two-way to a one-way street, this means you should turn into the first lane.

options.text: Turn into second lane.

dmv_test_5.question: You exit the freeway on a ramp that curves downhill. You should:

options.text: Slow to a safe speed before the curve.
options.explanation: You should always slow down before entering a curve. You may not be able to see hazards ahead and braking in a curve may cause your vehicle to skid.

options.text: Slow to the posted speed limit for the freeway.
Wait until you have entered the curve to begin braking.

dmv_test_5.question: Which of the following is not a safe driving practice when driving on the interstate?

options.text: Slower traffic must keep to the right.
Change lanes without signaling.
options.explanation: You should always signal when moving your vehicle to the right or left. On an interstate, you should stay in the right lane if you are moving more slowly than the surrounding traffic. It is illegal to back up or make a U-turn on interstate highways, so if you miss your exit, you should proceed to the next exit.

options.text: If you miss your exit, you must go to the next exit.

dmv_test_5.question: Which of these is a safe driving technique?

options.text: Using your high beam lights in the fog.
Staring at the road ahead of your vehicle.
Checking your rearview mirrors frequently.
options.explanation: To stay aware of hazards, you should scan the road and check your rearview mirrors every two to five seconds. Constantly staring at just the road ahead of you is dangerous. If you must drive in foggy conditions, you should use your low beam headlights, not your high beam headlights.

dmv_test_6.question: When planning to pass another vehicle, you should:

options.text: Not count on other drivers to make room for you.
options.explanation: When planning to pass, do not count on having enough time to pass several vehicles at once or assume that other drivers will make room for you. When you can see both headlights of the passed vehicle in your rearview mirror, you may have enough room to return to your driving lane.

options.text: Assume the driver will let you pass if you use your turn signal.
Assume the driver will maintain a constant speed.

dmv_test_6.question: You hit a parked vehicle and can't find the owner. What must you do?

options.text: Call your insurance company when you get home.
Wait for the owner to return.
Leave a note with your name and address on the parked vehicle.
options.explanation: If you hit a parked vehicle or other property, you must leave a note with your name, phone number, and address securely attached to the vehicle or property that you hit.

dmv_test_6.question: If you are driving and you see animals standing near the roadway:

options.text: Speed up to scare them away.
Slow down and proceed with caution.
options.explanation: Slow down and proceed with caution if you see animals that are standing near the roadway. They may unexpectedly bolt or change direction at the last moment. Some animals travel in packs, so there may be more animals just out of sight that are also near the road.

options.text: Quickly swerve into the next lane.

dmv_test_6.question: This sign means:

options.text: All traffic must turn left.
No left turn.
options.explanation: This sign means drivers cannot make a left turn. It is unsafe and unlawful to make a left turn at an intersection where this sign is posted.

options.text: No U-turn.

dmv_test_6.question: Which of the following statements about blind spots is true?

options.text: They are eliminated if you have one outside mirror on each side of the vehicle.
Large trucks have bigger blind spots than most passenger vehicles.
options.explanation: Blind spots are areas that a driver cannot see if they look in their mirrors. Large trucks have large blind spots that drivers of other vehicles should avoid.

options.text: Blind spots can be checked by looking in your rearview mirrors.

dmv_test_6.question: You should yield to a pedestrian:

options.text: Only if they are in a crosswalk.
At all times, even if the pedestrian is not obeying traffic laws.
options.explanation: Always be aware of pedestrians near your vehicle. You must do everything you can to prevent striking a pedestrian, regardless of the circumstances.

options.text: Only if the traffic lights are in the pedestrian's favor.

dmv_test_6.question: If you plan to pass another vehicle, you should:

options.text: Not assume the other driver will make space for you to return to your lane.
options.explanation: Even when you signal, you should not assume that the space you want to occupy is free or that other drivers will give you the right-of-way.

options.text: Assume the other driver will let you pass if you use your turn signal.
Assume the other driver will maintain a constant speed.

dmv_test_6.question: What usually causes a locked wheel skid?

options.text: Braking too hard at a slow speed
Braking lightly at a slow speed
Braking too hard at a fast speed
options.explanation: A locked wheel skid is most commonly caused by a driver braking too hard while traveling at a high speed. Drivers should use their brakes smoothly and gradually.

dmv_test_6.question: A broken yellow centerline indicates that:

options.text: Passing is not permitted.
Passing on the right is permitted when the way ahead is clear.
Passing on the left is permitted when the way ahead is clear.
options.explanation: A broken yellow centerline next to your side of the road indicates that traffic may cross the centerline to pass from your side of the road.

dmv_test_6.question: This sign means:

options.text: Merge.
options.explanation: This sign warns that two lanes of traffic going the same direction will soon merge into one lane.

options.text: Winding road ahead.
Reserved parking for persons with disabilities.

dmv_test_6.question: When you are facing a green light and there are pedestrians in the intersection:

options.text: You must yield the right-of-way to pedestrians.
options.explanation: When facing a green light, you must yield to pedestrians and vehicles already in the intersection. Drivers must yield to pedestrians when turning on a steady green signal.

options.text: You have the right-of-way over pedestrians.
Pedestrians must wait for you to cross.

dmv_test_6.question: If you become drowsy while driving, you should:

options.text: Try to fight it.
Take a break.
options.explanation: If you start to feel tired while driving, drive to the first available rest stop or service area to take a break, nap, stretch, or change drivers. You should not rely on caffeine pills or energy drinks, as these are not a replacement for rest and may make your driving even more dangerous.

options.text: Take some caffeine pills.

dmv_test_6.question: It is a very windy day. You are driving and a dust storm blows across the freeway, reducing your visibility. You should decrease your speed and turn on your:

options.text: Interior lights.
Parking lights.
Headlights.
options.explanation: Drivers must use their headlights any time conditions prevent them from seeing other vehicles. Conditions with lowered visibility include dust, clouds, rain, snow, smoke, or fog on or near the roadway.

dmv_test_6.question: Which of these statements is true about large trucks?

options.text: They take longer to stop than passenger vehicles.
options.explanation: Large trucks take longer to stop than other vehicles traveling at the same speed. The average passenger vehicle traveling at 55 mph can stop within 400 feet. However, a large truck traveling at the same speed can take almost 800 feet to stop.

options.text: They all have air brakes that allow them to stop quickly.
They are more maneuverable than passenger vehicles.

dmv_test_6.question: You want to park downhill on a two-way road and there is no curb. Which way do you turn your front wheels?

options.text: Straight ahead
Right, toward the side of the road
options.explanation: When parking facing downhill on a road with or without a curb, or when facing uphill on a road without a curb, turn your front wheels toward the edge of the road so your vehicle will roll away from traffic if the brakes fail. However, when parking uphill on a road with a curb, turn your wheels toward the center of the road so the vehicle will roll into the curb if the brakes fail.

options.text: Left, toward the center of the road

dmv_test_6.question: When driving behind another vehicle at night, you should:

options.text: Keep your headlights on the low beam setting.
options.explanation: Use high beam headlights only when driving in rural areas and when other cars are not nearby. Lower your headlights to their low beam setting when you are following closely behind another driver.

options.text: Use your high beam headlights until you are within 10 feet of the vehicle ahead.
Use your high beam headlights.

dmv_test_6.question: This sign means:

options.text: Traffic signal ahead.
options.explanation: This sign warns of of an approaching traffic signal.

options.text: Stop.
Yield the right-of-way.

dmv_test_6.question: If you drive 55 mph in a 55 mph zone, you can be given a speeding ticket:

options.text: Under no circumstances because it is always legal.
If the road or weather conditions require a slower speed.
options.explanation: California has a "Basic Speed Law," which means that you may never drive faster than would be safe in current conditions. Even if your speed is slower than the posted limit, you may still be cited if you are going too fast for conditions. When deciding how quickly to drive, drivers should take multiple factors into account, such as the speed of surrounding vehicles, the condition of the road surface, the presence of bicyclists and pedestrians, and weather conditions.

options.text: Only if you are approaching a sharp curve in the road.

dmv_test_6.question: When driving in fog, you should:

options.text: Use your high beam headlights.
Use your parking lights.
Use your low beam headlights.
options.explanation: Drivers should use low beam headlights when driving in fog. High beams will reflect back at the driver, making it difficult to see.

dmv_test_6.question: You want to turn left at an upcoming corner. Yield the right-of-way to:

options.text: Oncoming vehicles also turning left.
All approaching vehicles.
options.explanation: When making a left turn, you must yield to pedestrians, bicyclists, or other vehicles moving on their green light.

options.text: Pedestrians on the sidewalk waiting for a "Walk" signal.

dmv_test_6.question: To help avoid skidding on slippery surfaces, you should:

options.text: Shift to a lower gear after starting down a steep hill.
Speed up to enter curves and slow down to exit them.
Slow down before entering curves and intersections.
options.explanation: Slow down before you enter a curve because you do not know what may be ahead. Braking on a curve may cause you to skid.

dmv_test_6.question: California's Move Over law requires:

options.text: All vehicles to stay in the right lane at all times.
Trucks to use the left lane.
All vehicles to vacate the lane closest to an emergency vehicle that is stopped with its lights flashing.
options.explanation: If an emergency vehicle with its lights on is stopped on the side of the road, California drivers are required to vacate the lane directly next to the vehicle, if possible. If a driver cannot move over safely, they must slow down and proceed with caution. This law also applies when approaching a stopped tow truck or Department of Transportation vehicle.

dmv_test_6.question: When you drive through a construction zone, you should:

options.text: Stop to watch the workers.
Decrease your following distance.
Pass the construction zone carefully and not “rubberneck."
options.explanation: To avoid contributing to chronic traffic congestion, you should not "rubberneck." That is, you should not slow down to look at out-of-the-ordinary things.

dmv_test_6.question: This symbol is used for:

options.text: Dangerous intersections.
Slow-moving vehicles.
options.explanation: A reflective orange triangle on the rear of a vehicle means it travels only at slow speeds. You may see this sign on roadwork equipment, farm vehicles, or horse-drawn wagons and carriages. It appears as a solid orange triangle during the day and a hollow red triangle at night.

options.text: Yield signs.

dmv_test_6.question: This sign means:

options.text: No right turn.
options.explanation: This sign prohibits right turns. You cannot make a right turn at an intersection where this sign is posted.

options.text: You must turn right.
Watch for traffic on your right.

dmv_test_6.question: Which of the following is true about vehicles displaying a diamond-shaped sign that indicates a hazardous load?

options.text: They are not allowed to drive on freeways.
They must stop before crossing railroad tracks.
options.explanation: Vehicles displaying hazardous load signs are required to stop before crossing railroad tracks.

options.text: They are not allowed to exceed 35 mph.

dmv_test_6.question: Drivers turning left must yield to:

options.text: Oncoming vehicles traveling straight or turning right.
options.explanation: Drivers making a left turn must yield to all vehicles approaching from the opposite direction. This includes bicycles and motorcycles.

options.text: Passing cars.
No one in particular.

dmv_test_6.question: When parking uphill on a two-way street with no curb, your front wheels should be:

options.text: Turned to the left (toward the street).
Turned to the right (away from the street).
options.explanation: When parking on a hill (either uphill or downhill) where there is no curb, you should turn your wheels so that the vehicle will roll away from the center of the road if the brakes fail.

options.text: Parallel with the pavement.

dmv_test_6.question: You are required to stop your vehicle:

options.text: At any intersection where a police officer orders you to stop.
Where there is a red traffic light.
Both of the above.
options.explanation: You must come to a complete stop at a steady or flashing red traffic light. You must always obey instructions given by officers directing traffic, regardless of any posted signs or traffic signals.

dmv_test_6.question: When can you drive in a bike lane?

options.text: During rush hour traffic if there are no bicyclists in the bike lane.
When you are within 200 feet of a cross street where you plan to turn right.
options.explanation: If there is a bike lane, drive into the bike lane no more than 200 feet before a turn. Watch for bicyclists or motorcyclists who may get between your vehicle and the curb.

options.text: When you want to pass a driver ahead of you who is turning right.

dmv_test_6.question: If a traffic signal light is not working, you must:

options.text: Stop, then proceed when safe.
options.explanation: If a traffic signal is not working and no lights are showing, you should proceed cautiously as if the intersection is controlled by stop signs in all directions.

options.text: Stop before entering the intersection and let all other traffic go first.
Slow down or stop, only if necessary.

dmv_test_6.question: U-turns in business districts are:

options.text: Always illegal because they are dangerous.
Legal whenever oncoming vehicles are not a hazard.
Legal at intersections, unless a sign prohibits them.
options.explanation: In a business district, you may make a U-turn only at an intersection, unless a sign prohibits it, or where openings are provided for turns.

dmv_test_6.question: If your vehicle has a mechanical problem:

options.text: Signal and pull into the slow lane.
Stop in your lane and put on your hazard lights.
Put on your hazard lights and pull off the road.
options.explanation: If your vehicle breaks down on a highway, make sure other drivers can see it. Get your vehicle off the road and away from traffic if at all possible and turn on your emergency flashers to show that you are having trouble.

dmv_test_6.question: This sign means:

options.text: Two-way traffic.
options.explanation: This sign informs drivers that they are leaving a divided roadway and approaching a two-way highway.

options.text: Change in direction ahead.
School zone and crossing.

dmv_test_6.question: You must show proof of insurance to law enforcement:

options.text: Only if you are involved in a collision.
If you are involved in a collision or stopped for a citation.
options.explanation: You must have evidence of financial responsibility, such as proof of insurance, with you whenever you drive. You must always show proof of insurance and your license to an officer upon request after a traffic stop or collision.

options.text: Only if you are stopped and cited.

dmv_test_6.question: A vehicle suddenly cuts in front of you, creating a hazard. What should you do first?

options.text: Honk and step on the brake firmly.
Take your foot off the gas pedal.
options.explanation: If a vehicle merges in front of you too closely, take your foot off of the accelerator. This will create space between you and the vehicle ahead without requiring you to slam on your brakes or swerve into another lane.

options.text: Swerve into the lane next to you.

dmv_test_7.question: This yellow warning sign means:

options.text: You are approaching a school or school crosswalk.
Slow down, drive with caution, and watch for children.
Both of the above.
options.explanation: This sign is placed on roads near schools to warn drivers to slow down, drive with caution, and watch for children.

dmv_test_7.question: Fines in a construction zone are:

options.text: Doubled.
options.explanation: Fines for moving traffic violations are doubled in highway construction or maintenance zones where workers are present. When operating in a construction zone, you must drive carefully and follow all directions provided by signs, signals, officers, and flaggers.

options.text: Tripled.
Cut in half.

dmv_test_7.question: Hydroplaning occurs when tires ride on a thin film of water instead of on the surface of the road. To prevent hydroplaning in rainy weather, you should:

options.text: Put on your cruise control to maintain a constant speed.
Decrease your speed.
options.explanation: In rainy weather, you should lower your speed to reduce the risk of hydroplaning. Driving too fast may cause your tires to ride up on the water and lose contact with the surface of the road, making it very difficult to control your vehicle.

options.text: Move to the shoulder of the road as soon as it starts to rain.

dmv_test_7.question: A flashing red traffic light at an intersection means:

options.text: Slow down before entering.
Stop before entering.
options.explanation: A flashing red signal means "stop." After coming to a stop, you may proceed once it is safe, observing all right-of-way rules.

options.text: Stop and wait for the green light.

dmv_test_7.question: On freezing, wet days, which of the following roadways is most likely to hide spots of ice?

options.text: Roadways near the tops of hills
Roadways on bridges and overpasses
options.explanation: Bridges and overpasses tend to freeze before the rest of the road does. They can hide spots of ice.

options.text: Roadways paved with asphalt

dmv_test_7.question: In inclement weather, you should:

options.text: Steer off the road.
Drive in a low gear.
Steer and brake smoothly.
options.explanation: When driving during unfavorable weather conditions, avoid slamming on the brakes and making sharp, quick turns. These behaviors will make controlling your vehicle in inclement weather even more difficult.

dmv_test_7.question: There is no crosswalk and you see a pedestrian crossing your lane ahead. You should:

options.text: Make eye contact with and then pass the pedestrian.
Slow down as you pass the pedestrian.
Stop and let the pedestrian finish crossing the street.
options.explanation: At an intersection where traffic is not controlled by traffic signal lights, drivers are required to yield the right-of-way to pedestrians within any crosswalk, marked or unmarked. Even if there is no crosswalk, yield to the pedestrian.

dmv_test_7.question: When taking any medicine, you should:

options.text: Consult your doctor about the effects before driving.
options.explanation: Legal medications, both prescription and over-the-counter, can potentially impair your ability to drive. Always consult with your doctor or pharmacist if you have questions about how a particular drug or drug combination will affect your ability to drive. You should particularly make a point of talking with your doctor if they give you a prescription for a tranquilizer or sedative.

options.text: Have someone follow you home.
Keep your window open and drive more slowly.

dmv_test_7.question: To improve visibility lowered by rain or fog, drivers should use their:

options.text: Low beam headlights.
options.explanation: Use low beam headlights when driving in rain, snow, sleet, or fog. High beam headlights in adverse weather conditions lower visibility by reflecting off the precipitation and back into the driver's eyes.

options.text: High beam headlights.
Parking lights.

dmv_test_7.question: This yellow sign means:

options.text: There is a sharp turn to the right.
options.explanation: Some warning signs have a fluorescent yellow-green background. These signs warn of upcoming conditions, including roads with curves and sharp turns.

options.text: The lane must turn right.
A right turn is permitted on a green arrow only.

dmv_test_7.question: This sign means:

options.text: No passing zone.
options.explanation: A triangular yellow sign with black lettering indicates a no passing zone. It will appear on the left side of a two-way, two-lane roadway at the beginning of an area where prohibitive pavement markings are also used.

options.text: Slow-moving vehicle.
Two-way traffic.

dmv_test_7.question: When approaching a roundabout, you should always:

options.text: Increase your speed.
Decrease your speed.
options.explanation: When approaching a roundabout, slow down. A roundabout is designed to be driven at a low speed.

options.text: Maintain your speed.

dmv_test_7.question: A broken yellow line beside a solid yellow line indicates that passing is:

options.text: Permitted from the side next to the solid yellow line.
Not permitted from either direction.
Permitted from the side next to the broken yellow line.
options.explanation: When the center of the road is marked by a solid yellow line beside a broken yellow line, passing is permitted from the side next to the broken line and prohibited from the side next to the solid line.

dmv_test_7.question: You want to make a right turn at the corner. A pedestrian with a guide dog is at the corner ready to cross the street in front of you. Before making your right turn, you should:

options.text: Turn off your engine until the person crosses the street.
Tell the pedestrian when to cross the street.
Wait until the person crosses the street.
options.explanation: Pedestrians using guide dogs or white canes (with or without a red tip) must be given the right-of-way at all times.

dmv_test_7.question: To turn left from a one-way street with multiple lanes onto a two-way street, start the turn in:

options.text: The far left lane.
options.explanation: When making a left turn from a one-way street onto a two-way street, start from the far left lane.

options.text: Any available lane.
The lane closest to the middle of the street.

dmv_test_7.question: This sign means:

options.text: No U-turn.
No left turn.
No right turn.
options.explanation: Where this sign is posted, it is prohibited to make a right turn. It would be unsafe and unlawful to make a right turn at an intersection with this sign.

dmv_test_7.question: You may drive off of the paved roadway to pass another vehicle:

options.text: If the shoulder is wide enough to accommodate your vehicle.
If the vehicle ahead of you is turning left.
Under no circumstances.
options.explanation: You may never drive off the paved or main-traveled portion of the road and onto the shoulder to pass another vehicle.

dmv_test_7.question: The speed limit at an uncontrolled railroad crossing is:

options.text: 25 mph.
15 mph.
options.explanation: When you are within 100 feet of an uncontrolled railroad crossing where you cannot see the tracks for 400 feet in both directions, the speed limit is 15 mph.

options.text: 20 mph.

dmv_test_7.question: You are driving behind a motorcycle and want to pass. You must:

options.text: Stay in the right lane as much as possible because the motorcycle is small and doesn't use all of the lane.
Blow your horn to make the motorcycle move onto the shoulder so that you can pass.
Have your vehicle entirely in the left lane before and during the pass.
options.explanation: When passing a motorcycle, allow a full lane to the motorcycle. Never crowd into the same lane as the motorcycle. Returning to the original lane too soon can force a rider to swerve to the right and into traffic or off the road.

dmv_test_7.question: You want to pass a bicyclist in a narrow traffic lane when an oncoming vehicle is approaching. You should:

options.text: Honk your horn then pass the bicyclist.
Slow down and let the vehicle pass you before you pass the bicyclist.
options.explanation: In this situation, you should take on one danger at a time. Rather than trying to squeeze between the bicyclist and the other vehicle, you should slow down to let the other vehicle pass, and then pass the bicyclist when it is safe to do so.

options.text: Wait until the bicyclist rides off the roadway.

dmv_test_7.question: California's "Basic Speed Law" says:

options.text: You should never drive faster than posted speed limits.
You should never drive faster than is safe for current conditions.
options.explanation: The "Basic Speed Law" means that you may never drive faster than would be safe in current conditions. For example, if you drive 45 mph in a 55 mph zone during a dense fog, even though you are below the posted limit, you may be cited for driving too fast for conditions.

options.text: The maximum speed limit in California is 70 mph on certain freeways.

dmv_test_7.question: If you pass a school bus that is stopped with its red lights flashing, you will:

options.text: Be fined up to $1,000.
options.explanation: Drivers must come to a complete stop when approaching a school bus stopped with its red lights flashing. Failure to stop until the red lights stop flashing may result in license suspension and a fine of up to $1,000.

options.text: Be fined up to $100.
Face no legal consequences.

dmv_test_7.question: This yellow sign means:

options.text: One lane ahead.
Merging traffic ahead.
options.explanation: This sign warns of the possible presence of merging traffic.

options.text: Lane ends ahead.

dmv_test_7.question: If you are getting tired while driving, you should:

options.text: Stop and either get rest or change drivers.
options.explanation: To avoid the dangers of fatigued driving, take breaks every hour or so during a long trip. If possible, share driving responsibilities with another person so you can each sleep while the other person drives.

options.text: Drink something with caffeine.
Open a window.

dmv_test_7.question: It is legal to make a left turn at a red traffic light after stopping only if:

options.text: You are traveling on a two-way street and turning onto a two-way street.
You are traveling on a one-way street and turning onto another one-way street.
options.explanation: After coming to a complete stop, you may turn left at a red light only if you are traveling on a one-way street and turning onto another one-way street. Only make the turn if there are no posted signs prohibiting such a turn.

options.text: You yield to all other traffic at the intersection.

dmv_test_7.question: You have allowed the wheels of your vehicle to run off the edge of the pavement. What should you do first?

options.text: Turn the front wheels slightly to the left to edge the car back onto the pavement.
Hold the steering wheel firmly, release the gas pedal, and gently apply the brakes.
options.explanation: If your vehicle leaves the roadway, hold the steering wheel firmly, release the gas pedal, and gently apply the brakes. Wait until your speed has reduced, check the traffic, and look for a place to safely return to the roadway by merging back into traffic. Overcompensating by jerking the wheel to return to the roadway can cause you to lose control of your vehicle or may cause your car to go into other lanes of traffic.

options.text: Apply the brakes and turn the front wheels sharply to the left.

dmv_test_7.question: This sign means:

options.text: Curves ahead.
Divided highway starts.
Divided highway ends.
options.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns that the divided highway ends ahead. Prepare to change lanes or shift lane position.

dmv_test_7.question: Which of the following increases your chances of being in a collision?

options.text: Looking over your shoulder while making lane changes
Continuously changing lanes to pass other vehicles
options.explanation: Every time you pass another vehicle, you increase your chances of being in a collision.

options.text: Adjusting your rearview mirror before you start driving

dmv_test_7.question: To avoid hydroplaning while driving in rainy conditions, you should:

options.text: Drive at a speed appropriate for ideal conditions.
Apply your brakes as soon as your car starts to skid.
Slow down.
options.explanation: When driving too quickly in wet conditions, your tires may lose all contact with the road surface. Loss of traction will cause the vehicle to ride on top of the water, which is called "hydroplaning." The best way to prevent this from happening is to drive more slowly in rainy or wet conditions than you would when driving during ideal weather conditions.

dmv_test_7.question: If you come across livestock or other animals on the roadway, you should:

options.text: Swerve out of the way.
Slow down and stop.
options.explanation: If you are driving and come across an animal of any kind in the road, try to slow down and stop if it's safe to do so. Swerving to avoid an animal can be dangerous because your vehicle may lose control and cause an accident.

options.text: Ignore them.

dmv_test_7.question: It is unlawful to:

options.text: Pass another vehicle in any marked no passing zone.
Pass another vehicle over a railroad crossing.
Both of the above.
options.explanation: It is illegal to cross the centerline to pass when driving on hills, in curves, and in other locations where you cannot see ahead far enough to pass safely. You may not pass at street crossings, at railroad crossings, where signs indicate no passing zones, or where a solid yellow line is next to your lane. You may not pass when the vehicle in front of you has stopped for a pedestrian or when driving in work zones where passing would be hazardous.

dmv_test_7.question: While all of the following actions are dangerous to do while driving, which is also illegal?

options.text: Listening to music through a set of dual headphones.
options.explanation: Listening to music through a set of dual headphones is dangerous and illegal.

options.text: Adjusting your outside mirrors.
Reading a road map.

dmv_test_7.question: Which of the following are factors commonly contributing to traffic crashes?

options.text: Exceeding the posted speed limit and driving too fast for conditions or circumstances.
options.explanation: Driving above the speed limit, driving too far below the speed limit, and driving too fast for conditions are all actions that commonly contribute to traffic accidents. Always drive with the general flow of traffic, within legal speed limits.

options.text: Getting adequate rest and staying alert.
Scanning the environment and staying focused on the driving task.

dmv_test_7.question: If there is a deep puddle on the road ahead, you should:

options.text: Maintain the posted speed to make it through the water.
Avoid the puddle if possible.
options.explanation: To prevent skidding on slippery surfaces, avoid especially slippery areas, such as ice patches, wet leaves, oil, or deep puddles. The safest surface for driving is a dry, solid surface.

options.text: Shift into neutral as you drive through the water.

dmv_test_7.question: This red and white sign means you should:

options.text: Stop and check for traffic coming from both directions before proceeding.
Give the right-of-way to traffic on the road you wish to enter or cross.
options.explanation: A three-sided yield sign indicates that you must slow down and be ready to stop, if necessary, to let any vehicle, bicyclist, or pedestrian pass before you proceed. In this case, you do not have the right-of-way.

options.text: Maintain a steady speed and check for traffic coming from all directions.

dmv_test_7.question: When making a right turn from a highway with two lanes traveling in your direction, you may turn from:

options.text: The lane closest to the center of the road.
The lane nearest the curb or edge of the roadway.
options.explanation: Begin and end the turn in the lane nearest the right-hand curb. Do not swing wide into another lane of traffic.

options.text: Either lane, depending on oncoming traffic.

dmv_test_8.question: This road sign means:

options.text: School crossing.
Pedestrian crossing.
options.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign indicates the presence of a crosswalk, regardless of if it is marked on the pavement or not. Upon seeing this sign, you should be alert and allow any pedestrians to cross the road safely.

options.text: Jogging trail.

dmv_test_8.question: This white sign means you:

options.text: May turn left only on a green arrow.
May turn left on a green light when it is safe.
options.explanation: A sign that says to "yield" means that you must slow down and be ready to stop to let any vehicle, bicyclist, or pedestrian pass before you proceed. After yielding, you may follow the remaining directions on the sign.

options.text: Must wait for the solid green light before you turn left.

dmv_test_8.question: Which of the following substances can affect the ability to drive?

options.text: Tranquilizers, marijuana, and sedatives.
Cough syrups and cold tablets containing codeine or antihistamines.
All of the above.
options.explanation: A number of drugs can impair your ability to drive, including depressant medications like tranquilizers and sedatives; over-the-counter cough syrups, cold tablets, and allergy medications (which may contain impairing substances like alcohol, codeine, or antihistamines); and illegal drugs.

dmv_test_8.question: This sign is a warning that you are approaching:

options.text: An intersection.
A crosswalk.
A railroad crossing.
options.explanation: A round sign means you are approaching a railroad crossing. This sign is posted a few hundred feet in front of the tracks and tells drivers to slow down, look, listen, and prepare to stop.

dmv_test_8.question: When driving at night, you should:

options.text: Always use your high beams.
Look directly at the headlights of an oncoming vehicle.
Increase your following distance.
options.explanation: Increase your following distance when it is difficult to see due to darkness. Use headlights to increase visibility, following the rules for proper use of high beams and low beams. Avoid looking directly at the headlights of an oncoming vehicle to avoid being blinded by the glare.

dmv_test_8.question: It is illegal to drive in a bicycle lane unless you are:

options.text: in need of the space and the bike lane is empty.
Passing another vehicle
Parking (where permitted), entering or leaving the road, turning (within 200 feet of an intersection).
options.explanation: It is illegal to drive in a bicycle lane unless you are parking (where permitted), entering or leaving the road, or turning (within 200 feet of an intersection).

dmv_test_8.question: An orange-colored sign like this means:

options.text: There is roadwork ahead.
options.explanation: Orange-colored signs indicate construction areas. Proceed with caution.

options.text: You must change lanes ahead.
There is a detour ahead.

dmv_test_8.question: Only ____ can lower blood alcohol concentration (BAC) and reduce alcohol's effects on a body.

options.text: Drinking caffeine
Eating foods high in fat
Time
options.explanation: The only way to sober up after drinking alcohol is to allow time for your body to eliminate the alcohol in your system. Nothing you can do, including eating and drinking, can accelerate this process.

dmv_test_8.question: A police officer is signaling for you to continue driving through a red light. What should you do?

options.text: Do as the officer tells you.
options.explanation: You must obey any traffic direction, order, or signal given by a traffic officer, peace officer, or firefighter, even if it conflicts with existing signs, signals, or laws.

options.text: Wait for the green light.
Stop first, then do what the officer tells you.

dmv_test_8.question: When driving in fog, it is best to drive with:

options.text: High beam headlights.
Low beam headlights.
options.explanation: Use low beam headlights when driving in fog, rain, or snow. High beams may reflect off of the weather and make visibility even poorer.

options.text: Four-way flashers.

dmv_test_8.question: Backing your vehicle is:

options.text: Always dangerous.
options.explanation: Backing up is always dangerous because it is hard to see behind your vehicle. Use extra caution when backing up.

options.text: Dangerous if you have a helper.
Only dangerous in large vehicles.

dmv_test_8.question: When you see this sign, you should stop and:

options.text: Check for vehicles only in the direction that you plan on going, then proceed.
Let all vehicles that arrive before or after you go first.
Check for traffic in all directions before proceeding.
options.explanation: At a stop sign, you must come to a full stop and check for traffic in all directions before proceeding.

dmv_test_8.question: You are preparing to exit the interstate. When should you start reducing your speed?

options.text: About halfway through the deceleration lane.
As you approach the deceleration lane.
Immediately upon entering the deceleration lane.
options.explanation: When leaving an interstate, you should maintain your speed until you enter the deceleration lane, at which point you should reduce your speed to the exit ramp's posted advisory speed.

dmv_test_8.question: It is illegal to leave a child age six or younger unattended in a vehicle on a hot day:

options.text: Even if they are secured in a child passenger restraint system.
options.explanation: It is never a good idea to leave a child unattended in a car. It is illegal to leave a child age six or younger unattended in a vehicle. A child may be left under the supervision of a person age 12 or older.

options.text: If they are supervised by a person twelve years of age or older.
Only if the key is in the ignition.

dmv_test_8.question: All of the following are dangerous to do while driving. Which is also illegal?

options.text: Wearing a headset that covers both ears.
options.explanation: It is illegal to drive while wearing a headset or earplugs in both ears.

options.text: Having one or more interior lights on.
Using cruise control on residential streets.

dmv_test_8.question: Blue traffic signs offer information on:

options.text: Motorist services.
options.explanation: Blue signs on the roadway are service signs. They are used to provide information about motorist services, such as upcoming rest areas, food options, or nearby hospitals.

options.text: Construction and maintenance.
Mileage information, such as distances to specific locations.

dmv_test_8.question: At an intersection with stop signs on all corners, yield the right-of-way to any driver:

options.text: On your left.
Who arrived before you.
options.explanation: After coming to a full stop, vehicles should proceed through a four-way stop in the order in which they arrive to the intersection. If multiple vehicles arrive at the same time, the vehicle on the left must yield the right-of-way to the vehicle on the right.

options.text: Across from your vehicle.

dmv_test_8.question: On a green arrow, you must:

options.text: Yield to any vehicle, bicycle, or pedestrian in the intersection.
options.explanation: A green arrow means "go." You must turn in the direction the arrow is pointing after you yield to any vehicles, bicycles, or pedestrians who are still in the intersection.

options.text: Yield to pedestrians only in the intersection.
Wait four seconds before proceeding.

dmv_test_8.question: It is illegal for a person 21 years of age or older to drive with a blood alcohol concentration (BAC) that is ____ or higher.

options.text: 0.08% -- Eight-hundredths of one percent
options.explanation: For drivers age 21 or older, it is illegal to drive with a blood alcohol concentration (BAC) of 0.08 percent or higher. Driving while under the influence of alcohol is not only illegal, but dangerous.

options.text: 0.10% -- One-tenth of one percent
0.05% -- Five-hundredths of one percent

dmv_test_8.question: You consent to take a chemical test for the alcohol content of your blood, breath, or urine:

options.text: Only if you have been drinking alcohol.
Whenever you drive in California.
options.explanation: By driving in California, you consent to have your breath, blood, or urine tested if you are arrested for suspicion of driving under the influence of alcohol and/or drugs.

options.text: Only if you have a collision.

dmv_test_8.question: When should drivers yield the right-of-way to pedestrians in a crosswalk?

options.text: Only if the pedestrians first wave to the driver.
Only if the pedestrians are not texting while walking.
At all times.
options.explanation: Bring your vehicle to a complete stop at a crosswalk to yield the right-of-way to any vehicle or pedestrian already in the intersection. You may carefully proceed if your lane is completely clear.

dmv_test_8.question: You must look for bicyclists in the same lanes used by motor vehicles because they:

options.text: Must ride facing oncoming traffic.
Illegally share lanes with motor vehicles.
Are entitled to share the road with motor vehicles.
options.explanation: Bicyclists have the right to operate on the road and may lawfully be permitted to ride on certain sections of freeways where there is no alternate route and bicycling is not forbidden by a sign. Watch for bicyclists and share the road when they are present.

dmv_test_8.question: Slowing down just to look at collisions or anything else out-of-the-ordinary:

options.text: Causes traffic congestion.
options.explanation: Avoid "rubbernecking," or slowing down to look at collisions or anything else out-of-the-ordinary. This helps to relieve traffic congestion.

options.text: Prevents rear-end collisions.
Improves traffic flow by preventing collisions.

dmv_test_8.question: A steady green traffic light at an intersection means:

options.text: Increase your speed.
Adjust your mirrors.
You may continue through the intersection at a safe and reasonable speed, if it is clear to do so.
options.explanation: A steady green traffic light indicates that the driver may continue through the intersection. The driver should yield to traffic or pedestrians already in the intersection and proceed when the intersection is clear.

dmv_test_8.question: A curb painted blue means parking is:

options.text: Allowed for no longer than 15 minutes.
Only allowed when picking up or dropping off passengers.
For disabled persons with a special placard or plate.
options.explanation: A blue curb indicates an area where parking is permitted only for a disabled person, or driver of a disabled person, who displays a placard or special license plate for disabled persons or disabled veterans.

dmv_test_8.question: Which way do you turn your front wheels to park downhill next to a curb?

options.text: Into the curb
options.explanation: When parking downhill, turn your front wheels into the curb or toward the side of the road. Set the parking brake.

options.text: Away from the curb
Parallel to the curb

dmv_test_8.question: As your speed increases, it is important to:

options.text: Turn on your headlights.
Look well ahead of your vehicle.
options.explanation: Your vehicle's stopping distance increases as your speed increases. When driving at high speeds, it is important to look well ahead of your vehicle to allow yourself space to safely react to hazardous situations.

options.text: Change lanes frequently.

dmv_test_8.question: A red arrow pointing to the right on a traffic light means you may:

options.text: Turn in that direction after slowing and checking for traffic.
Not turn in that direction until the light turns green.
options.explanation: A red arrow means "stop." You must remain stopped until a green light or green arrow appears. Do not turn against a red arrow.

options.text: Turn in that direction after you come to a complete stop.

dmv_test_8.question: Prior to entering a curve:

options.text: Activate your turn signal.
Reduce your speed.
options.explanation: You may drive more slowly than the posted speed limit, based on road conditions, but it is illegal to drive any faster than the posted speed limit. Some conditions which require reduced speed for safety include approaching curves or hills where visibility is limited, driving on slippery roads, and driving on roads where animals and pedestrians are present.

options.text: Brake hard.

dmv_test_8.question: What does this road sign mean?

options.text: Be ready to merge with traffic entering your lane.
options.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns that merging traffic will be entering from the right, so drivers should prepare to allow the incoming traffic to safely merge.

options.text: Always stop.
Divided highway ahead.

dmv_test_8.question: This white sign means you should not pass other vehicles:

options.text: Until after you pass the sign.
Unless it seems safe to do so.
For any reason.
options.explanation: A white rectangular sign indicates that you must obey the stated rule. This sign means that drivers should not pass other vehicles for any reason.

dmv_test_8.question: What does this road sign mean?

options.text: Winding road
Loose gravel
Slippery when wet
options.explanation: This sign indicates that the road may be slippery when wet. Exercise caution when driving on a slippery road.

dmv_test_8.question: When changing lanes, you can check your blind spot by:

options.text: Using the inside rearview mirror.
Turning your head and looking over your shoulder.
options.explanation: Even if your vehicle is properly equipped with mirrors, there are blind spots that cannot be seen by using the mirrors. Before changing lanes, look over your shoulder to check these areas.

options.text: Using your side mirror.

dmv_test_8.question: When driving in fog, you should use your:

options.text: Fog lights only.
High beams.
Low beams.
options.explanation: It is best to postpone driving until a fog clears. However, if you must drive in the fog, you should do so slowly and use your windshield wipers and low beam headlights.

dmv_test_8.question: Having a driver license is a:

options.text: Requirement.
Privilege.
options.explanation: It is important to remember that driving is a privilege and that all drivers play a role in ensuring that everyone remains safe on the roadways. If you prove to be abusive of that privilege, the privilege may be revoked.

options.text: Right.

dmv_test_8.question: When you see this black and yellow sign, it means:

options.text: The road to the right is for one-way traffic only.
There is a detour to the right due to road construction.
The road ahead changes direction at an extreme angle.
options.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. This sign tells drivers to slow down and prepare for an abrupt change in direction at an extreme angle.

dmv_test_9.question: When passing another vehicle:

options.text: Pass the vehicle as slowly as possible.
Drive at the same speed as the vehicle you are passing.
Pass the vehicle as safely and as quickly as possible.
options.explanation: When passing another vehicle that is traveling in the same direction as you, pass quickly to resume visibility. Return to your previous lane only when you can see both of the vehicle's headlights in your rearview mirror.

dmv_test_9.question: This sign indicates that:

options.text: There is a steep hill ahead.
options.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns drivers about an upcoming steep hill. Drivers should slow down and be ready to control their speed and protect their brakes from damage.

options.text: No trucks are allowed on the upcoming hill.
A logging road is ahead.

dmv_test_9.question: Which of the following statements about blind spots is true?

options.text: Blind spots are eliminated if you have one outside mirror.
Large trucks have bigger blind spots than most passenger vehicles.
options.explanation: Even if a vehicle is properly equipped with rearview and outside mirrors, it still has blind spots that cannot be seen in the mirrors. Large trucks have much larger blind spots than most passenger vehicles.

options.text: Blind spots can be checked by looking in your rearview mirror.

dmv_test_9.question: This sign means:

options.text: Merge right.
Divided highway begins.
Lane ends.
options.explanation: This sign indicates that the right lane ends ahead. A merging maneuver will be required for drivers in that lane.

dmv_test_9.question: You should drive on the shoulder to pass a car:

options.text: If the vehicle ahead of you is turning left.
Under no circumstances.
options.explanation: Passing on the right is permissible only if it is possible to do so without driving off the roadway. Never pass another vehicle on the shoulder because the other driver will not expect you to be there and may pull off the road.

options.text: If the shoulder is wide enough.

dmv_test_9.question: To make a right turn at a corner, you:

options.text: May not enter the bicycle lane.
Should only merge into the bicycle lane if you stop before turning.
Must merge into the bicycle lane before turning.
options.explanation: When making a right turn where there is a bicycle lane, you must merge into the bicycle lane no more than 200 feet before the corner and then make the turn. Be sure there are no bicyclists in your path before merging.

dmv_test_9.question: A solid yellow line next to a broken yellow line means that vehicles:

options.text: Driving in both directions may pass.
Next to the broken line may pass.
options.explanation: Yellow lines separate lanes of traffic moving in opposite directions. A broken yellow line next to your driving lane means that you may pass.

options.text: Next to the solid line may pass.

dmv_test_9.question: When parking your vehicle parallel to the curb on a level street:

options.text: Your front wheels must be turned toward the street.
Your wheels must be within 18 inches of the curb.
options.explanation: When parking alongside the curb on a level street, the front and back wheels of your vehicle must be parallel with and within 18 inches of the curb.

options.text: One of your rear wheels must touch the curb.

dmv_test_9.question: This road sign means:

options.text: Watch for people crossing your path.
No passing zone.
Work zone ahead.
options.explanation: This orange warning sign tells drivers that an area of roadwork is upcoming. When traveling through a work zone, stay alert for temporary traffic control devices.

dmv_test_9.question: When turning left at an intersection:

options.text: You should always yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.
options.explanation: Drivers making left turns must yield to oncoming traffic that is traveling straight. Drivers must always yield to pedestrians.

options.text: Oncoming traffic and pedestrians should yield to you.
You should never yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.

dmv_test_9.question: Changing from one lane to another is best done:

options.text: Quickly and often.
When a car is in your blind spot.
Gradually and carefully.
options.explanation: You should always change lanes gradually and carefully. Only change lanes when necessary. Every lane change increases the possibility of a traffic accident.

dmv_test_9.question: To know where traffic is behind you:

options.text: Frequently check your rearview mirror.
options.explanation: Drivers should check their rearview mirrors often to stay aware of the position of traffic behind them.

options.text: Turn and look out your back window.
Keep other vehicles out of your blind spots.

dmv_test_9.question: When merging onto the freeway, you should be driving:

options.text: At or near the speed of the freeway traffic.
options.explanation: You should enter a freeway at or near the speed of traffic, unless the speed of traffic exceeds the legal speed limit.

options.text: At the legal speed limit.
More slowly than the freeway traffic.

dmv_test_9.question: You must yield the right-of-way to an emergency vehicle that is using its siren and flashing lights by:

options.text: Driving as closely to the right edge of the road as possible and stopping.
options.explanation: You must yield the right-of-way to any emergency vehicle that is using its siren and flashing lights. Do this by driving to the right edge of the road and stopping, taking care not to stop in an intersection. You may move again after the emergency vehicle has passed.

options.text: Moving into the right lane and driving slowly until it has passed.
Stopping immediately, even if you are within an intersection.

dmv_test_9.question: To prevent tailgating, drivers should follow the:

options.text: One-second rule.
Two-second rule.
Three-second rule.
options.explanation: Most rear-end collisions are caused by tailgating. To avoid tailgating, use the “Three-Second Rule.” When the vehicle ahead of you passes a certain point, such as a sign, count “one-thousand-one, one-thousand-two, one-thousand-three.” If you pass the same point before you finish counting, you are following too closely.

dmv_test_9.question: You should not make sudden stops in front of large trucks and buses because:

options.text: Small vehicle drivers cannot adequately see large trucks and buses in their rearview mirrors.
Large trucks and buses, due to their size and weight, require longer distances to stop than smaller passenger vehicles.
options.explanation: Large vehicles require longer distances to stop and accelerate than smaller vehicles do. Making a sudden stop in front of a large vehicle is dangerous because the other driver may not be able to stop in time to avoid a collision.

options.text: Large trucks and buses travel at a higher speeds than small vehicles.

dmv_test_9.question: This is the shape and color of a ____ sign.

options.text: Stop
Wrong way
Yield
options.explanation: Downward-facing triangular signs mean drivers must yield. When approaching a yield sign, slow down to a speed that is reasonable for existing conditions and stop if necessary. If you must stop, do so at a marked stop line, if it exists.

dmv_test_9.question: This sign means:

options.text: No U-turn.
options.explanation: This sign indicates that you may not make a U-turn. You cannot turn around to go in the opposite direction at an intersection where this sign is posted.

options.text: No turning.
No left turn.

dmv_test_9.question: You have been involved in a minor traffic collision with a parked vehicle and you can't find the owner. You must:

options.text: Leave a note on the vehicle.
Report the collision without delay to the city police or, in unincorporated areas, to the California Highway Patrol.
Both of the above.
options.explanation: If you collide with a parked car or other property, leave a note with your name, phone number, and address securely attached to what you hit. You must report the collision to the local city police or, if the collision was in an unincorporated area, to the California Highway Patrol (CHP).

dmv_test_9.question: If weather or light conditions require you to have your lights on while driving:

options.text: Use your parking lights.
Use your high beams.
Use your low beams.
options.explanation: Use your low beam headlights when driving in foggy, snowy, or rainy conditions. Light from high beam headlights will reflect back, causing glare and making it even more difficult to see ahead.

dmv_test_9.question: Which of the following is true about roadways on bridges and overpasses in cold, wet weather?

options.text: They tend to freeze before the rest of the road does.
options.explanation: Bridges and overpasses tend to freeze before the rest of the road does. They can hide spots of ice.

options.text: They do not freeze because they are made of concrete.
They tend to freeze after the rest of the road does.

dmv_test_9.question: When entering traffic after being parked at a curb, you:

options.text: Should drive more slowly than other traffic for 200 feet.
Should wait for a large enough gap to get up to the speed of traffic.
options.explanation: Any time that you merge into city or highway traffic, you should wait for a gap in traffic large enough for your vehicle to get up to the speed of other traffic.

options.text: Should wait for the first two vehicles to pass, then drive into the lane.

dmv_test_9.question: Use your headlights on rainy, snowy, or foggy days:

options.text: To keep your engine warm.
So others can see your vehicle.
options.explanation: On rainy, snowy, or foggy days, it may be difficult for other drivers to see your vehicle. Under these conditions, headlights make your vehicle easier to see. If the weather requires you to turn on your windshield wipers, you must also turn on your low beam headlights.

options.text: To warn others of bad weather conditions.

dmv_test_9.question: Check your rearview mirrors:

options.text: Often to see how traffic is moving behind you.
options.explanation: When driving, do not develop a fixed stare. Frequently check your rearview mirrors so you know the positions of vehicles near you.

options.text: To see if a vehicle is in your blind spot.
Only when you are slowing down.

dmv_test_9.question: If you drive faster than other vehicles on a road with one lane moving in each direction and continually pass the other cars, you will:

options.text: Get you to your destination much more quickly and safely.
Increase your chances of an collision.
options.explanation: You should avoid passing other vehicles on two-lane roads. Every time you pass a vehicle, your odds of being in a collision increase.

options.text: Help prevent traffic congestion.

dmv_test_9.question: You should signal continuously while turning because it:

options.text: Is illegal to turn off your signal before completing a turn.
Lets other drivers know what your intentions are.
options.explanation: You should always signal when turning, changing lanes, slowing down, or stopping so that other drivers, motorcyclists, bicyclists, and pedestrians will know your intentions.

options.text: Is always unsafe to turn off a signal before completing a turn.

dmv_test_9.question: You should turn on your headlights:

options.text: One half hour after sunset.
options.explanation: Headlights must be used one half hour after sunset until one half hour before sunrise, when windshield wipers are being used due to rain or snow, and in any other situation when visibility is less than 1,000 feet. They should be used when a car is being driven on a small country or mountain road, even in sunny weather.

options.text: When stopped at a railroad crossing.
When parked at a school.

dmv_test_9.question: You are approaching an intersection with a steady yellow traffic light. If you have not already entered the intersection, you should:

options.text: Speed up to beat the red light.
Reduce you speed and proceed carefully through the intersection.
Come to a safe stop.
options.explanation: When a steady yellow light appears on a traffic signal, you should prepare to stop. If you are already within the intersection, you should clear the intersection as quickly as possible.

dmv_test_9.question: There is a vehicle stopped on the right shoulder of the road with its hazard lights on. You should:

options.text: Change lanes to the left and speed up.
Slow down and pass very carefully.
options.explanation: If you see a vehicle’s hazard lights ahead, slow down. There may be a collision or other road emergency ahead. Stop and give assistance if asked by anyone, or pass very carefully.

options.text: Stop your vehicle until you can see what has happened.

dmv_test_9.question: This sign means:

options.text: Trucks entering.
Truck exit only.
Steep downgrade ahead.
options.explanation: This sign warns that a steep downgrade is ahead on the road. Drivers should check their brakes.

dmv_test_9.question: You just sold your vehicle. You must notify the DMV within ____ days.

options.text: Five
options.explanation: When you sell or transfer a vehicle, you must notify the DMV within five days.

dmv_test_9.question: Before returning to your original lane after passing another vehicle, you should:

options.text: Beep your horn.
See both headlights of the passed vehicle in your rearview mirror.
options.explanation: When passing is permitted, look for both headlights of the passed vehicle in your rearview mirror. Only then may you safely return to your original lane.

options.text: Flash your headlights.

dmv_test_9.question: If you are driving near a large commercial vehicle, you should:

options.text: Follow the large vehicle closely to reduce wind drag on your vehicle.
Avoid driving beside it for long stretches of time.
options.explanation: Because large commercial vehicles have large blind spots on each side, you should avoid driving beside them for long periods of time.

options.text: Drive on its right side when on curves and hills.

dmv_test_9.question: If you are involved in a traffic collision, you are required to complete and submit a written report to the DMV:

options.text: Only if you or the other driver is injured.
If there is property damage in excess of $1,000 or if there are any injuries.
options.explanation: If a collision results in death, any minor or major injury, or more than $1,000 in damage to anyone's property, each driver involved must file a report with the DMV within 10 days. In some cases, the driver's insurance agent, broker, or legal representative may file the report to represent the driver.

options.text: Only if you are at fault.

dmv_test_9.question: Always stop before crossing railroad tracks when:

options.text: There isn't room on the other side for you to completely cross the tracks.
options.explanation: Expect a train on any track, at any time, traveling in either direction. If you need to stop after crossing the tracks, wait until you can completely cross the tracks before proceeding. Make sure your vehicle clears the tracks before you stop.

options.text: The railroad crossing is located in a city or town that has frequent train traffic.
You are transporting two or more young children in a passenger vehicle.

dmv_test_9.question: When you see this yellow sign, you should:

options.text: Always stop at the crosswalk.
Stop at the crosswalk until a crossing guards signals for you to go.
Be prepared to stop if children are in the crosswalk.
options.explanation: A five-sided sign indicates that you are near a school. Be aware and stop if children are in the crosswalk.

dmv_test_10.question: You should use your horn when:

options.text: Another vehicle is in your way.
It may help prevent a collision.
options.explanation: Only use your horn when it is necessary to avoid collisions. Do not use your horn if a driver or bicyclist is moving slowly and you want him or her to drive faster or get out of your way.

options.text: Another driver makes a mistake.

dmv_test_10.question: Placard abuse will result in:

options.text: Placard revocation only.
Only a fine.
Placard revocation, a fine, and/or jail time.
options.explanation: Abuse of a disabled placard or plate is a misdemeanor. Placard abuse can result in the loss of special parking privileges, a fine of up to $1,000, and up to six months of jail time.

dmv_test_10.question: This sign means:

options.text: Slippery when wet.
options.explanation: All roads are slippery and dangerous when wet. This sign warns of conditions that can cause a driver to lose control of a car. A driver should slow down when coming upon wet pavement because it takes longer to stop.

options.text: Stop sign ahead.
No U-turn.

dmv_test_10.question: When driving at night, you should:

options.text: Always use your high beams.
Look directly at the headlights of an oncoming vehicle.
Increase your following distance.
options.explanation: Driving at night is more hazardous than daytime driving because the lowered visibility makes it difficult to judge speed, distances, and other potential hazards. Increase your following distance to help prevent a potential collision if the vehicle in front of you should stop abruptly. Use your headlights when driving at night, following the rules for proper usage of high beams and low beams.

dmv_test_10.question: On rainy, snowy, or foggy days, turn on your windshield wipers and use your headlights:

options.text: On the high beam setting.
So other drivers can see you.
options.explanation: Turn on your headlights when it is cloudy, raining, snowing, or foggy. If weather conditions require you to use your windshield wipers, you are required to turn on your low beam headlights.

options.text: Only when driving on the freeway.

dmv_test_10.question: If you approach a flashing red traffic light, you:

options.text: Are traveling in the wrong direction.
Must treat the intersection as if it is controlled by a stop sign.
options.explanation: Treat a flashing red light the same as a stop sign. Come to a complete stop at the stop line or, if there is no stop line, prior to the crosswalk and before entering the intersection. Yield to all other traffic and pedestrians.

options.text: May not proceed until it changes to green.

dmv_test_10.question: Flash your brake lights or turn on your emergency flashers if you:

options.text: Need to warn other drivers of a collision ahead.
options.explanation: If you can see a collision ahead, warn the drivers behind you by turning on your emergency flashers or by tapping your brake pedal quickly three or four times.

options.text: Are temporarily parked in a traffic lane to make delivery.
Are backing out of a parking space.

dmv_test_10.question: If you are feeling fatigued while driving, you should:

options.text: Increase your speed to reach your destination more quickly.
Increase the volume of your radio.
Find a safe parking area to take a short nap.
options.explanation: When driving, watch for warning signs of fatigue. You are too tired to drive safely if you are struggling to keep your eyes open, drifting from your lane, or turning up the radio and rolling down your windows to keep yourself awake. If you notice these signs, it is a good idea to find a safe place to park so you can refresh yourself with a short nap.

dmv_test_10.question: You are driving on a one-way street. You may only turn left onto another one-way street if:

options.text: You increase your speed before the turn.
Traffic on the street moves to the right.
Traffic on the street moves to the left.
options.explanation: You may turn left onto a one-way street that moves to the left if there is no sign prohibiting the turn. You may not turn left onto a one-way street where traffic moves to the right.

dmv_test_10.question: When may you legally drive around or under a railroad crossing gate?

options.text: Never.
options.explanation: Do not go around or under any lowered gate at a railroad crossing. Once the gate is raised, do not proceed across the tracks until you can see clearly in both directions and are sure there are no trains coming.

options.text: When you can see clearly in both directions.
When the warning lights are not flashing.

dmv_test_10.question: A U-turn is not permitted:

options.text: In a parking lot.
On or near any curve or hill.
options.explanation: You must never turn around while on or near any curve or hill. You may not be able to see oncoming traffic or pedestrians and may cause a collision.

options.text: On a straight roadway with a clear view for 500 feet in both directions.

dmv_test_10.question: A diamond-shaped sign means:

options.text: Yield.
Stop.
Warning.
options.explanation: Diamond-shaped signs are used to warn drivers of special conditions or hazards ahead. They are typically yellow or orange in color.

dmv_test_10.question: There are oncoming vehicles to your left and a row of parked vehicles to your right. You should steer:

options.text: Closer to the oncoming vehicles than the parked vehicles.
Closer to the parked vehicles than the oncoming vehicles.
A middle course between the oncoming and parked vehicles.
options.explanation: If there are oncoming vehicles to your left and a row of parked vehicles to your right, the best thing to do is to split the difference. Steer a middle course between the oncoming cars and the parked cars.

dmv_test_10.question: At a railroad crossing, you must:

options.text: Watch for vehicles that must stop at all railroad crossings (school buses, trucks carrying hazardous materials, etc.).
Watch for multiple trains.
Both of the above.
options.explanation: You must approach all railroad crossings with extreme caution and cross only when you know that no train is coming from either direction. Be aware of vehicles that must stop at all railroad crossings, such as school buses and trucks carrying hazardous materials.

dmv_test_10.question: Alcohol in any concentration is:

options.text: A stimulant.
A depressant.
options.explanation: Alcohol, in any concentration, is a depressant. It slows all nerve impulses and bodily functions, resulting in a lessening of inhibitions and negatively affecting a consumer's ability to concentrate and stay alert.

options.text: Neither of the above.

dmv_test_10.question: At intersections, crosswalks, and railroad crossings, you should always:

options.text: Stop, listen, and proceed cautiously.
Look to the sides of your vehicle to see what is coming.
options.explanation: Any time you come to a place where people may cross or enter your path, or where one line of traffic meets another, you should look to the left and right sides of your vehicle to make sure no one is coming.

options.text: Slowly pass vehicles that seem to be stopped for no reason.

dmv_test_10.question: If your vehicle has a two-part safety belt system, you should:

options.text: Use only the lap belt.
Use both the lap and shoulder belts.
options.explanation: If your vehicle has a two-part seat belt system, be sure to wear both the lap belt and the shoulder belt. Wearing either part alone greatly reduces your protection. If you have an automatic shoulder belt, be sure to buckle your lap belt as well.

options.text: Use only the shoulder belt.

dmv_test_10.question: This sign indicates a:

options.text: Railroad crossing.
options.explanation: Yellow signs with black markings are used to warn drivers about upcoming hazards or special conditions. Round signs are used only to warn about upcoming railroad crossings.

options.text: Pedestrian crossing.
No passing zone.

dmv_test_10.question: You may cross double yellow lines to pass another vehicle if the:

options.text: Vehicle in front of you moves to the right to let you pass.
Yellow line next to your side of the road is broken.
options.explanation: A broken yellow line in the center of the road indicates that traffic next to the broken yellow line may pass, if it is safe to do so.

options.text: Yellow line next to the opposite side of the road is broken.

dmv_test_10.question: If pedestrians are illegally crossing in the middle of the street instead of in a crosswalk, you:

options.text: Must stop for them.
options.explanation: You must yield to pedestrians at all times. If the pedestrians are jaywalking or crossing the street where they should not be, you must still stop for them.

options.text: Do not have to stop for them.
Should honk your horn at them.

dmv_test_10.question: You reach an intersection with stop signs on all four corners at the same time as the driver on your left. Who has the right-of-way?

options.text: The driver on your left has the right-of-way.
You have the right-of-way.
options.explanation: If two vehicles arrive at the same time to an intersection that has stop signs on all corners, the vehicle to the right has the right-of-way.

options.text: Whoever is signaling to make a turn has the right-of-way.

dmv_test_10.question: You must stop at the intersection ahead. Just before the intersection, you have to cross railroad tracks. You should stop before crossing the railroad tracks when:

options.text: There isn't room on the other side for you to completely cross the tracks.
options.explanation: If you need to stop after crossing railroad tracks, wait until you can completely cross the tracks before proceeding. Make sure your vehicle clears the tracks before you stop.

options.text: The crossing is located in a city or town with frequent train traffic.
You are transporting two or more children in a passenger vehicle.

dmv_test_10.question: You drive defensively when you:

options.text: Put one car length between you and the car ahead.
Look only at the car in front of you while driving.
Keep your eyes moving to look for possible hazards.
options.explanation: You are driving defensively when you are looking down the road for potential hazards. Constantly staring at the road directly in front of your vehicle is dangerous. As you scan ahead, be alert to vehicles around you.

dmv_test_10.question: You must file a report of a traffic accident occurring in California when:

options.text: Your vehicle fails a smog test.
You are involved in a collision and there is an injury.
options.explanation: When you have a collision, report it to DMV within 10 days if anyone was injured (no matter how slightly) or killed. You or your representative must make this report whether or not you caused the collision, even if the collision occurred on private property.

options.text: You change your insurance company.

dmv_test_10.question: When can you drive in a bike lane?

options.text: 30 minutes after sunset or 30 minutes before sunrise
On foggy days when visibility is low
200 feet before making a turn
options.explanation: When you are making a right turn, you must enter the bicycle lane no more than 200 feet before the corner or driveway entrance. Do not drive in the bicycle lane at any other time

dmv_test_10.question: Which of these vehicles must always stop before crossing railroad tracks?

options.text: Tank trucks with hazardous materials placards.
options.explanation: A diamond-shaped sign on a truck means that the load on the truck is potentially dangerous (containing gas, explosives, etc.). Vehicles displaying these signs are required to stop before crossing railroad tracks.

options.text: Motor homes or pickup trucks towing a boat trailer.
Sport utility vehicles carrying four or more persons.

dmv_test_10.question: When driving on a slippery surface, such as snow or ice:

options.text: Shift to a low gear before going down steep hills.
options.explanation: To prevent skidding on slippery surfaces, you should shift to a low gear before going down a steep hill. You should also follow farther behind the vehicle in front of you than you normally would. Quick stops should be avoided. Unless you have antilock brakes, pump the brakes to slow or stop.

options.text: Maintain traction by following other vehicles closely.
Pump your brakes to keep them from freezing.

dmv_test_10.question: You are crossing an intersection and an emergency vehicle is approaching while using its siren and flashing lights. You should:

options.text: Stop immediately in the intersection until it passes.
Pull to the right of the intersection and stop.
Continue through the intersection, pull to the right, and stop.
options.explanation: If you are in an intersection when you see an emergency vehicle approaching while using its flashing lights and/or siren, continue through the intersection and then drive to the right and stop. You must yield the right-of-way to any police vehicle, fire engine, ambulance, or other emergency vehicle using a siren or flashing lights.

dmv_test_10.question: A large truck is ahead of you and is turning right onto a street with two lanes in each direction. The truck:

options.text: May complete its turn in either of the two lanes.
May have to swing wide to complete the right turn.
options.explanation: When a vehicle makes a turn, the rear wheels follow a shorter path than the front wheels. The longer the vehicle, the bigger the difference between the paths of the front and rear wheels. Therefore, long trucks often have to swing wide to complete a right turn.

options.text: Must stay in the right lane at all times while turning.

dmv_test_10.question: If a road is slippery, maintain a following distance that is:

options.text: No different than normal.
Farther from the car ahead than normal.
options.explanation: You need a longer distance to stop your vehicle on a slippery road than you do on a dry road. Maintain an increased following distance when driving on slippery roads.

options.text: Closer to the car ahead than normal.

dmv_test_10.question: This road sign means:

options.text: You are about to enter a one-way street from the wrong direction.
options.explanation: This sign marks a one-way road, entrance, or exit. If you are facing this sign, traffic is coming toward you. Turn around if you are driving toward this sign.

options.text: U-turns are prohibited.
You may proceed if the way is clear.

dmv_test_10.question: If you have an argument with another person and you are angry, you should:

options.text: Loudly play the radio while driving so you won’t think about your argument.
Take a few minutes to cool off before driving.
options.explanation: Your emotions affect your ability to drive safely.
