If you are overly angry, excited, afraid, worried, or depressed, you should give yourself time to calm down before operating a vehicle. You need to be able to mentally focus on driving without thinking about the things that made you upset.

options.text: Drive on the interstate to let off steam.

dmv_test_10.question: You can help keep the driver behind you a safe distance away from your vehicle by:

options.text: Driving 10 mph faster than the car behind you.
Driving 10 mph slower than the car behind you.
Maintaining a steady speed.
options.explanation: It is not always easy to maintain a safe distance behind your vehicle. However, you can help keep the driver behind you a safe distance away from your vehicle by maintaining a steady speed and signaling turns, lane changes, and deceleration in advance.

dmv_test_10.question: A peace officer is signaling for you to drive to the edge of the roadway. You decide to ignore the officer's warning and flee the scene. You are guilty of a misdemeanor and can be punished by being:

options.text: Fined up to $1,000.
Jailed in the county jail for not more than one year.
options.explanation: Any person, while operating a motor vehicle, who willfully flees or attempts to evade a peace officer performing his or her duties is guilty of a misdemeanor punishable by imprisonment in a county jail for not more than one year.

options.text: Given a warning and a citation.

dmv_test_10.question: Animals may be transported in the back of a pickup truck only if:

options.text: The sides of the truck bed are at least 18 inches high.
They are properly secured.
options.explanation: An animal must not be transported in the back of a pickup or other truck unless the animal is properly secured to prevent it from falling, jumping, or being thrown from the vehicle.

options.text: The tailgate of the truck is closed.

dmv_test_10.question: What is the benefit of a space cushion around your vehicle?

options.text: Other drivers can cut in front of you, improving the flow of traffic.
If another driver makes a mistake, you have time to react.
options.explanation: Keeping space around your vehicle is important to ensure that you have time to safely react if another driver makes a mistake. For example, extra space around your vehicle may give you time to brake or maneuver out of the way of a vehicle veering into your lane.

options.text: It inflates to protect you from injury in the case of a collision.

dmv_test_11.question: A broken yellow line beside a solid yellow line indicates that:

options.text: Passing is permitted from the lane next to the solid yellow line.
Passing is not permitted from either direction.
Passing is permitted from the lane next to the broken yellow line.
options.explanation: A broken yellow line alongside a solid yellow line means that traffic in the lane next to the broken line may cross the line to pass, while traffic in the lane next to the solid line may not.

dmv_test_11.question: You were parked and have been waiting a long time with your turn signal on to re-enter traffic. However, traffic is heavy. You should:

options.text: Continue waiting and yielding to traffic in the lane.
options.explanation: If you have been parked on the side of a road, you must yield to existing traffic when re-entering the road.

options.text: Slowly inch your vehicle into the traffic lane.
Drive on the shoulder until a gap in traffic appears.

dmv_test_11.question: This road sign means:

options.text: Bicycle crossing.
options.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. These signs alert drivers to areas where bicycles may be crossing.

options.text: Stop only if other cars are approaching.
Yield the right-of-way to pedestrians.

dmv_test_11.question: You must obey instructions from school crossing guards:

options.text: At all times.
options.explanation: Drivers should be alert to the presence of crossing guards when near a school and must always obey their instructions.

options.text: Only during school hours.
Unless you do not see any children present.

dmv_test_11.question: Roadways are the most slippery:

options.text: During a heavy downpour.
After it has been raining for awhile.
During the first rain after a dry spell.
options.explanation: Many roads are most slippery during the first rain after a dry spell because oil and dust on the road have not previously been washed away.

dmv_test_11.question: You see a signal person at a road construction site ahead. You should obey his or her instructions:

options.text: Only if you see orange cones on the road ahead.
Unless they conflict with existing signs, signals, or laws.
At all times.
options.explanation: Obey special signs or instructions from flaggers. Driving carefully through work zones improves safety for drivers, pedestrians, bicyclists, and road workers.

dmv_test_11.question: If there is no crosswalk and you see a pedestrian crossing your lane, you should:

options.text: Make sure the pedestrian can see you before proceeding.
Cautiously drive around the pedestrian.
Stop and let the pedestrian finish crossing.
options.explanation: Drivers must always yield the right-of-way to pedestrians in the roadway, even if there is not a marked crosswalk.

dmv_test_11.question: While driving at night, a vehicle coming toward you has its high beams on, making it hard for you to see the road ahead. You should:

options.text: Look ahead toward the left edge of your lane.
Look ahead toward the right edge of your lane.
options.explanation: If an oncoming driver fails to dim their high beams, you should avoid looking directly at the headlights. Instead, look toward the right edge of your lane and watch the oncoming vehicle out of the corner of your eye.

options.text: Look straight ahead in your lane.

dmv_test_11.question: When preparing to make a left turn from a two-way street, you should drive:

options.text: Near the right-hand side of the road.
Near the centerline.
options.explanation: When you are turning left from a two-way street, begin in the lane closest to the centerline and start your turn just before the front of your car reaches the center of the intersection. Do not cut the corner. Steering hand-over-hand, turn into the first available legal lane.

options.text: On the left of the centerline.

dmv_test_11.question: What is a potential effect of taking a prescription drug while drinking alcohol?

options.text: There will likely be no effect.
It will make you more alert.
It can make you unfit to drive.
options.explanation: Legal medications, both prescription and over-the-counter, can impair your ability to drive. They can be particularly dangerous when used in combination with alcohol.

dmv_test_11.question: All of the following practices are dangerous to do while driving. Which of these is also illegal?

options.text: Listening to music through headphones that cover both ears.
options.explanation: Even people with good hearing cannot hear well if the radio or CD player is blaring. Do not wear a headset or earplugs in both ears while driving; it is against the law.

options.text: Adjusting your outside mirrors.
Transporting an unrestrained animal inside the vehicle.

dmv_test_11.question: You are approaching a railroad crossing with no warning devices and are unable to see 400 feet down the tracks in one direction. The speed limit is:

options.text: 15 mph.
options.explanation: Within 100 feet of a railroad crossing where you cannot see 400 feet down the tracks in both directions, the speed limit is 15 mph. However, you may drive faster if the crossing is controlled by gates, a warning signal, or a flagger.

options.text: 20 mph.
25 mph.

dmv_test_11.question: Highway pavement will be particularly treacherous and most slippery:

options.text: If it has been raining several hours.
If it has just begun to rain.
options.explanation: Pavement is particularly treacherous when it first begins to rain. Accumulations of dirt and oil mix with the rainwater, creating a greasy film on the roadway.

options.text: If it has been raining for one to two hours.

dmv_test_11.question: Drivers turning left must yield to:

options.text: Overtaking cars.
Oncoming cars.
options.explanation: Drivers turning left must yield to oncoming vehicles that are driving straight ahead. A turning driver may only proceed when they can safely turn without affecting oncoming traffic.

options.text: No one.

dmv_test_11.question: When you are merging onto the freeway, you should be driving:

options.text: At or near the speed of traffic on the freeway.
options.explanation: When merging onto a freeway, you should enter at or near the speed of traffic.

options.text: Five to 10 mph slower than the speed of traffic on the freeway.
The posted speed limit for freeway traffic.

dmv_test_11.question: It is against the law to enter an intersection when:

options.text: You can't get all the way across before the light turns red.
options.explanation: Do not enter an intersection if you cannot get completely across before the traffic signal light turns red. If you block the intersection, you can be cited.

options.text: The light is flashing yellow and you didn't stop first.
The light is yellow and you cannot stop safely.

dmv_test_11.question: If you are about to be hit from the rear, you should consider each of the following, except for:

options.text: Applying your brakes.
Letting go of the steering wheel.
options.explanation: If your vehicle is hit from the rear while you are in forward motion, your body will be thrown backward. Press yourself against the back of your seat and put your head against the head restraint to prevent whiplash. Maintain a firm grip on the steering wheel and be ready to apply your brakes to avoid being pushed into another vehicle.

options.text: Pressing your head firmly against the head restraint.

dmv_test_11.question: A white painted curb indicates a:

options.text: Loading zone for freight or passengers.
Loading zone for passengers or mail only.
options.explanation: At a white painted curb, you may stop only long enough to pick up or drop off passengers or mail.

options.text: Loading zone for freight only.

dmv_test_11.question: If you are involved in a traffic accident in California, you must file a report of the accident with the DMV when:

options.text: The collision causes $1,000 in damage.
options.explanation: If a collision results in death, any minor or major injury, or more than $1,000 in damage to anyone's property, each driver involved must file a report with the DMV within 10 days. In some cases, the driver's insurance agent, broker, or legal representative may file the report to represent the driver.

options.text: You plan on being out of the state for more than 30 days.
You refinance the remaining balance of your vehicle loan.

dmv_test_11.question: You are driving on a freeway with a posted speed limit of 65 mph. Traffic is heavy and moving at 35 mph. The best speed for your vehicle is most likely:

options.text: 25 mph.
35 mph.
options.explanation: Collisions are more likely to happen when one driver travels more quickly or more slowly than the other vehicles on the road. You should enter a freeway at or near the speed of traffic, unless the speed of traffic exceeds the legal speed limit.

options.text: 30 mph.

dmv_test_11.question: If you want to pass a pedestrian who is walking along the roadway and an oncoming vehicle is approaching, you should:

options.text: Slow down and let the oncoming vehicle pass before you pass the pedestrian.
options.explanation: If possible, try to only deal with one roadway hazard at a time. If you want to pass a pedestrian but an oncoming vehicle is approaching, slow down and let the vehicle pass. You may then pass the pedestrian if it is safe to do so.

options.text: Keep driving at a steady speed. The oncoming vehicle must stop for you.
Honk your horn to get the pedestrian to move over.

dmv_test_11.question: Temporary signs used in construction and maintenance work areas:

options.text: Have a red background with green writing.
Have an orange background with black writing.
options.explanation: All temporary signs in work zones have orange backgrounds with black writing and/or symbols.

options.text: Have a yellow background with blue writing.

dmv_test_11.question: This sign means:

options.text: Trucks under 18,000 pounds are allowed.
Hill ahead.
options.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. This sign indicates that there is a steep hill ahead. Slow down and be ready to shift to a lower gear to control your speed and protect your brakes from damage.

options.text: Truck stop ahead.

dmv_test_11.question: You should signal at least how many feet before you turn?

options.explanation: You should signal at least 100 feet before you turn, before every lane change, at least five seconds before you change lanes on a freeway, before pulling next to the curb or away from the curb, even when you do not see other vehicles around you, and when you are almost through the intersection if you plan to turn shortly after crossing the intersection. Remember to turn off your signal when you no longer need it.

dmv_test_11.question: If your car becomes disabled while on the highway, you should:

options.text: Stop in the right lane.
Park with all four wheels off the traveled highway, if possible.
options.explanation: If your vehicle becomes disabled, you must (if possible) park with all four wheels off of the main-traveled portion of the road.

options.text: Stop where you are.

dmv_test_11.question: When double solid yellow lines separate lanes of traffic:

options.text: Passing is permitted from the left.
Passing is permitted from the right.
Passing is not permitted from either direction.
options.explanation: Yellow lines separating lanes of traffic indicate that traffic is moving in opposite directions. Double solid lines indicate that passing is not permitted from either direction.

dmv_test_11.question: Driving under the influence of any medication which impairs your driving is permitted:

options.text: Under no circumstances.
options.explanation: It is illegal to drive under the influence of any substance that impairs your ability to drive safely. This includes alcohol, prescription medications, over-the-counter medications, and illegal drugs.

options.text: If you don't feel drowsy.
If it is prescribed by a physician.

dmv_test_11.question: Drivers are required to obey instructions from:

options.text: Security guards patrolling parking lots.
Other drivers whose vehicles are broken down on the roadway.
Flaggers (signal persons) at construction sites.
options.explanation: Drivers must obey special signs or instructions given by flaggers. They are in place to keep drivers and workers safe.

dmv_test_11.question: Collisions are more likely to happen when:

options.text: All vehicles are traveling at about the same speed.
One lane of traffic is traveling faster than the other lanes.
One vehicle is traveling faster or slower than the flow of traffic.
options.explanation: Collisions are more likely to happen when one driver moves faster or slower than the other vehicles on the road. Driving faster than other traffic increases your chance of being involved in a collision. Driving more slowly than other traffic is also dangerous because it can increase the risk of a rear-end collision with your vehicle or cause other drivers to swerve to avoid hitting you.

dmv_test_11.question: A school bus is stopped ahead of you in your lane with its red lights flashing. You should:

options.text: Stop and proceed when you think all of the children have exited the bus.
Slow to 25 mph and pass cautiously.
Stop for as long as the red lights are flashing.
options.explanation: When a stopped school bus is using its flashing red lights, approaching drivers must stop and remain stopped until the lights stop flashing. If the school bus is on the opposite side of a divided highway, drivers do not need to stop.

dmv_test_11.question: If you have a green light but traffic is blocking the intersection, you should:

options.text: Stay out of the intersection until traffic clears.
options.explanation: Even if your traffic light is green, you must not enter an intersection unless you can get completely across the intersection before the light turns red. If you block the intersection, you can be cited.

options.text: Enter the intersection and wait until traffic clears.
Merge into another lane and try to go around the traffic.

dmv_test_11.question: If you are being passed in a no passing zone, you should:

options.text: Pull off the road.
Maintain your speed and position.
Slow down and let the other driver safely return to the drive lane.
options.explanation: Passing areas are based on how far ahead drivers can see. Allow the passing vehicle to re-enter the drive lane as easily as possible to help everyone avoid potential upcoming hazards.

dmv_test_11.question: What does this road sign indicate?

options.text: Directions for children
School zone ahead
options.explanation: Pentagonal signs indicate that you are in or are approaching a school zone and/or school crossing. Be aware of children when driving near a school zone and follow posted speed limits.

options.text: Playground area ahead

dmv_test_11.question: This sign means:

options.text: No U-turn.
options.explanation: This sign indicates that U-turns are prohibited.

options.text: Traffic signal ahead.
Railroad ahead.

dmv_test_11.question: You may make a left turn on a red light only from a:

options.text: One-way street onto a two-way street.
One-way street onto a one-way street.
options.explanation: You may turn left against a red light when you are turning from a one-way street onto a one-way street. Make sure there is no sign prohibiting the turn. Yield to other vehicles, pedestrians, or bicyclists who have a green light. Look both ways and turn when it is safe.

options.text: Two-way street onto a one-way street.

dmv_test_11.question: You enter a designated turn lane to make a left turn at an upcoming intersection. There is oncoming traffic. You should:

options.text: Move to the left of the center lane.
Signal before you arrive at the intersection.
options.explanation: When making a left turn, you should always begin signaling about 100 feet before the turn. You should keep your front wheels aiming straight ahead until it is safe to start your turn. This ensures that you will not be pushed into oncoming traffic if another vehicle hits you from behind.

options.text: Turn your front wheels to the left to be prepared to turn.

dmv_test_12.question: You are driving on a freeway with a posted speed limit of 65 mph. Traffic is traveling at 70 mph. You may legally drive:

options.text: 70 mph or faster to keep up with the speed of traffic.
Between 65 mph and 70 mph.
No faster than 65 mph.
options.explanation: On most California highways, the maximum speed limit is 65 mph. You may drive at 70 mph only if the speed limit is posted as such.

dmv_test_12.question: When driving in fog, it is best to drive with:

options.text: High beam headlights.
Low beam headlights.
options.explanation: Use your low beam headlights when driving in fog, rain, or snow. High beam lights can reflect off the weather conditions, lowering visibility even more.

options.text: Four-way flashers.

dmv_test_12.question: If your wheels drop off the roadway or pavement edge, you should:

options.text: Wait until it is safe to do so, then gradually re-enter the roadway.
options.explanation: If your wheels drop off the roadway or pavement edge, do not attempt to turn back onto the roadway immediately. Instead, reduce your speed, check traffic, and gradually turn back onto the roadway when it is safe to do so.

options.text: Turn back onto the roadway immediately.
Stop.

dmv_test_12.question: As you enter into a roundabout, you should slow down and:

options.text: Yield to any crossing pedestrians and bicyclists.
Yield to any car already within the roundabout.
Both of the above.
options.explanation: When entering a roundabout, you must yield to pedestrians, bicyclists, and traffic already in the roundabout.

dmv_test_12.question: Streets and highways are most slippery:

options.text: When it has been raining hard for several hours.
When they are clean and dry.
Just after it starts to rain.
options.explanation: Driving during the first half hour of rainfall is dangerous because roadways become extremely slippery when the water mixes with oil and other chemicals on the road surfaces that have not yet washed away. Use extra caution when driving on slippery roads.

dmv_test_12.question: If you hit an animal with your vehicle while driving on a California highway, you should:

options.text: Move the injured animal off the road.
Call the humane society.
options.explanation: If you injure or kill an animal on the roadway, you should call CHP, the nearest humane society, or the police. You should not leave the animal to die or try to move the animal.

options.text: Continue driving.

dmv_test_12.question: Pedestrians crossing at corners have the right-of-way:

options.text: Only at controlled intersections.
Only when a crosswalk is painted on the street.
Whether or not a crosswalk is marked.
options.explanation: Respect the right-of-way of pedestrians. Always stop for any pedestrian crossing at a corner or crosswalk, even if the corner is without traffic signal lights. You should stop for pedestrians crossing at any crosswalk, whether or not the crosswalk is marked by painted lines.

dmv_test_12.question: This road sign means:

options.text: No right turn.
Drive only in the direction of the arrow.
options.explanation: Regulatory signs provide notice to road users of traffic laws that must be obeyed. Where this sign is present, drivers must drive in the direction indicated by the arrow.

options.text: Curve ahead.

dmv_test_12.question: You are involved in a minor collision at an intersection. There are no injuries and there is very little vehicle damage. You should:

options.text: Leave your vehicle in the traffic lane until law enforcement arrives.
Move your vehicle out of the traffic lane, if possible.
options.explanation: After a collision, if no one has been injured or killed and you can safely do so, you should move your vehicle out of the traffic lane.

options.text: Not move your vehicle for any reason.

dmv_test_12.question: When crossing a sidewalk to enter traffic from an alley or driveway, drivers should:

options.text: Stop only if pedestrians are on the sidewalk.
Stop before driving onto the sidewalk or sidewalk area.
options.explanation: When leaving an alley, driveway, or parking lot to enter a roadway, you must stop before driving onto a sidewalk or sidewalk area. Pedestrians and existing traffic have the right-of-way.

options.text: Expect pedestrians on the sidewalk to yield the right-of-way.

dmv_test_12.question: If your car begins to skid out of control, you should:

options.text: Pump the brakes.
Apply the brakes lightly.
Stay off the brakes.
options.explanation: If your vehicle begins to skid, stay off the brakes. Continue to correct your steering until the vehicle is back under your control and moving safely down the road.

dmv_test_12.question: If you are riding in a vehicle equipped with a lap belt and a separate shoulder belt, you are:

options.text: Only required to use the lap belt.
Required to use both the lap and shoulder belts.
options.explanation: If your vehicle is equipped with a lap belt and a separate shoulder belt, you are required to use both.

options.text: Only required to use the shoulder belt.

dmv_test_12.question: When passing, you should move back into the right lane when:

options.text: You are one vehicle length ahead of the passed vehicle.
You can see both headlights of the passed vehicle in your rearview mirror.
options.explanation: Do not pass unless you have enough space to return to the driving lane. Before you return to the driving lane, be sure you have enough room between yourself and the vehicle you have passed. When you can see both headlights of the passed vehicle in your rearview mirror, it is safe to return to the driving lane.

options.text: You are 50 feet ahead of the passed vehicle.

dmv_test_12.question: Double solid yellow lane markings mean that:

options.text: Neither lane may pass.
options.explanation: Yellow lane markings indicate a separation of lanes where traffic is traveling in opposite directions. When you see double solid yellow lane markings, passing is prohibited from both directions.

options.text: Both lanes may pass.
The lane to the right may pass.

dmv_test_12.question: If the driver of an oncoming vehicle fails to dim their headlights:

options.text: Look toward the center of the roadway.
Look toward the right side of the road.
options.explanation: If an oncoming driver fails to dim their headlights, look toward the right side of the road. This will keep you from being blinded by the other vehicle’s headlights and allow you to see enough of the road to stay on course. Do not try to retaliate by keeping your bright lights on.

options.text: Look straight ahead.

dmv_test_12.question: This sign means:

options.text: Upcoming downgrade or hill.
options.explanation: This sign warns of a dangerous downgrade or hill ahead. The hill may be very long or steep, or it may have sharp curves.

options.text: Road construction area.
Upcoming narrowing of roadway.

dmv_test_12.question: When driving under low-visibility conditions due to fog, you should:

options.text: Turn on your high beam headlights.
Slow down and use your low beam headlights.
options.explanation: When driving in fog, you should slow down and use your low beam lights. If the fog is so dense that you cannot see, pull off the road and wait for the fog to clear.

options.text: Increase your speed so you do not cause an accident.

dmv_test_12.question: This sign is used to warn drivers that:

options.text: The right lane is ending and traffic should merge left.
options.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. This sign warns drivers that the number of lanes is reduced ahead and that traffic should merge left.

options.text: The road curves ahead.
There are upcoming intersections.

dmv_test_12.question: When should you yield your legal right-of-way?

options.text: Often, even at controlled intersections.
Whenever it helps prevent collisions.
options.explanation: Never assume other drivers will give you the right-of-way. Yield your right-of-way whenever it helps prevent collisions.

options.text: Never. It confuses other drivers.

dmv_test_12.question: A safety zone is a specially marked area for passengers to get on or off of buses or trolleys. You may not drive through a safety zone:

options.text: When a bus or trolley is present.
When a bus or trolley is unloading passengers.
At any time for any reason.
options.explanation: You may never drive through a safety zone. This space is set aside for pedestrians.

dmv_test_12.question: Allow extra space in front of your vehicle when following a:

options.text: Station wagon.
Passenger vehicle.
Motorcycle.
options.explanation: Allow for extra space when driving behind a motorcycle. Motorcycles can stop more quickly than other vehicles can and you must have adequate room to stop if the motorcyclist brakes or falls off. Also, remember that motorcycles are difficult to see at night because they only have one tail light.

dmv_test_12.question: Various traffic control devices in construction and maintenance work areas are the color:

options.text: Red.
Orange.
options.explanation: Orange warning signs are used in and around work zones. Use special caution when you see orange signs, cones, or barriers on a roadway.

options.text: Yellow.

dmv_test_12.question: The speed limit on a school zone where children are present is ____, unless otherwise posted.

options.text: 15 mph
25 mph
options.explanation: When driving within 500 to 1,000 feet of a school while children are outside or crossing the street, the speed limit is 25 mph, unless otherwise posted. Some school zones may have speed limits as low as 15 mph.

options.text: 20 mph

dmv_test_12.question: At a crosswalk:

options.text: You must yield to pedestrians.
options.explanation: Pedestrians have the right-of-way at street crossings but must obey traffic control signals. Where a traffic signal is not present, vehicles must stop for pedestrians in a crosswalk, whether it is marked or unmarked.

options.text: Pedestrians must yield to you.
Construction workers must yield to you.

dmv_test_12.question: Make room for cars that are entering the freeway by:

options.text: Slowing down.
Merging into a different lane.
options.explanation: Make room for vehicles that are entering a freeway. If possible, merge into the next lane to create a gap for the incoming vehicles. If you cannot merge, adjust your speed to allow for the vehicles to enter traffic as smoothly and safely as possible.

options.text: Maintaining your speed and position.

dmv_test_12.question: A curb painted red means:

options.text: Loading zone.
The area is reserved for picking up or dropping off passengers.
No parking, standing, or stopping.
options.explanation: You may not stop, stand, or park at a red-painted curb.

dmv_test_12.question: The best thing to do if you become tired while driving is to:

options.text: Stop to rest or change drivers.
options.explanation: If you become tired while driving, it is best to stop to rest or change drivers. Being tired dulls your mind and slows down your reactions, making driving hazardous.

options.text: Drink coffee.
Open a window.

dmv_test_12.question: When is it legal for minors to use a cell phone without a hands-free device while driving?

options.text: When making a call while stopped at the red light
When making a call for emergency assistance
options.explanation: It is illegal for minors to use a cell phone at all while driving, except to contact an emergency entity in an emergency situation. For adult drivers, the use of hands-free devices is permitted; however, to avoid distractions, it is advisable to make calls only if needed to call for help in an emergency.

options.text: Never

dmv_test_12.question: Abandoning an animal on the highway may result in:

options.text: Jail time.
options.explanation: It is illegal to dump or abandon an animal on the highway. Doing so can result in six months of jail time, a fine of up to $1,000, or both.

options.text: A point against your license.
No legal consequences.

dmv_test_12.question: If a traffic signal light is green and a police officer signals for you to stop, you should:

options.text: Obey the officer.
options.explanation: Drivers must obey any instructions given by a police officer, even if the instructions contradict laws, signs, signals, or markings that would otherwise apply.

options.text: Obey the traffic signal.
Do what the vehicle in front of you does.

dmv_test_12.question: Three of the most important times to check for traffic behind you are before:

options.text: Backing, making a sharp turn, or crossing an intersection.
Backing, changing lanes, or slowing down quickly.
options.explanation: It is important to check behind you before changing lanes, reducing your speed, backing up, or driving down a long or steep hill.

options.text: Changing lanes, crossing intersections, or slowing down quickly.

dmv_test_12.question: You may legally block an intersection:

options.text: If you entered the intersection on the green light.
During rush hour traffic.
Under no circumstances.
options.explanation: Even if the light is green, you may not enter an intersection unless you can get completely across before the light turns red. If you block the intersection, you can be cited.

dmv_test_12.question: To avoid last-minute moves, you should be looking down the road to where your vehicle will be in about:

options.text: 5 to 10 seconds.
10 to 15 seconds.
options.explanation: To avoid last-minute moves, you should scan the road 10 to 15 seconds ahead of your vehicle. This allows you to see hazards before meeting them.

options.text: 15 to 20 seconds.

dmv_test_12.question: All of the following are dangerous to do while driving. Which is also illegal?

options.text: Wearing a headset that covers both ears
options.explanation: Do not wear a headset or earplugs in both ears while driving; it is against the law. You must be able to be aware of all possible surrounding hazards.

options.text: Having one or more interior lights on
Using cruise control on residential streets

dmv_test_12.question: When you see an emergency vehicle approaching while using its flashing lights, you must:

options.text: Maintain your speed and stay in your lane until the vehicle has passed.
Move into the right lane and drive slowly until the vehicle has passed.
Pull over to the curb or edge of the road and stop until the vehicle has passed.
options.explanation: If you see an emergency vehicle approaching while using its flashing lights, pull over to the right edge of the road and stop. Position yourself parallel to the curb. On one-way streets, drive toward the road edge nearest you.

dmv_test_12.question: You are getting ready to make a right turn. You should:

options.text: Signal and turn immediately.
Stop before entering the right lane and let all other traffic go first.
Slow down or stop, if necessary, and then make the turn.
options.explanation: When making a right turn, you should begin signaling about 100 feet before the turn, reduce your speed, stop behind the limit line (if applicable), and then make the turn.

dmv_test_13.question: In traffic moving at 50 to 55 mph, you are least likely to have an accident if you:

options.text: Drive a few miles per hour faster than most other vehicles.
Stay within that speed range.
options.explanation: You should adjust your speed to travel smoothly with the other traffic on a roadway (provided that the other traffic is driving within the posted speed limits). Remember that vehicles moving in the same direction at the same speed cannot hit each other. Crashes involving multiple vehicles often happen when some vehicles are traveling at different speeds than others.

options.text: Drive a few miles per hour slower than most other vehicles.

dmv_test_13.question: What is the only effective way to remove alcohol from the body?

options.text: Drink strong coffee.
Wait.
options.explanation: The only way to remove the effects of alcohol from the body is to let time pass. Eating, drinking coffee, or taking a shower will not speed up this process.

options.text: Take a cold shower.

dmv_test_13.question: "No passing zone" signs tell drivers:

options.text: To speed up slightly.
That it is not safe to pass.
options.explanation: If you come across a "No passing zone" sign, it is not legal to pass in the indicated area. You are likely driving in an area with restricted visibility where it would be unsafe to pass another vehicle.

options.text: To maintain a steady speed.

dmv_test_13.question: If a tire suddenly blows out while you are driving, you should:

options.text: Grip the steering wheel firmly, slow down, and exit the traffic lane.
options.explanation: If you experience a sudden tire blowout, do not panic. Grasp the steering wheel firmly and take your foot off the accelerator to allow the vehicle to roll to a stop. Lightly apply the breaks when it is safe to do so. Do not move to the shoulder of the road until the car has slowed considerably.

options.text: Pump the brakes rapidly.
Brake hard and steer toward the right edge of the roadway.

dmv_test_13.question: There are two traffic lanes moving in your direction. You are driving in the left lane and many vehicles are passing you on the right. If the driver behind you wishes to drive faster, you should:

options.text: Stay in your lane so you don't impede the flow of traffic.
Drive onto the left shoulder to let the other vehicles pass.
Move into the right lane when it is safe.
options.explanation: To drive quickly, pass, or turn left, use the left lane. Use the right lane when driving more slowly than surrounding traffic, entering the road, or turning right.

dmv_test_13.question: Driving under the influence of any medication which impairs your driving is permitted:

options.text: Under no circumstances.
options.explanation: It is illegal to drive under the influence of any substance that impairs your ability to drive safely. This includes alcohol, prescription medications, over-the-counter medications, and illegal drugs.

options.text: If you don't feel drowsy.
If it is prescribed by a physician.

dmv_test_13.question: In a vehicle equipped with airbags, the safest place for children age 12 and under to ride is in:

options.text: The front seat.
The back seat.
options.explanation: While airbags provide supplemental protection for adults in the event of a crash, they pose a severe safety risk for children. Anyone age 12 or under should sit in the back seat of a vehicle with airbags.

options.text: The bed of a pick-up truck.

dmv_test_13.question: This sign means:

options.text: Crossroad ahead.
options.explanation: This sign indicates that there is a crossroad ahead.

options.text: Merge.
Stop.

dmv_test_13.question: What is the difference between traffic lights with red arrows and those with solid red lights?

options.text: Red arrows are only used to stop traffic which is turning.
Red arrows are only used for protected turn lanes.
You cannot turn on a red arrow, even if you stop first.
options.explanation: You may sometimes turn right when stopped by a solid red light. You may never turn left or right when stopped by a traffic light with a red arrow.

dmv_test_13.question: After passing a vehicle, it is safe to return to your driving lane when:

options.text: The driver you passed signals for you to return to your lane.
You signal your intention for three seconds.
You see the headlights of the passed vehicle in your rearview mirror.
options.explanation: Before you return to your driving lane, be sure you are not dangerously close to the vehicle you have just passed. One way to do this is to look for the vehicle in your inside rearview mirror. When you can see both headlights in your rearview mirror, you may have enough room to return to your driving lane.

dmv_test_13.question: You just sold your vehicle. You must notify the DMV within ____ days.

options.text: Five
options.explanation: When you sell or transfer a vehicle, you must notify the DMV within five days.

dmv_test_13.question: Roadways are the most slippery:

options.text: During a heavy downpour.
After it has been raining for awhile.
During the first rain after a dry spell.
options.explanation: Many roads are most slippery during the first rain after a dry spell because oil and dust on the road have not previously been washed away.

dmv_test_13.question: Drivers are required to obey instructions from:

options.text: Security guards patrolling parking lots.
Other drivers whose vehicles are broken down on the roadway.
Flaggers (signal persons) at construction sites.
options.explanation: Drivers must obey special signs or instructions given by flaggers. They are in place to keep drivers and workers safe.

dmv_test_13.question: The best way to avoid a dangerous situation while driving is to:

options.text: Know what is happening around your vehicle.
options.explanation: Always be aware of what is happening around your vehicle. Constantly observing your surroundings to the front, sides, and rear of your vehicle will help you see problems that may require you to change speed or roadway position.

options.text: Turn off the radio.
Always keep your eyes focused ahead of your car.

dmv_test_13.question: Just like alcohol and other drugs, drowsiness can:

options.text: Help you to be a better driver.
Make you feel better.
Impair your judgment.
options.explanation: Not getting enough sleep is a cause of poor driving behavior. Just like drugs and alcohol, sleepiness slows reaction time, decreases awareness, and impairs judgment.

dmv_test_13.question: Stopping distances and severity of crashes:

options.text: Decrease as vehicle speed increases.
Are not affected by vehicle speed.
Increase as vehicle speed increases.
options.explanation: Stopping distances are longer and crashes are more severe when traffic travels at higher speeds.

dmv_test_13.question: This sign means:

options.text: Pedestrian crossing.
options.explanation: This sign indicates that there is a pedestrian crosswalk.

options.text: Side road.
Railroad ahead.

dmv_test_13.question: The safest precaution that you can take when using cellular phones while driving is:

options.text: To use hands-free devices so you can keep both hands on the steering wheel.
options.explanation: Minors may not use a cellular phone while driving, except for certain emergencies. Cell phones are allowed to be used by drivers over age 18, but a hands-free device should be used.

options.text: To keep your phone within easy reach so you won't need to take your eyes off the road.
To review the number before answering a call.

dmv_test_13.question: Double solid yellow line markings down the center of a road indicate that passing is:

options.text: Allowed from both directions.
Allowed only from your direction of travel.
Not allowed from either direction.
options.explanation: A double yellow centerline means that it is prohibited for traffic from either direction to cross the centerline to pass.

dmv_test_13.question: A sign with this shape means:

options.text: Railroad crossing.
Warning.
options.explanation: A diamond-shaped yellow sign warns of possible danger ahead. Orange signs, which are mostly diamond-shaped, are used to warn of possible dangers in or near work areas.

options.text: Signal ahead.

dmv_test_13.question: To turn left from a one-way street onto a one-way street, start from:

options.text: The lane closest to the left curb.
options.explanation: When turning left from a one-way street onto a one-way street, start the turn from the far left lane. Watch for pedestrians, motorcyclists, and bicyclists between your vehicle and the curb because they may also legally use the left turn lane for their left turns. Turn into any lane that is safely open.

options.text: The center lane.
Any lane, as long as it seems safe to do so.

dmv_test_13.question: This sign means:

options.text: Yield sign ahead.
options.explanation: This sign indicates that there is a yield sign ahead. You should begin to slow down when you see this warning sign.

options.text: Side road entering from left.
Stop sign ahead.

dmv_test_13.question: If you drive more slowly than the flow of traffic, you will most likely:

options.text: Interfere with traffic and receive a ticket.
options.explanation: You must drive more slowly than usual when there is heavy traffic or bad weather. However, if you block the normal and reasonable movement of traffic by driving too slowly, you may be cited. You should match the speed of traffic, unless the speed of traffic exceeds the legal speed limit.

options.text: Improve traffic flow.
Demonstrate defensive driving techniques.

dmv_test_13.question: While driving, you should look 10 to 15 seconds ahead of you:

options.text: And focus on the middle of the road.
Because it is a legal requirement.
To see potential hazards early.
options.explanation: To avoid last-minute moves, scan the road 10 to 15 seconds ahead of your vehicle so you can see hazards early. Constantly staring at the road right in front of your vehicle is dangerous.

dmv_test_13.question: A driver should:

options.text: Stare directly in front of their car.
Only focus on the middle of the road.
Watch beside, ahead, and to the rear of their car.
options.explanation: A driver should watch beside, ahead, and to the rear of their car. To be a good driver, you must know what is happening all around your vehicle.

dmv_test_13.question: It is illegal to leave a child age ____ or younger alone in a vehicle.

options.text: Eight
Seven
Six
options.explanation: It is never a good idea to leave a child unattended in a car. It is illegal to leave a child who is age six or younger unattended in a vehicle. A child may be left in a car if they are under the supervision of a person age 12 or older.

dmv_test_13.question: This sign is a:

options.text: Service sign.
Regulatory sign.
Warning sign.
options.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. There may be an upcoming change in traffic direction, a steep downgrade, or another potentially hazardous situation that requires action on the part of the driver.

dmv_test_13.question: Always stop before crossing railroad tracks when:

options.text: There isn't room on the other side for you to completely cross the tracks.
options.explanation: Expect a train on any track, at any time, traveling in either direction. If you need to stop after crossing the tracks, wait until you can completely cross the tracks before proceeding. Make sure your vehicle clears the tracks before you stop.

options.text: The railroad crossing is located in a city or town that has frequent train traffic.
You are transporting two or more young children in a passenger vehicle.

dmv_test_13.question: When a school bus is stopped ahead on your side of the road with its red lights flashing, you must:

options.text: Slow to a speed no faster than 10 mph.
Stop until the lights stop flashing.
options.explanation: The flashing overhead lights and stop arm on a school bus will be activated when the bus is stopped to load or unload students. If approaching a bus using these signals, you may not proceed until the red lights have stopped flashing and the stop arm has been retracted. Never pass a school bus that is dropping off or picking up students.

options.text: Change lanes and pass cautiously.

dmv_test_13.question: Blind spots are:

options.text: Spots in your vision when you become fatigued.
Areas of the road that cannot be seen in a vehicle's mirrors.
options.explanation: When changing lanes, look over your shoulder in the direction you plan to move. Check for obstructions near the rear corners of your vehicle. These areas are called “blind spots” because you cannot see them by using your mirrors.

options.text: Traffic control devices.

dmv_test_13.question: If a traffic signal light is not working, you must:

options.text: Stop, then proceed when safe.
options.explanation: If a traffic signal is not working and no lights are showing, you should proceed cautiously as if the intersection is controlled by stop signs in all directions.

options.text: Stop before entering the intersection and let all other traffic go first.
Slow down or stop, only if necessary.

dmv_test_13.question: If you see a pedestrian using a guide dog or carrying a white cane:

options.text: The pedestrian must yield the right-of-way.
You must yield the right-of-way.
options.explanation: Blind or partially blind pedestrians may carry a white cane or use the assistance of a guide dog. You must yield the right-of-way to a pedestrian with a guide dog or a white cane.

options.text: Honk your horn to let them know you are there.

dmv_test_13.question: You should not start across an intersection if you know you will block the intersection when the light turns red:

options.text: Under any circumstances.
options.explanation: Even if the signal is green, you must not enter an intersection unless you can get completely across before the light turns red. If you block the intersection, you can be cited.

options.text: Unless you entered the intersection on a yellow light.
Unless you entered the intersection on a green light.

dmv_test_13.question: To prevent tailgating, drivers should follow the:

options.text: One-second rule.
Two-second rule.
Three-second rule.
options.explanation: Most rear-end collisions are caused by tailgating. To avoid tailgating, use the “Three-Second Rule.” When the vehicle ahead of you passes a certain point, such as a sign, count “one-thousand-one, one-thousand-two, one-thousand-three.” If you pass the same point before you finish counting, you are following too closely.

dmv_test_13.question: Which of the following is a dangerous habit when driving in work zones?

options.text: Tailgating another vehicle
Failing to carefully watch for workers and moving equipment
Both of the above
options.explanation: When driving in a work zone, adjust your speed for the traffic conditions and don't follow other vehicles too closely. Be attentive to workers and machines in the work zone.

dmv_test_13.question: You see a signal person at a road construction site ahead. You should obey his or her instructions:

options.text: Only if you see orange cones on the road ahead.
Unless they conflict with existing signs, signals, or laws.
At all times.
options.explanation: Obey special signs or instructions from flaggers. Driving carefully through work zones improves safety for drivers, pedestrians, bicyclists, and road workers.

dmv_test_14.question: When entering traffic after being parked at a curb, you:

options.text: Should drive more slowly than other traffic for 200 feet.
Should wait for a large enough gap to get up to the speed of traffic.
options.explanation: Any time that you merge into city or highway traffic, you should wait for a gap in traffic large enough for your vehicle to get up to the speed of other traffic.

options.text: Should wait for the first two vehicles to pass, then drive into the lane.

dmv_test_14.question: To help others see you when daylight begins to fade, you should use your:

options.text: Parking lights.
Low beam headlights.
options.explanation: As daylight begins to fade, turn on your low beams to help others see you. Only use your high beam headlights in an open area where no other drivers are present.

options.text: Emergency flashers.

dmv_test_14.question: If you have a sudden tire blowout:

options.text: Use the brakes lightly.
options.explanation: If a tire suddenly goes flat while you are driving, hold the steering wheel tightly and keep the vehicle moving straight. Slow down gradually by taking your foot off the gas pedal and using the brakes lightly.

options.text: Pump the brakes.
Apply the brakes firmly.

dmv_test_14.question: When changing lanes:

options.text: Check your side mirror and look over your shoulder to make sure the lane is clear.
options.explanation: Before changing lanes, you should check your side mirrors and look over your shoulder to make sure it is safe to proceed.

options.text: Check the inside rearview mirror.
Slow down.

dmv_test_14.question: Extra space in front of a large truck is needed for:

options.text: Other drivers to merge onto the freeway.
The truck driver to stop the vehicle.
options.explanation: Because they are larger, trucks take longer to stop than cars traveling at the same speed. Other drivers should not pull in front of a truck and then slow down or stop.

options.text: Other drivers when they want to slow down.

dmv_test_14.question: You should signal continuously while turning because it:

options.text: Is illegal to turn off your signal before completing a turn.
Lets other drivers know what your intentions are.
options.explanation: You should always signal when turning, changing lanes, slowing down, or stopping so that other drivers, motorcyclists, bicyclists, and pedestrians will know your intentions.

options.text: Is always unsafe to turn off a signal before completing a turn.

dmv_test_14.question: A safety zone is a specially marked area for passengers to get on or off of buses or trolleys. You may not drive through a safety zone:

options.text: When a bus or trolley is present.
When a bus or trolley is unloading passengers.
At any time for any reason.
options.explanation: You may never drive through a safety zone. This space is set aside for pedestrians.

dmv_test_14.question: A flashing red traffic light at an intersection means:

options.text: Slow down before entering.
Stop before entering.
options.explanation: A flashing red signal means "stop." After coming to a stop, you may proceed once it is safe, observing all right-of-way rules.

options.text: Stop and wait for the green light.

dmv_test_14.question: Distracted driving is:

options.text: Anything that causes evasive action while driving.
Anything that takes your attention away from driving.
options.explanation: The term “distracted driving” refers to driving while anything takes your eyes, hands, or mind away from the task at hand. Distracted driving is the most common contributing factor to reported traffic collisions. Distractions of any sort cause drivers to miss key visual and audio cues needed to avoid a crash.

options.text: Anything that causes you to pay more attention to driving.

dmv_test_14.question: If you drive 55 mph in a 55 mph zone, you can be given a speeding ticket:

options.text: Under no circumstances because it is always legal.
If the road or weather conditions require a slower speed.
options.explanation: California has a "Basic Speed Law," which means that you may never drive faster than would be safe in current conditions. Even if your speed is slower than the posted limit, you may still be cited if you are going too fast for conditions. When deciding how quickly to drive, drivers should take multiple factors into account, such as the speed of surrounding vehicles, the condition of the road surface, the presence of bicyclists and pedestrians, and weather conditions.

options.text: Only if you are approaching a sharp curve in the road.

dmv_test_14.question: When parking your vehicle parallel to the curb on a level street:

options.text: Your front wheels must be turned toward the street.
Your wheels must be within 18 inches of the curb.
options.explanation: When parking alongside the curb on a level street, the front and back wheels of your vehicle must be parallel with and within 18 inches of the curb.

options.text: One of your rear wheels must touch the curb.

dmv_test_14.question: This sign means:

options.text: Reserved parking for persons with disabilities.
options.explanation: This sign indicates parking spaces that are reserved for vehicles displaying Persons with Disabilities license plates, Disabled Veteran license plates, and/or disabled parking placards.

options.text: Slow-moving vehicle.
No U-turn.

dmv_test_14.question: Trucks' blind spots are:

options.text: Directly behind the body.
On the immediate left of the cab.
Both on the immediate left of the cab and directly behind the body.
options.explanation: A truck's blind spots are much larger than a smaller car’s blind spots. The driver cannot see your car behind their vehicle and you can't see what’s happening in traffic ahead if you're driving too closely behind the truck. Whether you are driving behind or to the side of the truck, if you can’t see the driver’s face in their side view mirror, then they can’t see you.

dmv_test_14.question: This sign means:

options.text: Road construction/maintenance area.
options.explanation: Diamond-shaped signs are used to warn of actual or possible hazards. The color orange is used for warning signs usually found in construction or maintenance areas.

options.text: Side road.
Railroad ahead.

dmv_test_14.question: This road sign means:

options.text: Slow down or stop.
Stop if necessary.
You must come to a complete stop.
options.explanation: An octagonal sign always means stop. When approaching a stop sign, you must come to a complete stop at the marked stop line and proceed only when it is safe to do so. If there is no stop line, stop before the crosswalk. If there is no crosswalk, stop before the intersection at a point from which you can see oncoming traffic.

dmv_test_14.question: To see objects in their blind spot when changing lanes, drivers should check:

options.text: Only the left outside mirror.
Over their left or right shoulder.
options.explanation: Your vehicle's blind spots are the areas that you cannot see in your mirrors. Look over the appropriate shoulder to check your blind spot when changing lanes.

options.text: Only the inside rearview mirror.

dmv_test_14.question: This white sign means you should not pass other vehicles:

options.text: Until after you pass the sign.
Unless it seems safe to do so.
For any reason.
options.explanation: A white rectangular sign indicates that you must obey the stated rule. This sign means that drivers should not pass other vehicles for any reason.

dmv_test_14.question: If a motorist sees pedestrians in an upcoming crosswalk, what should the motorist do?

options.text: Continue ahead. The motorist has the right-of-way.
Wait for the pedestrians to cross the street.
options.explanation: A driver must yield the right-of-way to a pedestrian within a crosswalk. The driver should wait until the intersection is clear to proceed.

options.text: Pull to the right and go around the pedestrians.

dmv_test_14.question: If you are driving and a tire suddenly goes flat, you should:

options.text: Rapidly pump the brake pedal several times.
Slow down gradually and not brake.
options.explanation: If a tire blows out or suddenly goes flat while you are driving, grip the steering wheel firmly and keep the vehicle aiming straight. Take your foot off the accelerator and do not brake. Allow the vehicle to slow by itself and use the brakes gently, but only if necessary. Pull off the road when it is safe to do so.

options.text: Press down on the brake pedal as hard as you can.

dmv_test_14.question: Which of the following statements about driving speed is true?

options.text: As your speed increases, the chance of a fatality increases.
As your speed increases, so should your following distance.
Both of the above.
options.explanation: As driving speeds increase, the chance of a fatality in the case of a collision increases. If you are going faster than 80 miles per hour, you have almost no chance of living through a crash. The speed you drive affects your stopping distance, so you should increase your following distance as you increase your speed.

dmv_test_14.question: You want to park uphill on a two-way road and there is no curb. Which direction do you turn your front wheels?

options.text: Straight ahead
Right, toward the side of the road
options.explanation: When parking either uphill or downhill on a road that has no curb, you should turn your wheels so that the vehicle will roll away from the center of the road if the brakes fail.

options.text: Left, toward the center of the road

dmv_test_14.question: If you have a green light but traffic is blocking the intersection, you should:

options.text: Stay out of the intersection until traffic clears.
options.explanation: Even if your traffic light is green, you must not enter an intersection unless you can get completely across the intersection before the light turns red. If you block the intersection, you can be cited.

options.text: Enter the intersection and wait until traffic clears.
Merge into another lane and try to go around the traffic.

dmv_test_14.question: Before changing lanes or attempting to pass another vehicle, you should:

options.text: Check your blind spots and mirrors.
Signal your intention before changing lanes.
All of the above.
options.explanation: Every time you want to change lanes or otherwise move your vehicle to the right or left, signal to alert other drivers to your intentions. Always check your mirrors and turn your head to check your blind spot before attempting any lateral move.

dmv_test_14.question: Always carefully look for motorcycles before you change lanes because:

options.text: Their small size can make them hard to see.
options.explanation: You should check carefully for motorcycles when changing lanes because their small size makes it easy for them to disappear into your blind spots.

options.text: They usually have the right-of-way at intersections.
It is illegal for motorcycles to share traffic lanes.

dmv_test_14.question: This sign means:

options.text: There is a 35 mph speed zone after the curve ahead.
Drive no slower than 35 mph around the upcoming curve.
Approach the upcoming curve at a speed of 35 mph or slower.
options.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. These signs may be accompanied by speed advisory plaques that indicate the speed with which you should proceed.

dmv_test_14.question: To be able to turn quickly, your hands must be:

options.text: On opposite sides of the steering wheel.
options.explanation: Both hands should be placed on opposite sides of the steering wheel. This position is comfortable and promotes safe turning on high-speed roadways.

options.text: Next to each other on the top of the steering wheel.
On the top and bottom of the steering wheel.

dmv_test_14.question: Children on bicycles should be given extra space by motor vehicle operators because:

options.text: They do not have the same physical reflexes as adults.
They are smaller and more difficult to see than adults.
Both of the above.
options.explanation: Children are often the least predictable pedestrians and the most difficult pedestrians to see. Take extra care to look out for children, especially near schools, bus stops, playgrounds, parks, and ice cream trucks. Be aware of children riding bikes on the sidewalk, as they may come onto the road unexpectedly.

dmv_test_14.question: When passing another vehicle, it is safe to return to your lane if you:

options.text: Cannot see the vehicle directly to your right.
See the vehicle’s headlights in your rearview mirror.
options.explanation: Before returning to your original lane after passing, you must make sure you are not dangerously close to the vehicle you have just passed. When you can see both of the vehicle's headlights in your rearview mirror, you may have enough room to return to the lane.

options.text: Have passed the other vehicle’s front bumper.

dmv_test_14.question: A broken yellow line down the center of a road indicates that:

options.text: A construction zone is ahead.
Passing is not permitted from either direction.
Passing is permitted from either direction.
options.explanation: When broken yellow lines separate the lanes of traffic on a two-lane roadway, any driver may pass when there is no oncoming traffic.

dmv_test_14.question: After you have passed a vehicle moving in the same direction, it is safe to move back into the right lane:

options.text: After about three seconds.
When you can no longer see the passed vehicle over your right shoulder.
When you can see the entire front of the passed vehicle in your rearview mirror.
options.explanation: When passing, you should not return to your original lane until you can see both headlights of the passed vehicle in your rearview mirror. Always check your blind spots before moving back into your original lane.

dmv_test_14.question: You may drive off of the paved roadway to pass another vehicle:

options.text: If the shoulder is wide enough to accommodate your vehicle.
If the vehicle ahead of you is turning left.
Under no circumstances.
options.explanation: You may never drive off the paved or main-traveled portion of the road and onto the shoulder to pass another vehicle.

dmv_test_14.question: When being followed by a tailgater, which of the following will help you avoid being hit from behind?

options.text: Merging into another lane
options.explanation: When being closely followed by a tailgater, you should slow down gradually or merge into another lane to prevent a collision with them.

options.text: Decreasing your following distance
Changing lanes frequently

dmv_test_14.question: You enter a designated turn lane to make a left turn at an upcoming intersection. There is oncoming traffic. You should:

options.text: Move to the left of the center lane.
Signal before you arrive at the intersection.
options.explanation: When making a left turn, you should always begin signaling about 100 feet before the turn. You should keep your front wheels aiming straight ahead until it is safe to start your turn. This ensures that you will not be pushed into oncoming traffic if another vehicle hits you from behind.

options.text: Turn your front wheels to the left to be prepared to turn.

dmv_test_14.question: This white sign means:

options.text: You should slow down and move to the right lane.
Stay in the right lane if you are driving more slowly than other traffic.
options.explanation: A white, rectangular sign indicates that you must obey important rules. This sign means that drivers should allow the left lane to remain open, when possible, for passing and for faster traffic.

options.text: Slower traffic must exit on the right.

dmv_test_14.question: It is dangerous to follow a motorcycle too closely because:

options.text: They do not follow the same rules as motor vehicles.
A motorcycle can stop much faster than a standard vehicle.
options.explanation: Motorcycles can stop quickly and following them too closely endangers your life and that of the motorcyclist. If the motorcyclist makes a mistake, you need to have enough time and space to avoid a crash.

options.text: They brake more slowly than motor vehicles.

dmv_test_14.question: You see a flashing yellow traffic signal at an upcoming intersection. The flashing yellow light means:

options.text: Stop before entering the intersection, as long as you can do so safely.
Stop. Yield to all cross traffic before crossing the intersection.
Slow down and cross the intersection carefully.
options.explanation: A flashing yellow traffic signal light warns you to proceed with caution. Slow down and be alert before entering the intersection. Yield to any pedestrians, bicyclists, or vehicles in the intersection.

dmv_test_15.question: Which of these statements is true about drugs and driving?

options.text: Any prescription drug is safe to use if you don't feel drowsy.
Even over-the-counter drugs can impair your driving.
options.explanation: Legal prescription and over-the-counter drugs can impair your ability to drive, including drugs taken for colds, hay fever, allergies, or to calm nerves or muscles. It is illegal to drive while under the influence of any drug that impairs your ability to drive safely; this law does not differentiate between illegal, prescription, or over-the-counter drugs.

options.text: Only illegal drugs can impair your driving.

dmv_test_15.question: Drivers must use their seat belt:

options.text: Unless they are driving a vehicle built before 1978.
Unless they are driving a limousine.
And failure to do so will result in a traffic ticket.
options.explanation: Drivers must always wear seat belts and may be cited for failure to do so.

dmv_test_15.question: All of the following are dangerous to do while driving. Which is also illegal?

options.text: Wearing a headset that covers both ears.
options.explanation: It is illegal to drive while wearing a headset or earplugs in both ears.

options.text: Having one or more interior lights on.
Using cruise control on residential streets.

dmv_test_15.question: California's "Basic Speed Law" says:

options.text: You should never drive faster than posted speed limits.
You should never drive faster than is safe for current conditions.
options.explanation: The "Basic Speed Law" means that you may never drive faster than would be safe in current conditions. For example, if you drive 45 mph in a 55 mph zone during a dense fog, even though you are below the posted limit, you may be cited for driving too fast for conditions.

options.text: The maximum speed limit in California is 70 mph on certain freeways.

dmv_test_15.question: A steady yellow traffic signal light is a warning that the light is about to change to red. If you are already within the intersection when a green light changes to yellow, you should:

options.text: Stop.
Continue moving and clear the intersection safely.
options.explanation: If you are already within an intersection when the traffic light turns yellow, you should clear the intersection as quickly as possible.

options.text: Increase your speed so as not to cause an accident.

dmv_test_15.question: On freezing, wet days, which of the following roadways is most likely to hide spots of ice?

options.text: Roadways near the tops of hills
Roadways on bridges and overpasses
options.explanation: Bridges and overpasses tend to freeze before the rest of the road does. They can hide spots of ice.

options.text: Roadways paved with asphalt

dmv_test_15.question: If you are convicted of driving with an excessive blood alcohol concentration (BAC), you may be sentenced to serve:

options.text: Up to six months in jail.
options.explanation: If you are convicted of DUI for the first time and you have an excessive BAC level, you may be sentenced to serve up to six months in jail and may be required to pay a fine between $390 and $1,000. Your vehicle may be impounded and is subject to storage fees.

options.text: Up to 12 months in jail.
No jail time, but you must pay a fine of $500.

dmv_test_15.question: You should increase the distance between your vehicle and the vehicle ahead when you:

options.text: Are following a small passenger vehicle.
Are being tailgated by another driver.
options.explanation: When being tailgated, create extra space in front of your vehicle and do not brake suddenly. Slow down gradually or merge into another lane to prevent a collision with the tailgater.

options.text: Are driving more slowly than the posted speed limit.

dmv_test_15.question: When parking uphill on a two-way street with no curb, your front wheels should be:

options.text: Turned to the left (toward the street).
Turned to the right (away from the street).
options.explanation: When parking on a hill (either uphill or downhill) where there is no curb, you should turn your wheels so that the vehicle will roll away from the center of the road if the brakes fail.

options.text: Parallel with the pavement.

dmv_test_15.question: When stopped at a red traffic light with a green arrow, you may proceed in the direction of the arrow if you:

options.text: First come to a complete stop.
Wait until the light changes.
Are in the proper lane and the intersection is clear.
options.explanation: You may proceed in the direction that a green arrow signal is pointing if you are in the proper lane, regardless of any other signals that are displayed. Before turning, you must yield the right-of-way to pedestrians and vehicles already within the intersection.

dmv_test_15.question: What is the benefit of a space cushion around your vehicle?

options.text: Other drivers can cut in front of you, improving the flow of traffic.
If another driver makes a mistake, you have time to react.
options.explanation: Keeping space around your vehicle is important to ensure that you have time to safely react if another driver makes a mistake. For example, extra space around your vehicle may give you time to brake or maneuver out of the way of a vehicle veering into your lane.

options.text: It inflates to protect you from injury in the case of a collision.

dmv_test_15.question: A flashing yellow traffic signal at an intersection means:

options.text: You should treat the signal like a stop sign.
Stop. Yield to all cross traffic before crossing in the intersection.
Slow down and be alert at the upcoming intersection.
options.explanation: A flashing yellow signal means "proceed with caution." You should slow down and be alert before entering the upcoming intersection and must yield to any pedestrians, bicycles, or vehicles in the intersection; however, you do not have to stop.

dmv_test_15.question: What message will be found on a red octagon-shaped sign?

options.text: Do not enter.
One-way.
Stop.
options.explanation: An octagonal (eight-sided) sign always means "stop." You must always come to a complete stop at this sign.

dmv_test_15.question: A solid yellow line next to a broken yellow line means that vehicles:

options.text: Driving in both directions may pass.
Next to the broken line may pass.
options.explanation: Yellow lines separate lanes of traffic moving in opposite directions. A broken yellow line next to your driving lane means that you may pass.

options.text: Next to the solid line may pass.

dmv_test_15.question: You are driving on a one-way street. You may only turn left onto another one-way street if:

options.text: You increase your speed before the turn.
Traffic on the street moves to the right.
Traffic on the street moves to the left.
options.explanation: You may turn left onto a one-way street that moves to the left if there is no sign prohibiting the turn. You may not turn left onto a one-way street where traffic moves to the right.

dmv_test_15.question: The first thing that alcohol effects is:

options.text: Vision.
Judgment.
options.explanation: Alcohol reduces all of the important abilities you need to drive safely. Alcohol goes from your stomach to your blood, then from your blood to all other parts of your body. Alcohol affects the areas of your brain that control judgment and skill.

options.text: Balance.

dmv_test_15.question: A pedestrian starts to cross the street after the "Don't Walk" signal begins to flash. The pedestrian is in the middle of the street when your signal light changes to green. You should:

options.text: Proceed if you have the right-of-way.
Proceed if the pedestrian is not in your lane.
Wait until the pedestrian crosses the street before proceeding.
options.explanation: At a green light, you must give the right-of-way to any vehicle, bicyclist, or pedestrian in the intersection. If a pedestrian begins crossing the street after the traffic signal light starts flashing, wait until they have crossed the street before proceeding.

dmv_test_15.question: A sign with this shape means:

options.text: No passing zone.
options.explanation: A pennant-shaped sign marks the beginning of a no passing zone.

options.text: Right turn permitted on red.
Yield right-of-way.

dmv_test_15.question: Which of the following statements is correct?

options.text: Use your left foot to brake.
Use your right foot for both braking and accelerating your vehicle.
options.explanation: Use your right foot for both braking and accelerating. You should apply the brakes gently with increasing pressure so that your vehicle stops gradually and smoothly.

options.text: You should always brake abruptly to ensure stopping.

dmv_test_15.question: Which statement is true?

options.text: You should put on your cruise control near a railroad crossing to maintain a constant speed.
You must stop at a railroad crossing when directed to do so by a flagger or stop sign.
options.explanation: You must stop at a railroad crossing when directed to do so by a flagger, stop sign, or warning signal. Use caution when driving near railroad tracks.

options.text: You have the right-of-way at a railroad crossing and do not need to stop.

dmv_test_15.question: Which of the following blocks the smooth flow of traffic?

options.text: Slowing down to look at collision scene.
options.explanation: Rubbernecking (the practice of slowing down to look at collisions or other out-of-the-ordinary things) contributes to traffic congestion and should be avoided.

options.text: Avoiding unnecessary lane changes.
Using public transportation instead of your vehicle.

dmv_test_15.question: If it feels like your tires have lost contact with the surface of the road, you should:

options.text: Slow down by shifting into a lower gear.
Ease your foot off the gas pedal.
options.explanation: If it feels like your tires have lost contact with the surface of the road, you should ease your foot off the gas pedal and stay off the brakes. Do not try to stop or turn until your tires are gripping the road again.

options.text: Slow down by pumping the brakes quickly and firmly.

dmv_test_15.question: When you tailgate other drivers (drive closely to their rear bumper):

options.text: You can frustrate the other drivers and make them angry.
options.explanation: Most rear-end collisions are caused by tailgating. To avoid tailgating, use the “Three Second Rule.” When the vehicle ahead of you passes a certain point, such as a sign, count “one-thousand-one, one-thousand-two, one-thousand-three.” If you pass the same point before you finish counting, you are following too closely.

options.text: Your actions cannot result in a traffic citation.
You help reduce traffic congestion.

dmv_test_15.question: Animals may be transported in the back of a pickup truck only if:

options.text: The sides of the truck bed are at least 18 inches high.
They are properly secured.
options.explanation: An animal must not be transported in the back of a pickup or other truck unless the animal is properly secured to prevent it from falling, jumping, or being thrown from the vehicle.

options.text: The tailgate of the truck is closed.

dmv_test_15.question: A steady red arrow displayed on a traffic light means:

options.text: Drivers cannot turn in the indicated direction.
options.explanation: If a traffic signal is displaying a steady red arrow, traffic in the indicated lane may not proceed in the direction shown by the arrow. Drivers must come to a full stop and wait for a green signal to proceed.

options.text: Drivers may turn in the indicated direction after coming to a complete stop.
Drivers may turn in the indicated direction.

dmv_test_15.question: When passing another vehicle, you should return to your original lane when:

options.text: You can see both headlights of the passed vehicle in your rearview mirror.
options.explanation: When passing another vehicle, move back into your original lane only when you can see the passed vehicle’s headlights in your rearview mirror. This ensures that you will have enough room to safely pull back in front of the other vehicle.

options.text: You have cleared the front bumper of the passed vehicle.
You are 50 feet in front of the passed vehicle.

dmv_test_15.question: This sign means you are approaching a railroad crossing that does not have a signal. You should:

options.text: Come to a complete stop.
Proceed at a consistent speed while looking and listening for approaching trains.
Slow down, look both ways, listen for any trains, and be prepared to stop if any trains are nearby.
options.explanation: At a railroad crossing marked with this sign, a driver should look both ways, listen for any trains, and be prepared to stop if any trains are nearby. Never try to outdrive an oncoming train.

dmv_test_15.question: California's "Basic Speed Law" says you must:

options.text: Keep your speed close to that of other traffic.
Never drive faster than is safe for current conditions.
options.explanation: The "Basic Speed Law" states that you may never drive faster than is safe for current conditions. For example, if you drive at 45 mph in a 55 mph zone during a dense fog, even though you are below the posted limit, you may be cited for driving "too fast for conditions."

options.text: Always drive at the posted speed limit.

dmv_test_15.question: When planning to pass another vehicle, you should:

options.text: Not count on other drivers to make room for you.
options.explanation: When planning to pass, do not count on having enough time to pass several vehicles at once or assume that other drivers will make room for you.
