When you can see both headlights of the passed vehicle in your rearview mirror, you may have enough room to return to your driving lane.

options.text: Assume the driver will let you pass if you use your turn signal.
Assume the driver will maintain a constant speed.

dmv_test_15.question: A driver should:

options.text: Assume all drivers automatically obey the right-of-way rules.
Assume most drivers obey the right-of-way rules.
Always be prepared to yield the right-of-way.
options.explanation: Although the right-of-way rules provide a guide to determine who should yield the right-of-way at an intersection, no one should assume they automatically have the right-of-way. The situation and circumstances at an intersection must always be considered. Drivers should yield their legal right-of-way if it can help prevent a collision.

dmv_test_15.question: Which of the following is most likely to be slippery in cold weather after snow or rain?

options.text: A hilly, open road
A residential road
A road in a shaded area
options.explanation: On cold, wet days, shaded spots on a roadway can become icy. Shaded areas often freeze before, and thaw out after, the rest of a road.

dmv_test_15.question: A school bus is stopped ahead of you in your lane with its red lights flashing. You should:

options.text: Stop and proceed when you think all of the children have exited the bus.
Slow to 25 mph and pass cautiously.
Stop for as long as the red lights are flashing.
options.explanation: When a stopped school bus is using its flashing red lights, approaching drivers must stop and remain stopped until the lights stop flashing. If the school bus is on the opposite side of a divided highway, drivers do not need to stop.

dmv_test_15.question: A police officer is signaling for you to continue driving through a red light. What should you do?

options.text: Do as the officer tells you.
options.explanation: You must obey any traffic direction, order, or signal given by a traffic officer, peace officer, or firefighter, even if it conflicts with existing signs, signals, or laws.

options.text: Wait for the green light.
Stop first, then do what the officer tells you.

dmv_test_15.question: Before you change lanes, you should check your mirrors and:

options.text: Never look over your right shoulder.
Always slow down in your traffic lane.
Glance over your shoulder.
options.explanation: Before changing lanes, it is very important to check behind you. You should look over your shoulder to ensure that you are not getting in the way of vehicles in the lane you want to enter. Before changing lanes, you should also ensure that no drivers are attempting to drive into the same spot from a different lane.

dmv_test_15.question: When driving on a multilane street with two-way traffic:

options.text: Drive alongside other vehicles so the drivers can see you.
You should drive ahead of or behind the other vehicles.
options.explanation: Driving directly alongside another vehicle could create a collision if the other driver crowds your lane or tries to change lanes without looking. To avoid this, you should drive ahead of or behind vehicles in other lanes rather than alongside them.

options.text: It is safest to drive in the lane next to the centerline.

dmv_test_15.question: You are getting ready to make a right turn. You should:

options.text: Signal and turn immediately.
Stop before entering the right lane and let all other traffic go first.
Slow down or stop, if necessary, and then make the turn.
options.explanation: When making a right turn, you should begin signaling about 100 feet before the turn, reduce your speed, stop behind the limit line (if applicable), and then make the turn.

dmv_test_16.question: This road sign means:

options.text: Hospital.
Upcoming intersection.
options.explanation: Warning signs provide notice to road users of a situation that might not be readily apparent and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns drivers of an upcoming intersection so they may prepare for potential traffic or prepare to turn.

options.text: Railroad crossing.

dmv_test_16.question: This road sign means:

options.text: Drive with caution and be ready to stop.
You must come to a complete stop.
options.explanation: The stop sign is the only eight-sided sign you will see on any roadway. When you encounter a stop sign, you must come to a complete stop. You may not proceed until the way is clear for you to completely and safely pass through the intersection.

options.text: Stop, if necessary.

dmv_test_16.question: California's Move Over law requires:

options.text: All vehicles to stay in the right lane at all times.
Trucks to use the left lane.
All vehicles to vacate the lane closest to an emergency vehicle that is stopped with its lights flashing.
options.explanation: If an emergency vehicle with its lights on is stopped on the side of the road, California drivers are required to vacate the lane directly next to the vehicle, if possible. If a driver cannot move over safely, they must slow down and proceed with caution. This law also applies when approaching a stopped tow truck or Department of Transportation vehicle.

dmv_test_16.question: Allow extra space in front of your vehicle when following a:

options.text: Station wagon.
Passenger vehicle.
Motorcycle.
options.explanation: Allow for extra space when driving behind a motorcycle. Motorcycles can stop more quickly than other vehicles can and you must have adequate room to stop if the motorcyclist brakes or falls off. Also, remember that motorcycles are difficult to see at night because they only have one tail light.

dmv_test_16.question: What message will be found on this yellow pennant-shaped sign?

options.text: Right turns only.
Right turns permitted.
No passing zone.
options.explanation: Pennant-shaped yellow signs like this are used to indicate a no passing zone.

dmv_test_16.question: Interstate driving requires drivers to:

options.text: Have the ability to safely drive at increased speeds.
Be constantly alert.
Both of the above.
options.explanation: Safe use of the interstate demands drivers be constantly alert and capable of driving at high speeds.

dmv_test_16.question: If you are facing a green traffic light but the intersection ahead is blocked by traffic, you should:

options.text: Turn left and find another route.
Stay out of the intersection until traffic clears.
options.explanation: Even if you are facing a green traffic light, do not start across the intersection if there are other vehicles blocking your way. If you are caught in the intersection when the light changes to red, your vehicle will block cross traffic. You can get a ticket for blocking an intersection.

options.text: Follow the other vehicles and enter the intersection.

dmv_test_16.question: This road sign means:

options.text: Steep grade ahead.
The road ahead winds with a series of turns or curves.
Slippery when wet.
options.explanation: Warning signs provide notice to road users of a situation that might not be readily apparent and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns drivers to be careful when driving under wet conditions as the pavement will become slippery and more difficult to navigate safely.

dmv_test_16.question: This sign means:

options.text: School zone or crossing.
options.explanation: A five-sided yellow or yellow-green sign alerts drivers to either a school zone or school crossing.

options.text: Pedestrian crossing.
Railroad ahead.

dmv_test_16.question: The proper way to make a right turn is to:

options.text: Signal, slow down, and get into the lane closest to the centerline before turning.
Signal, slow down, and get into the lane closest to the right curb before turning.
options.explanation: Before beginning a right turn, use the appropriate signal to give surrounding drivers adequate notice of your intentions. Slow down and approach the intersection from the right lane, staying as close as is practical to the right curb or edge of the roadway.

options.text: Approach the corner in the lane nearest the right curb, but move over toward the middle of the street before turning.

dmv_test_16.question: If you find that the roadway ahead of you is flooded, you should:

options.text: Slam on the brakes.
Not drive through the flooded area. Turn around and find another route.
options.explanation: Never attempt to drive on a flooded road. Even if the water looks shallow, it may hide many kinds of hazards. If you encounter a flooded area, turn around and seek another route to your destination.

options.text: Drive only in the center of the roadway.

dmv_test_16.question: A peace officer is signaling for you to drive to the edge of the roadway. You decide to ignore the officer's warning and flee the scene. You are guilty of a misdemeanor and can be punished by being:

options.text: Fined up to $1,000.
Jailed in the county jail for not more than one year.
options.explanation: Any person, while operating a motor vehicle, who willfully flees or attempts to evade a peace officer performing his or her duties is guilty of a misdemeanor punishable by imprisonment in a county jail for not more than one year.

options.text: Given a warning and a citation.

dmv_test_16.question: You are approaching a green traffic light and traffic is blocking the intersection. What is the best thing to do?

options.text: Partially enter the intersection to establish your right-of-way.
Don't enter the intersection until you can get completely across.
options.explanation: Even if your light is green, you must not enter an intersection unless you can get completely through the intersection before the light turns red. If you block the intersection, you can be cited.

options.text: Continue into the intersection and wait for traffic to clear.

dmv_test_16.question: To avoid traction loss on wet roads, you should:

options.text: Make abrupt turns.
Apply the brakes firmly.
Slow down.
options.explanation: To prevent hydroplaning, lower your speed in response to wet roads and keep your tires in good condition. If you detect a loss of control, take your foot off the gas, do not apply the brakes, maintain the direction of the vehicle, and allow the vehicle to slow to a manageable speed.

dmv_test_16.question: What should a driver do when approaching a traffic control signal that is not in operation?

options.text: Come to a full stop and yield the right-of-way before entering the intersection.
options.explanation: When traffic control signals are not working, a driver must always treat the intersection as an all-way stop and come to a complete stop, unless otherwise directed by law enforcement. The driver must then look and yield the right-of-way before entering the intersection.

options.text: If the intersection is clear, the driver does not need to stop.
Drive quickly through the intersection to get out of the way of other vehicles.

dmv_test_16.question: The speed limit at an uncontrolled railroad crossing is:

options.text: 25 mph.
15 mph.
options.explanation: When you are within 100 feet of an uncontrolled railroad crossing where you cannot see the tracks for 400 feet in both directions, the speed limit is 15 mph.

options.text: 20 mph.

dmv_test_16.question: Only ____ can reduce blood alcohol content (BAC) and alcohol's effects on the body.

options.text: Drinking caffeine
Eating foods high in fat
Time
options.explanation: Only the passage of time can remove alcohol and its impairing effects from the body.

dmv_test_16.question: What should you do when you see this sign?

options.text: Look for a train station ahead.
Signal before going any further.
Slow down and yield to trains.
options.explanation: A round sign means you are approaching a railroad crossing. This sign is posted a few hundred feet in front of the tracks and tells drivers to slow down, look, listen, and prepare to stop.

dmv_test_16.question: This road sign means:

options.text: Pedestrian crossing.
options.explanation: Warning signs provide notice to road users of a situation that might not be readily apparent and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign tells drivers to be alert to crossing pedestrians.

options.text: School crossing.
Jogging trail.

dmv_test_16.question: This road sign means:

options.text: Flagger ahead.
options.explanation: Orange is the standard color for work zone activity. If you see orange signs, cones, or barrels while driving, stay alert and be prepared for unexpected driving conditions. This sign alerts drivers to an upcoming flagger whose directions should be obeyed by all drivers.

options.text: Turn left at the intersection.
Last turn before a toll road.

dmv_test_16.question: Three of the most important times to check for traffic behind you are before:

options.text: Backing, making a sharp turn, or crossing an intersection.
Backing, changing lanes, or slowing down quickly.
options.explanation: It is important to check behind you before changing lanes, reducing your speed, backing up, or driving down a long or steep hill.

options.text: Changing lanes, crossing intersections, or slowing down quickly.

dmv_test_16.question: Backing your vehicle is:

options.text: Always dangerous.
options.explanation: Backing up is always dangerous because it is hard to see behind your vehicle. Use extra caution when backing up.

options.text: Dangerous if you have a helper.
Only dangerous in large vehicles.

dmv_test_16.question: This road sign means:

options.text: Road widens ahead.
Lane reduction. The right lane ends soon and traffic should merge left.
options.explanation: A warning sign is usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns that the number of lanes ahead is reduced and that traffic will need to merge to the left.

options.text: Highway entrance ramp ahead.

dmv_test_16.question: You consent to take a chemical test for the alcohol content of your blood, breath, or urine:

options.text: Only if you have been drinking alcohol.
Whenever you drive in California.
options.explanation: By driving in California, you consent to have your breath, blood, or urine tested if you are arrested for suspicion of driving under the influence of alcohol and/or drugs.

options.text: Only if you have a collision.

dmv_test_16.question: You are involved in a minor collision at an intersection. There are no injuries and there is very little vehicle damage. You should:

options.text: Leave your vehicle in the traffic lane until law enforcement arrives.
Move your vehicle out of the traffic lane, if possible.
options.explanation: After a collision, if no one has been injured or killed and you can safely do so, you should move your vehicle out of the traffic lane.

options.text: Not move your vehicle for any reason.

dmv_test_16.question: You are crossing an intersection and an emergency vehicle is approaching while using its siren and flashing lights. You should:

options.text: Stop immediately in the intersection until it passes.
Pull to the right of the intersection and stop.
Continue through the intersection, pull to the right, and stop.
options.explanation: If you are in an intersection when you see an emergency vehicle approaching while using its flashing lights and/or siren, continue through the intersection and then drive to the right and stop. You must yield the right-of-way to any police vehicle, fire engine, ambulance, or other emergency vehicle using a siren or flashing lights.

dmv_test_16.question: The speed limit on a school zone where children are present is ____, unless otherwise posted.

options.text: 15 mph
25 mph
options.explanation: When driving within 500 to 1,000 feet of a school while children are outside or crossing the street, the speed limit is 25 mph, unless otherwise posted. Some school zones may have speed limits as low as 15 mph.

options.text: 20 mph

dmv_test_16.question: Which of the following describes the thinking of defensive drivers?

options.text: They know other drivers will do the right thing.
They consider what other drivers might do and are prepared to react.
options.explanation: Driving defensively means anticipating potential errors made by others and preparing to compensate for their mistakes.

options.text: They expect no breaks and give none.

dmv_test_16.question: Pedestrians crossing at corners have the right-of-way:

options.text: Only at controlled intersections.
Only when a crosswalk is painted on the street.
Whether or not a crosswalk is marked.
options.explanation: Respect the right-of-way of pedestrians. Always stop for any pedestrian crossing at a corner or crosswalk, even if the corner is without traffic signal lights. You should stop for pedestrians crossing at any crosswalk, whether or not the crosswalk is marked by painted lines.

dmv_test_16.question: If you come to a railroad crossing with lowered gates and flashing warning lights, you should:

options.text: Drive around the crossing gates if you can't see a train.
Come to a complete stop well behind the gates, wait for the tracks to clear, and proceed once the gates are lifted.
options.explanation: You must stop at a railroad crossing where signs, warning devices, or flaggers warn you of the presence of a train. It is illegal to drive around lowered gates.

options.text: Slow down and drive around the gates.

dmv_test_16.question: Flash your brake lights or turn on your emergency flashers if you:

options.text: Need to warn other drivers of a collision ahead.
options.explanation: If you can see a collision ahead, warn the drivers behind you by turning on your emergency flashers or by tapping your brake pedal quickly three or four times.

options.text: Are temporarily parked in a traffic lane to make delivery.
Are backing out of a parking space.

dmv_test_16.question: This bicyclist is signaling:

options.text: A left turn.
options.explanation: Bicycles do not have turn signals so bicyclists use hand and arm signals to alert other drivers to their intentions. If a bicyclist puts their left arm straight out, they are signaling that they intend to turn left.

options.text: An upcoming stop.
A right turn.

dmv_test_16.question: You want to pass a bicyclist in a narrow traffic lane when an oncoming vehicle is approaching. You should:

options.text: Honk your horn then pass the bicyclist.
Slow down and let the vehicle pass you before you pass the bicyclist.
options.explanation: In this situation, you should take on one danger at a time. Rather than trying to squeeze between the bicyclist and the other vehicle, you should slow down to let the other vehicle pass, and then pass the bicyclist when it is safe to do so.

options.text: Wait until the bicyclist rides off the roadway.

dmv_test_16.question: Which of these vehicles must always stop before crossing railroad tracks?

options.text: Tank trucks marked with hazardous materials placards.
options.explanation: Trucks transporting hazardous loads must stop before they cross railroad tracks.

options.text: Motor homes or pickup trucks towing a boat trailer.
Any vehicle with three or more axles and weighing more than 4,000 pounds.

dmv_test_16.question: When you see this sign, you should stop and:

options.text: Check for vehicles only in the direction that you plan on going, then proceed.
Let all vehicles that arrive before or after you go first.
Check for traffic in all directions before proceeding.
options.explanation: At a stop sign, you must come to a full stop and check for traffic in all directions before proceeding.

dmv_test_16.question: Hydroplaning occurs when tires ride on a thin film of water instead of on the surface of the road. To prevent hydroplaning in rainy weather, you should:

options.text: Put on your cruise control to maintain a constant speed.
Decrease your speed.
options.explanation: In rainy weather, you should lower your speed to reduce the risk of hydroplaning. Driving too fast may cause your tires to ride up on the water and lose contact with the surface of the road, making it very difficult to control your vehicle.

options.text: Move to the shoulder of the road as soon as it starts to rain.

dmv_test_17.question: When making a right turn from a highway with two lanes traveling in your direction, you may turn from:

options.text: The lane closest to the center of the road.
The lane nearest the curb or edge of the roadway.
options.explanation: Begin and end the turn in the lane nearest the right-hand curb. Do not swing wide into another lane of traffic.

options.text: Either lane, depending on oncoming traffic.

dmv_test_17.question: You may cross a double yellow line to pass another vehicle if the yellow line next to:

options.text: The other side of the road is a solid line.
Your side of the road is a broken line.
options.explanation: Double yellow lines in the center of the road indicate that you may pass if a broken line is next to your driving lane.

options.text: The other side of the road is a broken line.

dmv_test_17.question: While in a motor vehicle on a highway, it is:

options.text: Illegal to either drink from or possess open containers of alcohol.
options.explanation: It is illegal to operate a motor vehicle while under the influence of alcohol. Neither drivers nor passengers may possess an open container of alcohol in a motor vehicle while it is in operation.

options.text: Legal to drink alcohol if you're not driving.
Legal to drink alcohol if you're driving but not drunk.

dmv_test_17.question: When driving on gravel or dirt roads:

options.text: Your tires grip the road better than when you are driving on pavement.
Your tires do not have as much traction as they do on pavement, so you must slow down.
options.explanation: Your tires do not have as much traction on loose gravel and dirt roads as they do on concrete and asphalt roads. When driving on gravel or dirt, you must slow down. It will take you much longer to stop and it is much easier to skid when turning.

options.text: Visibility is better than on pavement.

dmv_test_17.question: If there is a deep puddle on the road ahead, you should:

options.text: Maintain the posted speed to make it through the water.
Avoid the puddle if possible.
options.explanation: To prevent skidding on slippery surfaces, avoid especially slippery areas, such as ice patches, wet leaves, oil, or deep puddles. The safest surface for driving is a dry, solid surface.

options.text: Shift into neutral as you drive through the water.

dmv_test_17.question: You are driving on a city street and see an emergency vehicle with flashing lights behind you. What should you do?

options.text: Drive to the right edge of the road and slow down.
Drive to the right edge of the road and stop.
options.explanation: You must yield the right-of-way to any emergency vehicle that is using its siren and lights. Drive to the right edge of the road and stop until the emergency vehicle has passed. If you are within an intersection, drive through the intersection first and then stop.

options.text: Stay in your lane, slow down, and let it pass.

dmv_test_17.question: When approaching an intersection controlled by a flashing yellow light, you must:

options.text: Come to a complete stop at the intersection.
Maintain your normal speed.
Slow down and proceed with caution.
options.explanation: A traffic signal displaying a flashing yellow light indicates that you should be alert and proceed with caution. Slow down when approaching a flashing yellow traffic signal.

dmv_test_17.question: What does this road sign mean?

options.text: Slow down and prepare to stop if cars are approaching you.
Come to a full stop then proceed when it is safe to do so.
options.explanation: An octagonal sign always means stop. When approaching a stop sign, you must come to a complete stop at the marked stop line and proceed only when it is safe to do so. If there is no stop line, stop before the crosswalk. If there is no crosswalk, stop before the intersection at a point from which you can see any oncoming traffic.

options.text: Proceed carefully through the intersection, not always stopping.

dmv_test_17.question: When driving at night on a dimly lit street, you should:

options.text: Drive slowly enough that you can stop within the area illuminated by your headlights.
options.explanation: You should drive more slowly at night than during the day because it is not possible to see as far ahead at night. You should make sure that you can stop within the area illuminated by your headlights.

options.text: Turn on your high beam headlights to better see the vehicles ahead of you.
Keep the instrument panel lights bright to be more visible to other drivers.

dmv_test_17.question: When you see this sign, you should:

options.text: Watch for traffic merging from the right.
options.explanation: Warning signs alert drivers to upcoming hazards and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns drivers about potential traffic merging into their lane from the right.

options.text: Merge right.
Turn left.

dmv_test_17.question: If you experience a tire blowout:

options.text: Tap or pump the brakes.
Slow down gradually and use your brakes lightly.
options.explanation: If you experience a tire blowout, you should slow down gradually by taking your foot off of the accelerator. Don't apply the brakes until the vehicle has slowed considerably.

options.text: Apply the brakes firmly and quickly.

dmv_test_17.question: All of the following are dangerous to do while driving. Which is also illegal?

options.text: Wearing a headset that covers both ears
options.explanation: Do not wear a headset or earplugs in both ears while driving; it is against the law. You must be able to be aware of all possible surrounding hazards.

options.text: Having one or more interior lights on
Using cruise control on residential streets

dmv_test_17.question: To help avoid skidding on slippery surfaces, you should:

options.text: Shift to a lower gear after starting down a steep hill.
Speed up to enter curves and slow down to exit them.
Slow down before entering curves and intersections.
options.explanation: Slow down before you enter a curve because you do not know what may be ahead. Braking on a curve may cause you to skid.

dmv_test_17.question: What does this road sign mean?

options.text: Falling rocks
Trucks use second gear
Steep hill
options.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign indicates that you are approaching a steep hill. Slow down and be ready to shift to a lower gear to control your speed and protect your brakes from damage.

dmv_test_17.question: Dim your headlights for oncoming vehicles or when you are within 300 feet of a vehicle:

options.text: That you are approaching from behind.
options.explanation: You are required to dim your headlights to low beams within 500 feet of a vehicle that is coming toward you and within 300 feet of a vehicle that you are following.

options.text: Approaching you from behind.
That you have already passed.

dmv_test_17.question: Slowing down just to look at collisions or anything else out-of-the-ordinary:

options.text: Causes traffic congestion.
options.explanation: Avoid "rubbernecking," or slowing down to look at collisions or anything else out-of-the-ordinary. This helps to relieve traffic congestion.

options.text: Prevents rear-end collisions.
Improves traffic flow by preventing collisions.

dmv_test_17.question: Remove all snow, frost, and ice from:

options.text: Just the windshield.
All windows.
options.explanation: It is important that you are able to see clearly through all of your vehicle's windows, including the windshield. Remove all snow, ice, and frost from your vehicle's windows and mirrors before you start to drive.

options.text: Just the windshield and passenger window.

dmv_test_17.question: What is the purpose of rumble strips?

options.text: They alert drivers to potential tire problems.
They test a vehicle's shock absorbers.
Through vibration and sound, they alert inattentive drivers to the fact that their vehicles have left the travel lane.
options.explanation: Rumble strips create noise and vibrations to warn drowsy or inattentive drivers that they are straying off of the road or are approaching a stop sign or signal.

dmv_test_17.question: Continuous hard braking on ice and snow often:

options.text: Helps you stop faster.
Locks the front wheels of a vehicle, causing a loss of steering.
options.explanation: Continuous hard braking on snow and ice can result in the locking of the front brake, causing a loss of steering. To avoid the need for excessive braking, make sure to maintain an appropriate speed for conditions.

options.text: Keeps the brakes from freezing.

dmv_test_17.question: There is no crosswalk and you see a pedestrian crossing your lane ahead. You should:

options.text: Make eye contact with and then pass the pedestrian.
Slow down as you pass the pedestrian.
Stop and let the pedestrian finish crossing the street.
options.explanation: At an intersection where traffic is not controlled by traffic signal lights, drivers are required to yield the right-of-way to pedestrians within any crosswalk, marked or unmarked. Even if there is no crosswalk, yield to the pedestrian.

dmv_test_17.question: Which of the following increases your chances of being in a collision?

options.text: Looking over your shoulder while making lane changes
Continuously changing lanes to pass other vehicles
options.explanation: Every time you pass another vehicle, you increase your chances of being in a collision.

options.text: Adjusting your rearview mirror before you start driving

dmv_test_17.question: This sign means:

options.text: Do not drink and drive.
Slippery when wet.
options.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. This sign warns that the roadway is slippery when wet.

options.text: Road curves ahead.

dmv_test_17.question: Where is it safe to pass another vehicle?

options.text: Within an intersection where there are no oncoming vehicles
Wherever signs and/or pavement markings permit passing
options.explanation: Never pass within intersections or at other intersecting points, such as parking lot entrances and alleyways. Any time your view is blocked by a curve or a hill, you should stay in your lane and assume that there is an oncoming vehicle just out of sight. Wherever signs and/or pavement markings permit passing other vehicles, you will have to determine whether or not you have enough space to pass in a safe manner.

options.text: Within a curve where there are no oncoming vehicles

dmv_test_17.question: This sign means:

options.text: School crossing.
School zone.
Pedestrian crossing.
options.explanation: This sign marks the presence of a crosswalk. Be alert to any pedestrians that may be crossing the roadway.

dmv_test_17.question: It is illegal for a person 21 years of age or older to drive with a blood alcohol concentration (BAC) that is ____ or higher.

options.text: 0.08% -- Eight-hundredths of one percent
options.explanation: For drivers age 21 or older, it is illegal to drive with a blood alcohol concentration (BAC) of 0.08 percent or higher. Driving while under the influence of alcohol is not only illegal, but dangerous.

options.text: 0.10% -- One-tenth of one percent
0.05% -- Five-hundredths of one percent

dmv_test_17.question: Always use your seat belt:

options.text: Unless the vehicle was built before 1978.
Unless you are in a limousine.
When the vehicle is equipped with seat belts.
options.explanation: Use of seat belts is required for the driver and all passengers, including children who are over 8 years old or are at least 4 feet 9 inches tall. You must wear seat belts and shoulder harnesses even if the vehicle has airbags. If your vehicle is equipped with separate lap and shoulder belts, you must use both.

dmv_test_17.question: An orange and red triangular sign on a vehicle always means:

options.text: The vehicle has the right-of-way.
Slow-moving vehicle.
options.explanation: Slow-moving vehicles, such as farm tractors, road maintenance vehicles, and animal-drawn carts, display an orange and red triangle on the back.

options.text: Shoulder work ahead.

dmv_test_17.question: This sign means:

options.text: Stop.
options.explanation: An eight-sided red sign means "stop."

options.text: Merge.
Upcoming change in direction.

dmv_test_17.question: This sign means:

options.text: No turns.
No outlet.
No U-turns.
options.explanation: This sign indicates that U-turns are prohibited. You may see a sign like this at an intersection that commonly has oncoming traffic.

dmv_test_17.question: When you see this road sign, you should:

options.text: Keep right.
options.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign indicates that a divided highway is beginning and cars should keep to the right.

options.text: Keep left.
Pass with caution.

dmv_test_17.question: This sign means:

options.text: Slow-moving vehicle.
options.explanation: This sign is displayed on slow-moving vehicles.

options.text: Road construction/maintenance area.
Traffic signal ahead.

dmv_test_17.question: Which of these statements is true about large trucks?

options.text: They take longer to stop than passenger vehicles.
options.explanation: Large trucks take longer to stop than other vehicles traveling at the same speed. The average passenger vehicle traveling at 55 mph can stop within 400 feet. However, a large truck traveling at the same speed can take almost 800 feet to stop.

options.text: They all have air brakes that allow them to stop quickly.
They are more maneuverable than passenger vehicles.

dmv_test_17.question: There is a vehicle stopped on the right shoulder of the road with its hazard lights on. You should:

options.text: Change lanes to the left and speed up.
Slow down and pass very carefully.
options.explanation: If you see a vehicle’s hazard lights ahead, slow down. There may be a collision or other road emergency ahead. Stop and give assistance if asked by anyone, or pass very carefully.

options.text: Stop your vehicle until you can see what has happened.

dmv_test_17.question: When you see this sign, you:

options.text: Are approaching a railroad crossing and should prepare to stop.
options.explanation: This sign indicates that you are approaching a railroad crossing. You must look, listen, slow down, and prepare to stop. Wait for any trains to pass before you proceed.

options.text: Will always stop at the upcoming railroad crossing.
Should stop and wait for a signal before crossing the railroad tracks.

dmv_test_17.question: To prevent yourself from becoming an aggressive driver:

options.text: Relax and concentrate on driving.
options.explanation: To prevent yourself from becoming an aggressive driver, concentrate on driving and don't take the actions of other drivers personally. Be realistic about your travel time, drive within posted speed limits, and be forgiving of other drivers using the roadway.

options.text: Drive above the posted speed limit.
Tailgate the driver in front of you.

dmv_test_17.question: Which of the following is true about vehicles displaying a diamond-shaped sign that indicates a hazardous load?

options.text: They are not allowed to drive on freeways.
They must stop before crossing railroad tracks.
options.explanation: Vehicles displaying hazardous load signs are required to stop before crossing railroad tracks.

options.text: They are not allowed to exceed 35 mph.

dmv_test_18.question: This yellow sign means:

options.text: One lane ahead.
Merging traffic ahead.
options.explanation: This sign warns of the possible presence of merging traffic.

options.text: Lane ends ahead.

dmv_test_18.question: When driving in fog, you should:

options.text: Slow down and use your low beam headlights.
options.explanation: When driving in fog, you should slow down and use your low beam headlights. If the fog is so bad that you cannot see, pull off the road and wait for the fog to clear.

options.text: Slow down and use your high beam headlights.
Turn your lights on and off to warn other drivers.

dmv_test_18.question: When driving in fog, you should use your:

options.text: Fog lights only.
High beams.
Low beams.
options.explanation: It is best to postpone driving until a fog clears. However, if you must drive in the fog, you should do so slowly and use your windshield wipers and low beam headlights.

dmv_test_18.question: You drive defensively when you:

options.text: Put one car length between you and the car ahead.
Look only at the car in front of you while driving.
Keep your eyes moving to look for possible hazards.
options.explanation: You are driving defensively when you are looking down the road for potential hazards. Constantly staring at the road directly in front of your vehicle is dangerous. As you scan ahead, be alert to vehicles around you.

dmv_test_18.question: With a Class C driver license, a person may drive:

options.text: A three-axle vehicle if the Gross Vehicle Weight is less than 6,000 pounds.
options.explanation: A person with a Class C license may drive a three-axle vehicle if it weighs 6,000 pounds or less.

options.text: Any three-axle vehicle, regardless of the weight.
A vehicle pulling two trailers.

dmv_test_18.question: It is illegal to leave a child age six or younger unattended in a vehicle on a hot day:

options.text: Even if they are secured in a child passenger restraint system.
options.explanation: It is never a good idea to leave a child unattended in a car. It is illegal to leave a child age six or younger unattended in a vehicle. A child may be left under the supervision of a person age 12 or older.

options.text: If they are supervised by a person twelve years of age or older.
Only if the key is in the ignition.

dmv_test_18.question: Collisions are more likely to happen when:

options.text: All vehicles are traveling at about the same speed.
One lane of traffic is traveling faster than the other lanes.
One vehicle is traveling faster or slower than the flow of traffic.
options.explanation: Collisions are more likely to happen when one driver moves faster or slower than the other vehicles on the road. Driving faster than other traffic increases your chance of being involved in a collision. Driving more slowly than other traffic is also dangerous because it can increase the risk of a rear-end collision with your vehicle or cause other drivers to swerve to avoid hitting you.

dmv_test_18.question: You may make a left turn on a red light only from a:

options.text: One-way street onto a two-way street.
One-way street onto a one-way street.
options.explanation: You may turn left against a red light when you are turning from a one-way street onto a one-way street. Make sure there is no sign prohibiting the turn. Yield to other vehicles, pedestrians, or bicyclists who have a green light. Look both ways and turn when it is safe.

options.text: Two-way street onto a one-way street.

dmv_test_18.question: You may drive a motor vehicle in a bike lane:

options.text: If you drive more slowly than 15 mph.
No more than 200 feet before making a right turn.
options.explanation: If making a right turn, you may enter the bicycle lane no more than 200 feet before the corner or driveway. Drivers of motor vehicles should not enter a bicycle lane at any other time.

options.text: Whenever bicyclists are not present.

dmv_test_18.question: It is necessary to use your low beams any time you are:

options.text: On a lighted street.
On a freeway.
In fog.
options.explanation: Use your low beams when driving in fog, snow, rain, or mist. Light from high beams will reflect off of precipitation, causing a glare and making it even more difficult to see. Some vehicles are equipped with fog lights that should be used in addition to low beam headlights.

dmv_test_18.question: Reaction time is slower after:

options.text: Drinking alcohol.
options.explanation: Alcohol slows your reflexes and reaction time, reduces your ability to see clearly, and makes you less alert. As the amount of alcohol in your body increases, your judgment worsens and your driving skills decrease. You will have trouble judging distances, speeds, and the movement of other vehicles.

options.text: Sleeping.
Working hard.

dmv_test_18.question: Before you enter an intersection, you should look to your:

options.text: Left, your right, then your left again.
options.explanation: Before you enter an intersection, look to both the left and right for approaching vehicles or crossing pedestrians. Look to your left a second time, as vehicle approaching from your left will be closer than those approaching from your right. Look across the intersection before you start to move to make sure the path is clear all the way through.

options.text: Right.
Left.

dmv_test_18.question: To pass on a two-lane road, you should:

options.text: Sound your horn as you pass.
Flash your headlights as you pass.
Judge the distance to any oncoming vehicles.
options.explanation: It can be hard to judge the speed of oncoming vehicles. They do not always seem to be coming as fast as they really are. Always be sure you can safely change lanes when passing on a two-lane street. If you are not sure of an oncoming vehicle's speed, wait to pass until the oncoming vehicle has passed and you are sure there is enough space for you to change lanes safely.

dmv_test_18.question: If you approach a stopped school bus that has its lights flashing and signal arm extended, you should:

options.text: Stop.
options.explanation: If you approach a stopped school bus that has its lights flashing and arm extended, you must come to a full stop and remain stopped until the signal arm is pulled back and the bus resumes motion. This law applies whether you are traveling in the same direction as the bus or if you are approaching from the opposite side of the street.

options.text: Proceed at 15 mph if no children are present.
Proceed at normal speed, but watch for children.

dmv_test_18.question: At intersections, crosswalks, and railroad crossings, you should always:

options.text: Stop, listen, and proceed cautiously.
Look to the sides of your vehicle to see what is coming.
options.explanation: Any time you come to a place where people may cross or enter your path, or where one line of traffic meets another, you should look to the left and right sides of your vehicle to make sure no one is coming.

options.text: Slowly pass vehicles that seem to be stopped for no reason.

dmv_test_18.question: When used on roadways, bicycles are considered:

options.text: Hazards.
Vehicles.
options.explanation: Bicycles are considered vehicles when used on roadways. Bicyclists and motorists are expected to follow the same rules of the road.

options.text: Dangerous.

dmv_test_18.question: This road sign means:

options.text: When pavement is wet, reduce your speed.
options.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns drivers that the roadway will be slippery when wet and they should reduce their speed accordingly.

options.text: The road ahead winds in a series of turns or curves.
Traffic increases ahead.

dmv_test_18.question: If you come across livestock or other animals on the roadway, you should:

options.text: Swerve out of the way.
Slow down and stop.
options.explanation: If you are driving and come across an animal of any kind in the road, try to slow down and stop if it's safe to do so. Swerving to avoid an animal can be dangerous because your vehicle may lose control and cause an accident.

options.text: Ignore them.

dmv_test_18.question: At a school crossing sign, you should:

options.text: Always stop, whether there is a stop sign or not.
Watch for children and be ready to stop.
options.explanation: Pentagonal signs mean you are approaching a school zone and/or school crossing. When you see these signs, be alert and prepare to stop.

options.text: Always sound your horn when you see children.

dmv_test_18.question: Smoking inside a vehicle with a person younger than 18 years of age is:

options.text: Legal, if it is your child.
Illegal at all times.
options.explanation: In California, it is illegal to smoke in a vehicle at any time when a minor is present.

options.text: Not restricted by law.

dmv_test_18.question: Yellow lines separate:

options.text: Traffic lanes on one-way streets.
Traffic moving in opposite directions on two-way roads.
options.explanation: Yellow lines mark the center of a road used for two-way traffic. A solid yellow centerline indicates that drivers may not cross the line to pass. A broken yellow centerline indicates that drivers may cross the line to pass, but only if passing would not interfere with traffic.

options.text: All carpool lanes from regular traffic lanes.

dmv_test_18.question: When should you yield your legal right-of-way?

options.text: Often, even at controlled intersections.
Whenever it helps prevent collisions.
options.explanation: Never assume other drivers will give you the right-of-way. Yield your right-of-way whenever it helps prevent collisions.

options.text: Never. It confuses other drivers.

dmv_test_18.question: Tailgating other drivers (driving too closely to their rear bumper):

options.text: Can frustrate other drivers and make them angry.
options.explanation: Tailgating is a common behavior that can lead to aggressive driving, and so it should be avoided. Drivers may face legal consequences for driving unsafely.

options.text: Cannot result in a traffic citation.
Reduces collisions by preventing being "cut off."

dmv_test_18.question: It is illegal to drive in a bicycle lane unless you are:

options.text: in need of the space and the bike lane is empty.
Passing another vehicle
Parking (where permitted), entering or leaving the road, turning (within 200 feet of an intersection).
options.explanation: It is illegal to drive in a bicycle lane unless you are parking (where permitted), entering or leaving the road, or turning (within 200 feet of an intersection).

dmv_test_18.question: Never make a U-turn:

options.text: in residential districts.
at or on a railroad crossing.
options.explanation: Never make a U-turn where a No U-turn sign is posted, at or on a railroad crossing, on a divided highway by crossing a dividing section, curb, strip of land, or two sets of double yellow lines, when you cannot see clearly for 200 feet in each direction, on a one-way street, in front of a fire station, never use a fire station driveway to turn around, in business districts (the part of a city or town where most offices and businesses are).

options.text: where there isn't a "No U-turn" sign posted.

dmv_test_18.question: A solid yellow line on your side of the centerline means:

options.text: Reduce your speed.
Traffic light ahead.
Do not pass.
options.explanation: Solid yellow lines on two-lane roads indicate zones where passing is prohibited. If a solid yellow line appears next to a broken yellow line, drivers in the lane nearest to the solid yellow line may not pass. In some instances, both yellow lines will be solid, indicating that it is not safe to pass from either direction.

dmv_test_18.question: What usually causes a locked wheel skid?

options.text: Braking too hard at a slow speed
Braking lightly at a slow speed
Braking too hard at a fast speed
options.explanation: A locked wheel skid is most commonly caused by a driver braking too hard while traveling at a high speed. Drivers should use their brakes smoothly and gradually.

dmv_test_18.question: If you are driving and the rear end of your car starts skidding to the left, you should:

options.text: Steer to the right.
Steer to the left.
options.explanation: If your vehicle enters a skid, you should take your foot off of the brake and steer in the direction that you want to go. For example, if the rear of your vehicle is skidding to the left, you should steer to the left. This will help bring the front of the vehicle in line with the rear, thereby straightening out the vehicle's overall direction.

options.text: Tap your brakes lightly and shift into neutral.

dmv_test_18.question: Broken yellow lines are used on streets and highways to:

options.text: Indicate no passing zones.
Separate lanes of traffic moving in the same direction.
Separate lanes of traffic moving in opposite directions.
options.explanation: Yellow lines separate traffic moving in opposite directions. Dashed lines on the pavement indicate that passing is permitted when safe.

dmv_test_18.question: At intersections with a "Yield" sign, you must:

options.text: Yield the right-of-way to cross traffic that is near enough to cause conflict.
options.explanation: At a yield sign, you must slow down or stop, if necessary, and give the right-of-way to crossing or merging vehicles. Yield the right-of-way to any cross traffic that is close enough to cause conflict.

options.text: Yield the right-of-way only to vehicles on your right.
Always slow down and proceed without stopping.

dmv_test_18.question: Which way do you turn your front wheels to park downhill next to a curb?

options.text: Into the curb
options.explanation: When parking downhill, turn your front wheels into the curb or toward the side of the road. Set the parking brake.

options.text: Away from the curb
Parallel to the curb

dmv_test_18.question: As you approach the top of a hill, you should:

options.text: Speed up slightly.
Prepare to stop, if needed.
options.explanation: You may not know what is on the other side of a hill or just around a curve, even if you have driven the road many times. If a vehicle is stalled just out of sight on the roadway, you must be able to stop. Whenever you come to a hill or curve, adjust your speed so you can stop if necessary.

options.text: Maintain a steady speed.

dmv_test_18.question: If you have trouble seeing other vehicles because of dust or smoke blowing across the roadway, you should drive more slowly and turn on your:

options.text: Emergency flashers.
Parking lights.
Headlights.
options.explanation: You must turn on your headlights any time conditions prevent you from seeing other vehicles. Other drivers may have trouble seeing you, too.

dmv_test_18.question: Prior to entering a curve:

options.text: Activate your turn signal.
Reduce your speed.
options.explanation: You may drive more slowly than the posted speed limit, based on road conditions, but it is illegal to drive any faster than the posted speed limit. Some conditions which require reduced speed for safety include approaching curves or hills where visibility is limited, driving on slippery roads, and driving on roads where animals and pedestrians are present.

options.text: Brake hard.

dmv_test_18.question: This sign tells a driver that:

options.text: A construction flagger is ahead.
options.explanation: This sign warns that there is a flag person ahead. Always follow directions given by a flagger. Flaggers normally wear orange or yellow vests, yellow-green shirts, or bright jackets. They use paddles and red flags to direct traffic through the work zone and to let workers or construction vehicles cross the road.

options.text: A police officer is ahead.
A parking attendant is ahead.

dmv_test_18.question: Which child would require a child passenger restraint system?

options.text: A 9-year-old who is 4 feet 10 inches tall
A 10-year-old who is 5 feet 3 inches tall
A 7-year-old who is 4 feet 8 inches tall
options.explanation: Children who are eight years old or older, or who have reached at least 4 feet 9 inches in height, may use a properly secured safety belt meeting federal standards. Other children must be seated in a child passenger restraint system.

dmv_test_19.question: This sign is a:

options.text: Yield sign.
options.explanation: A downward-facing triangular sign is always a yield sign. Drivers must be prepared to slow down or stop when approaching a yield sign.

options.text: School crossing sign.
Stop sign.

dmv_test_19.question: If bad weather makes it difficult for you to see clearly, you should:

options.text: Speed up to get off the road quickly.
Drive in the lane closest to oncoming traffic.
Increase your following distance.
options.explanation: When it is difficult to see due to darkness or poor weather, increase your following distance. This will give you more time to react to hazards that you may not see in advance.

dmv_test_19.question: On rainy, snowy, or foggy days, turn on your windshield wipers and use your headlights:

options.text: On the high beam setting.
So other drivers can see you.
options.explanation: Turn on your headlights when it is cloudy, raining, snowing, or foggy. If weather conditions require you to use your windshield wipers, you are required to turn on your low beam headlights.

options.text: Only when driving on the freeway.

dmv_test_19.question: Which of these statements is true about driving and taking medications?

options.text: Most cold medications can make a person drowsy.
options.explanation: Remember that all medications, prescription or over-the-counter, are potentially dangerous and could impair your driving. Over-the-counter medicines that you take for colds and allergies can make you drowsy and affect your driving ability. It is your responsibility to know how your medication affects your ability to drive.

options.text: Over-the-counter medications cannot impair driving ability if taken in the recommended dosages.
Medications are safe to take at any time, if prescribed by a doctor.

dmv_test_19.question: The center of the roadway is marked with one solid yellow line and one broken yellow line. If the broken yellow line is directly next to your traffic lane, it means:

options.text: You are not allowed to pass in this area.
You are in a passing zone and it is safe for you to pass other vehicles on the left if no oncoming traffic is present.
options.explanation: When there is a solid yellow line and a broken yellow line in the center of the road, passing is permitted from the side of the road next to the broken line.

options.text: You are only allowed to make right turns in this area.

dmv_test_19.question: If your cell phone rings while you are driving and you do not have a hands-free device, you should:

options.text: Answer the call because it may be an emergency.
Let the call go to voicemail.
options.explanation: Drivers should not use a cell phone without a hands-free device. For minors, it is illegal to use any cell phone while driving, except in an emergency. Even if you do have a hands-free device, it is recommended that you let calls go to voicemail while driving in order to avoid distractions.

options.text: Check the incoming number before answering the call.

dmv_test_19.question: When driving on an interstate, to avoid traffic merging from on-ramps to your right, the best thing to do is to:

options.text: Change lanes to the left.
options.explanation: When driving on an interstate highway, be aware of upcoming on-ramps. When traffic permits, move out of the right-hand lane to allow vehicles to enter from the on-ramps to your right.

options.text: Slow down.
Maintain your speed and position.

dmv_test_19.question: This sign means:

options.text: Watch for bicycles.
options.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. Warning signs may alert drivers to areas where animals, people, and vehicles are likely to cross traffic.

options.text: Bicycles not allowed.
Bicycle repair shop ahead.

dmv_test_19.question: When approaching a roundabout, you should always:

options.text: Increase your speed.
Decrease your speed.
options.explanation: When approaching a roundabout, slow down. A roundabout is designed to be driven at a low speed.

options.text: Maintain your speed.

dmv_test_19.question: To enter a gap in highway traffic:

options.text: Watch only the vehicles behind the gap.
Check behind you, then watch the vehicle ahead.
options.explanation: Whenever you want to change lanes or enter traffic, you must be sure that there are no vehicles in your way in the lane you want to enter. Always check for traffic to the side of and behind your vehicle before you change lanes.

options.text: Speed up and let the other vehicles make way.

dmv_test_19.question: You are driving on the freeway. The vehicle in front of you is a large truck. You should drive:

options.text: Closely behind the truck in bad weather because the driver can see farther ahead than you can.
Farther behind the truck than you would when following a passenger vehicle.
options.explanation: When you follow so closely behind a truck that you cannot see the truck driver’s side view mirrors, the trucker cannot see you and has no way of knowing you are there. Tailgating a truck, or any vehicle, is dangerous because you take away your own cushion of safety if the vehicle in front of you stops quickly.

options.text: No more than one car length behind the truck so the driver can see you.

dmv_test_19.question: Work zone barriers, drums, cones, and signs are used to:

options.text: Make drivers angry about slow traffic.
Inconvenience drivers.
Keep traffic out of hazardous work zones.
options.explanation: Work zones on highways have become increasingly dangerous places for both workers and drivers. When approaching a work zone, watch for materials such as cones, barrels, signs, large vehicles, and workers in brightly colored vests to warn you and direct you.

dmv_test_19.question: It is against the law to enter an intersection when:

options.text: You can't get all the way across before the light turns red.
options.explanation: Do not enter an intersection if you cannot get completely across before the traffic signal light turns red. If you block the intersection, you can be cited.

options.text: The light is flashing yellow and you didn't stop first.
The light is yellow and you cannot stop safely.

dmv_test_19.question: Which of the following road surfaces freezes first?

options.text: A tunnel
An intersection
A bridge
options.explanation: Pavement on bridges and overpasses can become icy even when other surrounding pavement is dry. Bridges often freeze before, and thaw out after, the rest of a road.

dmv_test_19.question: When passing a row of parked vehicles, you should:

options.text: Be prepared for a person or vehicle to unexpectedly enter your lane.
options.explanation: Keep a space between your vehicle and parked vehicles. A person may step out of a parked vehicle or out from between the parked vehicles without looking. A driver may begin moving their vehicle before realizing you are there.

options.text: Expect all other drivers and pedestrians to respect your right-of-way.
Drive closely to the parked vehicles to allow more room for moving traffic.

dmv_test_19.question: If you pass a school bus that is stopped with its red lights flashing, you will:

options.text: Be fined up to $1,000.
options.explanation: Drivers must come to a complete stop when approaching a school bus stopped with its red lights flashing. Failure to stop until the red lights stop flashing may result in license suspension and a fine of up to $1,000.

options.text: Be fined up to $100.
Face no legal consequences.

dmv_test_19.question: Fines in a construction zone are:

options.text: Doubled.
options.explanation: Fines for moving traffic violations are doubled in highway construction or maintenance zones where workers are present. When operating in a construction zone, you must drive carefully and follow all directions provided by signs, signals, officers, and flaggers.

options.text: Tripled.
Cut in half.

dmv_test_19.question: If your car's suspension is bad, it can cause:

options.text: Vehicle control problems.
options.explanation: Your suspension helps you control your vehicle and provides a comfortable ride over varying road surfaces. If your vehicle bounces a lot after driving over a bump, or is generally hard to control, you may need new suspension parts.

options.text: Squealing brakes.
Slack in the steering.

dmv_test_19.question: This yellow signs means:

options.text: The road ahead has many curves.
There is a sharp curve in the road ahead.
The road ahead may be slippery.
options.explanation: This sign indicates that the road ahead may be slippery when wet.

dmv_test_19.question: You should use your horn when:

options.text: Another vehicle is in your way.
It may help prevent a collision.
options.explanation: Only use your horn when it is necessary to avoid collisions. Do not use your horn if a driver or bicyclist is moving slowly and you want him or her to drive faster or get out of your way.

options.text: Another driver makes a mistake.

dmv_test_19.question: If you have had several beers, the effects of alcohol will be reduced only by:

options.text: Taking a cold shower.
Waiting several hours.
options.explanation: The only way to remove the impairing effects of alcohol is to give the body time to remove it from the body. Drinking coffee, physical activity, or taking a cold shower will not speed up this process. It takes about one hour to cancel the effects of one drink.

options.text: Drinking several cups of coffee.

dmv_test_19.question: If your vehicle starts to lose traction because of water on the road, you should:

options.text: Drive at a constant speed to gain better traction.
Apply the brakes firmly to prevent your vehicle from sliding.
Slow down gradually and not apply the brakes.
options.explanation: When driving in heavy rain at speeds as low as 30 mph, your tires may lose all contact with the road and instead ride up on a layer of water above the surface of the road. This is called "hydroplaning." If your vehicle starts to hydroplane, slow down gradually and do not apply the brakes.

dmv_test_19.question: When changing lanes, you should never:

options.text: Look over your shoulder to check your blind spot.
Change lanes abruptly or spontaneously.
options.explanation: When changing lanes, you must be sure that there are no vehicles in the space you want to enter. Check for other vehicles behind and to the side of your vehicle by checking your mirrors and blind spots. Always use the proper turn signal before changing lanes to allow surrounding vehicles time to react to your movements.

options.text: Check for other vehicles moving into the same lane.

dmv_test_19.question: To turn left from a one-way street with multiple lanes onto a two-way street, start the turn in:

options.text: The far left lane.
options.explanation: When making a left turn from a one-way street onto a two-way street, start from the far left lane.

options.text: Any available lane.
The lane closest to the middle of the street.

dmv_test_19.question: You have been involved in a minor traffic collision with a parked vehicle and you can't find the owner. You must:

options.text: Leave a note on the vehicle.
Report the collision without delay to the city police or, in unincorporated areas, to the California Highway Patrol.
Both of the above.
options.explanation: If you collide with a parked car or other property, leave a note with your name, phone number, and address securely attached to what you hit. You must report the collision to the local city police or, if the collision was in an unincorporated area, to the California Highway Patrol (CHP).

dmv_test_19.question: A curb painted red means:

options.text: Loading zone.
The area is reserved for picking up or dropping off passengers.
No parking, standing, or stopping.
options.explanation: You may not stop, stand, or park at a red-painted curb.

dmv_test_19.question: If you drive faster than other vehicles on a road with one lane moving in each direction and continually pass the other cars, you will:

options.text: Get you to your destination much more quickly and safely.
Increase your chances of an collision.
options.explanation: You should avoid passing other vehicles on two-lane roads. Every time you pass a vehicle, your odds of being in a collision increase.

options.text: Help prevent traffic congestion.

dmv_test_19.question: On a green arrow, you must:

options.text: Yield to any vehicle, bicycle, or pedestrian in the intersection.
options.explanation: A green arrow means "go." You must turn in the direction the arrow is pointing after you yield to any vehicles, bicycles, or pedestrians who are still in the intersection.

options.text: Yield to pedestrians only in the intersection.
Wait four seconds before proceeding.

dmv_test_19.question: You are driving on the freeway behind a large truck. You should drive:

options.text: Closer behind the truck than you would if following a passenger vehicle.
Farther behind the truck than you would if following a passenger vehicle.
options.explanation: It is necessary to follow farther behind a large truck than you would if following a passenger vehicle because trucks have larger blind spots.

options.text: To the right side of the truck and wait to pass.

dmv_test_19.question: A large truck is ahead of you and is turning right onto a street with two lanes in each direction. The truck:

options.text: May complete its turn in either of the two lanes.
May have to swing wide to complete the right turn.
options.explanation: When a vehicle makes a turn, the rear wheels follow a shorter path than the front wheels. The longer the vehicle, the bigger the difference between the paths of the front and rear wheels. Therefore, long trucks often have to swing wide to complete a right turn.

options.text: Must stay in the right lane at all times while turning.

dmv_test_19.question: If you can see that the roadway up ahead is covered by heavy smoke, you should:

options.text: Turn on your four-way flashers and continue.
Reduce your speed, move as far to the right as possible, and stop off the roadway.
options.explanation: If you notice that the road ahead is covered by heavy smoke, reduce your speed immediately, drive as far as possible to the right, and stop off the roadway. Only then should you determine if it is safe for you to continue. Remember that certain kinds of smoke can irritate your eyes and lungs or even kill you.

options.text: Turn on your high beam headlights and continue.

dmv_test_19.question: When entering an interstate highway, you should:

options.text: Stop, check for cars, and enter when safe.
Check for cars and reduce your speed to 25 mph before entering the traffic lane.
Check for cars, increase your speed to match the flow of traffic, and merge when the way is clear.
options.explanation: Rather than stopping (as you would when entering other roads), you must use the merging or acceleration lane to speed up and smoothly merge with fast-moving traffic already on the interstate.

dmv_test_19.question: Which of the following is true about roadways on bridges and overpasses in cold, wet weather?

options.text: They tend to freeze before the rest of the road does.
options.explanation: Bridges and overpasses tend to freeze before the rest of the road does. They can hide spots of ice.

options.text: They do not freeze because they are made of concrete.
They tend to freeze after the rest of the road does.

dmv_test_19.question: This sign means:

options.text: Change in direction or narrowing of roadway.
options.explanation: This sign warns a driver of a change in direction or a narrowing of the road. A driver may find several of these signs on the outside of a sharp curve or on approaches to a narrow bridge.

options.text: No right turn.
No passing zone.

dmv_test_19.question: Your license can be suspended if you are under 21 and drive with a blood alcohol level of:

options.text: 0.15 percent or more.
0.08 percent or more.
Any amount.
options.explanation: There is zero tolerance for alcohol use by drivers under age 21. If you are under 21, the detection of any trace of alcohol in your system will result in stiff penalties, including the suspension of your license for two years.

dmv_test_19.question: How many alcoholic drinks does it take to affect your driving ability?

options.text: Three
Two
One
options.explanation: It is not advisable to drive after drinking any amount of alcohol. Even a single drink will affect your ability to drive safely.

dmv_test_20.question: Having a driver license is a:

options.text: Right, not a privilege.
Privilege, not a right.
options.explanation: Holding a driver license is not a right. It is a privilege that must be earned and maintained.

options.text: Requirement.

dmv_test_20.question: All of the following practices are dangerous to do while driving. Which of these is also illegal?

options.text: Listening to music through headphones that cover both ears.
options.explanation: Even people with good hearing cannot hear well if the radio or CD player is blaring. Do not wear a headset or earplugs in both ears while driving; it is against the law.

options.text: Adjusting your outside mirrors.
Transporting an unrestrained animal inside the vehicle.

dmv_test_20.question: What does this road sign mean?

options.text: You must turn right.
No right turns permitted.
options.explanation: This sign prohibits right turns. It is illegal to turn right at an intersection where this sign is posted.

options.text: Right turns permitted on a red light.

dmv_test_20.question: You must look for bicyclists in the same lanes used by motor vehicles because they:

options.text: Must ride facing oncoming traffic.
Illegally share lanes with motor vehicles.
Are entitled to share the road with motor vehicles.
options.explanation: Bicyclists have the right to operate on the road and may lawfully be permitted to ride on certain sections of freeways where there is no alternate route and bicycling is not forbidden by a sign. Watch for bicyclists and share the road when they are present.

dmv_test_20.question: You may not park your vehicle:

options.text: On the side of the freeway in an emergency.
Next to a red painted curb.
options.explanation: No stopping, standing, or parking is permitted next to a red painted curb. However, buses may stop in a red curb zone marked for buses.

options.text: Within 100 feet of an elementary school.

dmv_test_20.question: This sign means:

options.text: You should stop for other traffic.
Traffic is entering from another road and you should allow additional space for drivers to merge safely into the flow of traffic.
options.explanation: This sign alerts you to the possibility of traffic merging into the main stream of travel. After checking to your side and rear, you should move into another lane, if possible, to allow merging motorists a clear path.

options.text: Traffic is entering from another road and you should keep right.

dmv_test_20.question: While driving on a roadway with a single broken white centerline:

options.text: You must stay within your lane.
You may cross the centerline to change lanes.
options.explanation: White lines between lanes indicate that the lanes are traveling in the same direction. Broken white line markings indicate that it is legal to pass another vehicle when safe.

options.text: You may change lanes only from the left lane.

dmv_test_20.question: You are entering a freeway. Check traffic on the freeway by:

options.text: Using your rearview and side mirrors.
Using your rearview mirror.
Using your side mirror and looking over your shoulder.
options.explanation: When entering any roadway, you must be aware of traffic conditions. Use your side mirror and look over your shoulder to help you see and anticipate traffic when entering a freeway.

dmv_test_20.question: It is legal to drive with an alcoholic beverage container that has been opened only if the container is:

options.text: Under the front seat.
In the glove department.
In the trunk.
options.explanation: Any opened alcoholic beverage container must be kept in the trunk of the vehicle, or in another place where passengers do not sit. Keeping an opened alcoholic drink in the glove compartment is specifically prohibited. However, in a bus, taxi, camper, or motor home, these restrictions do not apply to non-driving passengers.

dmv_test_20.question: This yellow sign means:

options.text: There is a sharp turn to the right.
options.explanation: Some warning signs have a fluorescent yellow-green background. These signs warn of upcoming conditions, including roads with curves and sharp turns.

options.text: The lane must turn right.
A right turn is permitted on a green arrow only.

dmv_test_20.question: What is a crosswalk?

options.text: Another name for a four-way intersection.
An area designated for road construction workers.
The area where pedestrians may cross the roadway.
options.explanation: Pedestrian crosswalks are often shown by white, solid lines to emphasize pedestrian crossing points. Crosswalks may have additional lines between the white, solid lines or in place of the parallel lines. However, crosswalks may also be unmarked.

dmv_test_20.question: You were parked and have been waiting a long time with your turn signal on to re-enter traffic. However, traffic is heavy. You should:

options.text: Continue waiting and yielding to traffic in the lane.
options.explanation: If you have been parked on the side of a road, you must yield to existing traffic when re-entering the road.

options.text: Slowly inch your vehicle into the traffic lane.
Drive on the shoulder until a gap in traffic appears.

dmv_test_20.question: This road sign means:

options.text: Highway entrance ramp.
Road widens.
Right lane ends.
options.explanation: Warning signs provide notice to road users of a situation that might not be readily apparent and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign alerts drivers to the right lane ending and tells them to prepare for potential merging traffic.

dmv_test_20.question: The driver ahead of you stops at a crosswalk. What should you do?

options.text: Cautiously pass the vehicle at 10 mph or slower.
Stop, proceeding only when all the pedestrians have crossed.
options.explanation: You must not pass a vehicle that is stopped at a crosswalk. There may be pedestrians crossing the street that you cannot see. Instead, stop, proceeding only after all pedestrians have crossed.

options.text: Change lanes, look carefully, and pass the stopped vehicle.

dmv_test_20.question: This yellow sign means:

options.text: Controlled railroad ahead.
Be prepared to stop if the light is flashing.
There is a traffic signal ahead.
options.explanation: A yellow sign with a traffic signal pictured indicates that there is a traffic signal is ahead. Be prepared to respond to the upcoming traffic signal.

dmv_test_20.question: You may be able to identify an aggressive driver by:

options.text: Their erratic and improper lane changes.
options.explanation: While driving, you should remain aware of the actions of surrounding drivers. If you notice an aggressive driver nearby making erratic or improper lane changes, you should not challenge them. The safest way to handle an aggressive driver is to get out of their way.

options.text: The number of passengers in their car.
Their tendency to drive slowly.

dmv_test_20.question: When may you legally drive around or under a railroad crossing gate?

options.text: Never.
options.explanation: Do not go around or under any lowered gate at a railroad crossing. Once the gate is raised, do not proceed across the tracks until you can see clearly in both directions and are sure there are no trains coming.

options.text: When you can see clearly in both directions.
When the warning lights are not flashing.

dmv_test_20.question: When driving on the highway, consistently looking far ahead of your vehicle:

options.text: Helps you keep up with traffic.
Reduces the need for last-minute braking or turning.
options.explanation: To avoid the need for last-minute braking or turning, consistently watch the road far ahead of your vehicle. By looking ahead and being ready to stop or change lanes if needed, you can drive more safely, save fuel, and help keep traffic moving at a steady pace.

options.text: Allows you to spot upcoming police officers.

dmv_test_20.question: What can you do to reduce road rage?

options.text: Always signal your intention when changing lanes.
options.explanation: To do your part to prevent road rage, you should follow laws, signs, signals, and pavement markings. Always signal your intention when changing lanes.

options.text: Talk on your cell phone while driving.
Use your horn frequently.

dmv_test_20.question: This sign is used to warn drivers about:

options.text: Upcoming intersections.
Road construction.
Road curves ahead.
options.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. This sign is used to warn drivers about an upcoming curve to the right.

dmv_test_20.question: It is illegal to park your vehicle:

options.text: In an unmarked crosswalk.
options.explanation: It is illegal to park your car on a marked or unmarked crosswalk. You may park in a bicycle lane if there is not a "No parking" sign posted and your vehicle does not block a bicyclist.

options.text: Within three feet of a private driveway.
In a bicycle lane.

dmv_test_20.question: Which of the following statements about blind spots is true?

options.text: They are eliminated if you have one outside mirror on each side of the vehicle.
Large trucks have bigger blind spots than most passenger vehicles.
options.explanation: Blind spots are areas that a driver cannot see if they look in their mirrors. Large trucks have large blind spots that drivers of other vehicles should avoid.

options.text: Blind spots can be checked by looking in your rearview mirrors.

dmv_test_20.question: When you drive through a construction zone, you should:

options.text: Stop to watch the workers.
Decrease your following distance.
Pass the construction zone carefully and not “rubberneck."
options.explanation: To avoid contributing to chronic traffic congestion, you should not "rubberneck." That is, you should not slow down to look at out-of-the-ordinary things.

dmv_test_20.question: What should you do at an intersection with a flashing yellow signal light?

options.text: Maintain your speed but watch for other vehicles.
Stop before crossing the intersection.
Slow down and cross the intersection carefully.
options.explanation: Slow down and be alert before entering the intersection. Yield to any pedestrians, bicyclists, or vehicles in the intersection. You do not need to stop for a flashing yellow traffic signal light.

dmv_test_20.question: This road sign means:

options.text: The roadway ends ahead.
Drivers must bear either right or left.
options.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns drivers that they are arriving upon a fork in the road and they must bear either right or left.

options.text: A four-way intersection is ahead.

dmv_test_20.question: Which of these is a safe driving technique?

options.text: Using your high beam lights in the fog.
Staring at the road ahead of your vehicle.
Checking your rearview mirrors frequently.
options.explanation: To stay aware of hazards, you should scan the road and check your rearview mirrors every two to five seconds. Constantly staring at just the road ahead of you is dangerous. If you must drive in foggy conditions, you should use your low beam headlights, not your high beam headlights.

dmv_test_20.question: Large trucks are likely to lose speed when:

options.text: Driving up long or steep hills.
