options.explanation: Because large trucks require more time to accelerate than smaller vehicles, trucks can lose speed driving up long or steep hills. Be cautious when driving behind a large truck and be sure to give the vehicle additional space, especially when driving on an incline.

options.text: Driving in long, gradual curves.
Driving down long, gradual hills.

dmv_test_20.question: The speed limit in any alley is:

options.text: 20 mph.
15 mph.
options.explanation: The speed limit in any alley is 15 mph. This is always the speed limit, whether or not it is posted.

options.text: 25 mph.

dmv_test_20.question: When a school bus is stopped on the road ahead to load or unload children, you must:

options.text: Come to a complete stop until all the children have left the bus.
Come to a complete stop until the red lights stop flashing and the stop arm is withdrawn.
options.explanation: When a school bus is stopped on the road ahead with its lights flashing and its stop arm extended, you must come to a complete stop and wait to proceed until the lights have stopped flashing and the stop arm is withdrawn. Even after the bus begins to move again, do not proceed until you are sure there are no children crossing the road ahead of you.

options.text: Change lanes, drive slowly, and pass the bus cautiously.

dmv_test_20.question: Abandoning an animal on the highway may result in:

options.text: Jail time.
options.explanation: It is illegal to dump or abandon an animal on the highway. Doing so can result in six months of jail time, a fine of up to $1,000, or both.

options.text: A point against your license.
No legal consequences.

dmv_test_20.question: When changing lanes, you should never:

options.text: Cross the centerline in an intersection.
options.explanation: Before changing lanes, check for drivers trying to pass you who may be trying to enter the same lane as you. Look over your shoulder to check your blind spot. You should never attempt to pass or otherwise change lanes in an intersection.

options.text: Check your blind spots by looking over your left or right shoulder.
Check for other drivers moving into the same lane.

dmv_test_20.question: It is a very windy day. You are driving and a dust storm blows across the freeway, reducing your visibility. You should decrease your speed and turn on your:

options.text: Interior lights.
Parking lights.
Headlights.
options.explanation: Drivers must use their headlights any time conditions prevent them from seeing other vehicles. Conditions with lowered visibility include dust, clouds, rain, snow, smoke, or fog on or near the roadway.

dmv_test_20.question: When parking next to a curb, you should use your turn signals:

options.text: Only when pulling away from the curb.
When pulling next to, but not away from, the curb.
When pulling next to or away from the curb.
options.explanation: Drivers should signal when pulling next to a curb or away from a curb.

dmv_test_20.question: If you want to pass a bicyclists riding on the right edge of your lane:

options.text: You must honk your horn before passing the bicyclist.
You must not squeeze past the bicyclist.
options.explanation: When passing a bicyclist, you must allow at least three feet of space between your vehicle and the bicycle whenever possible. You must not squeeze the bicyclist off the road.

options.text: You may not pass the bicyclist for any reason.

dmv_test_20.question: If you plan to pass another vehicle, you should:

options.text: Not assume the other driver will make space for you to return to your lane.
options.explanation: Even when you signal, you should not assume that the space you want to occupy is free or that other drivers will give you the right-of-way.

options.text: Assume the other driver will let you pass if you use your turn signal.
Assume the other driver will maintain a constant speed.

dmv_test_20.question: When arriving to an uncontrolled intersection at the same time as vehicles to your right and left, you should:

options.text: Yield the right-of-way to the vehicle on your left.
Yield the right-of-way to the vehicle on your right.
options.explanation: If multiple vehicles arrive at the same time to an intersection that is not controlled by signs or signals, the driver on the right has the right-of-way. Drivers should then proceed in the order that they arrive to the intersection.

options.text: Wait until there are no vehicles at the intersection before proceeding.

dmv_test_21.question: You reach an intersection with stop signs on all four corners at the same time as the driver on your left. Who has the right-of-way?

options.text: The driver on your left has the right-of-way.
You have the right-of-way.
options.explanation: If two vehicles arrive at the same time to an intersection that has stop signs on all corners, the vehicle to the right has the right-of-way.

options.text: Whoever is signaling to make a turn has the right-of-way.

dmv_test_21.question: "No zones" are areas around trucks where cars:

options.text: Disappear into blind spots or are so close that they restrict the truck driver's ability to stop and maneuver safely.
options.explanation: "No zones" are areas around trucks or buses in which cars disappear into the larger vehicle's blind spots. "No zones" can also be defined as areas in which cars are so close to the larger vehicle that they restrict the truck or bus driver’s ability to stop and maneuver safely. A car being in a "No zone" greatly increases the potential for a crash.

options.text: Have sufficient space to travel behind the truck.
Have several car lengths between their vehicle and the truck.

dmv_test_21.question: When approaching a person who is crossing the street while using a white cane or guide dog, you should:

options.text: Stop until the person is well away from your path of travel.
options.explanation: When approaching a pedestrian who is using a white cane or guide dog while crossing the street, you must stop until the person is well away from your path of travel. Always yield the right-of-way to blind pedestrians.

options.text: Honk your horn as you proceed past them.
Carefully drive around them.

dmv_test_21.question: When a car with bright headlights drives toward you at night, you should:

options.text: Stop until the other driver passes.
Look below their headlights.
Glance toward the right edge of your lane.
options.explanation: To avoid being blinded when driving at night, do not look directly at the headlights of oncoming cars. Instead, look toward the right edge of the road until the oncoming driver has passed.

dmv_test_21.question: You are approaching a railroad crossing with no warning devices and are unable to see 400 feet down the tracks in one direction. The speed limit is:

options.text: 15 mph.
options.explanation: Within 100 feet of a railroad crossing where you cannot see 400 feet down the tracks in both directions, the speed limit is 15 mph. However, you may drive faster if the crossing is controlled by gates, a warning signal, or a flagger.

options.text: 20 mph.
25 mph.

dmv_test_21.question: Construction zone signs are generally:

options.text: Square or rectangular with white and red coloring.
Round or octagonal with black and yellow coloring.
Diamond-shaped or rectangular with orange and black coloring.
options.explanation: All temporary signs in work zones have an orange background with black letters or symbols. These signs are found on the right side of the road, or on both the left and right sides if the roadway is a divided highway.

dmv_test_21.question: Driving more slowly than surrounding traffic is:

options.text: A good idea if the weather is bad.
Appropriate if you don’t know the speed limit.
Often a hazard because other drivers may become frustrated and try to pass you.
options.explanation: Driving more slowly than other traffic can be dangerous. Drivers behind you may become impatient and will be tempted to take dangerous risks to pass you.

dmv_test_21.question: Motorcycles, scooters, and mopeds are not easy to see; therefore, you should:

options.text: Slow down when driving.
Make constant visual checks.
options.explanation: Motorcycles can be easily hidden in a vehicle’s blind spot or missed in a quick look due to their small size. Drivers of cars must always be alert and looking for motorcycles, mopeds, and scooters.

options.text: Share a lane with a motorcycle.

dmv_test_21.question: If it is necessary to make an emergency stop while driving on an interstate, you should:

options.text: Sound your horn at passing cars to get their attention.
Get out of your vehicle and flag down the first vehicle that passes.
Pull off the road, turn on your emergency flashers, and stay in your vehicle, if you can.
options.explanation: If you must stop on the shoulder of the interstate or highway, turn on your emergency flashers to warn other drivers and stay inside your vehicle, if you can. The extremely high speed of traffic makes standing or walking along an interstate highway very dangerous.

dmv_test_21.question: This sign means:

options.text: Four-lane traffic ahead.
Divided highway ahead.
Two-way traffic ahead.
options.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. This sign warns that you are leaving a separated one-way highway and will soon be driving on a two-way highway.

dmv_test_21.question: You are driving in the far right lane of a four-lane freeway and notice thick broken white lines on the left side of your lane. You are driving in:

options.text: The carpool lane and must merge into the next lane.
A special lane for slow-moving vehicles.
An exit lane.
options.explanation: Freeway lanes that are ending will usually be marked by large broken lines painted on the pavement. If you are driving in a lane marked with these broken lines, be prepared to exit the freeway or for the lane to end.

dmv_test_21.question: An orange-colored sign like this means:

options.text: There is roadwork ahead.
options.explanation: Orange-colored signs indicate construction areas. Proceed with caution.

options.text: You must change lanes ahead.
There is a detour ahead.

dmv_test_21.question: When driving on a slippery surface, such as snow or ice:

options.text: Shift to a low gear before going down steep hills.
options.explanation: To prevent skidding on slippery surfaces, you should shift to a low gear before going down a steep hill. You should also follow farther behind the vehicle in front of you than you normally would. Quick stops should be avoided. Unless you have antilock brakes, pump the brakes to slow or stop.

options.text: Maintain traction by following other vehicles closely.
Pump your brakes to keep them from freezing.

dmv_test_21.question: Large trucks turning onto a street with two lanes in each direction:

options.text: May complete the turn in either of the two lanes.
Often have to use the left lane to complete the turn.
options.explanation: Large trucks must often swing wide to complete a right turn. A truck making a right turn may initially appear to be turning left because of the need to swing wide. When behind a turning truck, you should pay attention to the truck's turn signal to be aware of which way the trucker actually intends to turn.

options.text: Must stay in the right lane at all times while turning.

dmv_test_21.question: Unless otherwise posted, the speed limit in a residential area is:

options.text: 20 mph.
25 mph.
options.explanation: Unless otherwise posted, the speed limit in business and residential districts is 25 mph.

options.text: 30 mph.

dmv_test_21.question: What does a traffic signal with a yellow left arrow indicate?

options.text: Drivers should prepare to yield to oncoming traffic.
The protected left turn is about to end.
Both of the above.
options.explanation: When a protected turn arrow changes from green to yellow, drivers must prepare to yield to oncoming traffic. A yellow arrow indicates that the protected left turn is ending.

dmv_test_21.question: When a school bus is picking up or dropping off children, you must:

options.text: Stop, regardless of your direction of travel.
options.explanation: When approaching a school bus that is picking up or dropping off passengers, you must come to a complete stop before reaching the bus, regardless of your direction of travel.

options.text: Stop if you are driving in the same direction.
Slow down and be prepared to stop.

dmv_test_21.question: You should signal at least how many feet before you turn?

options.explanation: You should signal at least 100 feet before you turn, before every lane change, at least five seconds before you change lanes on a freeway, before pulling next to the curb or away from the curb, even when you do not see other vehicles around you, and when you are almost through the intersection if you plan to turn shortly after crossing the intersection. Remember to turn off your signal when you no longer need it.

dmv_test_21.question: You must show proof of insurance to law enforcement:

options.text: Only if you are involved in a collision.
If you are involved in a collision or stopped for a citation.
options.explanation: You must have evidence of financial responsibility, such as proof of insurance, with you whenever you drive. You must always show proof of insurance and your license to an officer upon request after a traffic stop or collision.

options.text: Only if you are stopped and cited.

dmv_test_21.question: Excessive speed:

options.text: Saves time so you can get to your destination more quickly.
Helps you maneuver around obstacles.
Increases the likelihood of serious bodily injury and death.
options.explanation: Excessive speed is one of the most common contributing factors to vehicle crashes. Excessive speed does not save time and often leads to high-risk decision-making.

dmv_test_21.question: This sign indicates:

options.text: The distance from road surface to a bridge or overpass.
options.explanation: This is a low clearance warning sign. It indicates the distance from the road surface to the bottom of a bridge or overpass (in this case, 12 feet, 6 inches).

options.text: The maximum legal height of a vehicle allowed in this state.
The maximum width of a vehicle allowed on the highway.

dmv_test_21.question: You must file a report of a traffic accident occurring in California when:

options.text: Your vehicle fails a smog test.
You are involved in a collision and there is an injury.
options.explanation: When you have a collision, report it to DMV within 10 days if anyone was injured (no matter how slightly) or killed. You or your representative must make this report whether or not you caused the collision, even if the collision occurred on private property.

options.text: You change your insurance company.

dmv_test_21.question: Any amount of alcohol in the blood may affect a driver's:

options.text: Right-of-way privileges.
Judgment and physical coordination.
options.explanation: A driver’s ability to safely operate a vehicle may be impaired at any BAC level, even a level lower than the legal limit. Any amount of alcohol can affect one’s judgment and physical coordination. Driving under the influence of even a small amount of alcohol can lead to criminal charges.

options.text: Knowledge.

dmv_test_21.question: This sign means:

options.text: Stop Sign Ahead.
options.explanation: This sign indicates that a stop sign is ahead.

options.text: Side Road.
Railroad Warning.

dmv_test_21.question: This sign means:

options.text: One-way traffic.
Intersection ahead.
Merging traffic from the right.
options.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. This sign tells drivers to prepare to allow traffic to safely merge from the right.

dmv_test_21.question: When driving in a construction zone:

options.text: Slightly increase your speed.
Expect the unexpected.
options.explanation: You may encounter unexpected conditions in a construction zone. For the safety of yourself, other drivers, and construction workers, drive with extraordinary caution.

options.text: Expect construction workers to yield to motorists.

dmv_test_21.question: If you hit an animal with your vehicle while driving on a California highway, you should:

options.text: Move the injured animal off the road.
Call the humane society.
options.explanation: If you injure or kill an animal on the roadway, you should call CHP, the nearest humane society, or the police. You should not leave the animal to die or try to move the animal.

options.text: Continue driving.

dmv_test_21.question: In which of the following scenarios should your wheels not be pointed straight ahead?

options.text: When waiting to make a left turn at a traffic light.
When parked on a hill or sloping driveway.
options.explanation: While waiting to turn left, keep your wheels pointed straight ahead until it is safe to start your turn. If a vehicle hits you from behind, this will prevent you from veering into oncoming traffic. When parked facing either uphill or downhill, turn the wheels so the vehicle will not roll into traffic if the brakes fail.

options.text: When parked on the side of a level roadway where there is no curb.

dmv_test_21.question: The maximum posted speed limit should be driven only:

options.text: During the night.
During the day.
Under ideal conditions.
options.explanation: The posted maximum speed limit is the fastest legal speed you can travel on a road under ideal conditions. It is safest to drive at the same speed as surrounding traffic, up to the maximum speed limit. Maintaining a safe speed at all times is a responsibility shared by all motorists.

dmv_test_21.question: Regulatory signs are:

options.text: Green.
Yellow.
White.
options.explanation: Regulatory signs inform drivers of specific laws that must be obeyed. Displayed laws may be about traffic direction, lane use, turning, speed, parking, or special situations. Regulatory signs are commonly white squares or rectangles with black, red, or green letters or symbols.

dmv_test_21.question: This sign means:

options.text: No right turn.
options.explanation: This sign indicates that turns in the direction of the arrow (in this case, to the right) are prohibited.

options.text: Stop sign ahead.
Divided highway.

dmv_test_21.question: This sign means:

options.text: Slow down; curving road ahead.
Slow down and do not use your brakes.
Slow down; slippery when wet.
options.explanation: This sign warns that the road ahead becomes slippery when wet.

dmv_test_21.question: When is it legal for minors to use a cell phone without a hands-free device while driving?

options.text: When making a call while stopped at the red light
When making a call for emergency assistance
options.explanation: It is illegal for minors to use a cell phone at all while driving, except to contact an emergency entity in an emergency situation. For adult drivers, the use of hands-free devices is permitted; however, to avoid distractions, it is advisable to make calls only if needed to call for help in an emergency.

options.text: Never

dmv_test_21.question: This sign means:

options.text: You can travel in either direction in this lane.
There is two-way traffic.
options.explanation: This sign warns of two-way traffic.

options.text: You are approaching a divided highway.

dmv_test_21.question: This red and white sign means you should:

options.text: Stop and check for traffic coming from both directions before proceeding.
Give the right-of-way to traffic on the road you wish to enter or cross.
options.explanation: A three-sided yield sign indicates that you must slow down and be ready to stop, if necessary, to let any vehicle, bicyclist, or pedestrian pass before you proceed. In this case, you do not have the right-of-way.

options.text: Maintain a steady speed and check for traffic coming from all directions.

dmv_test_21.question: You are driving on a freeway with a posted speed limit of 65 mph. Traffic is heavy and moving at 35 mph. The best speed for your vehicle is most likely:

options.text: 25 mph.
35 mph.
options.explanation: Collisions are more likely to happen when one driver travels more quickly or more slowly than the other vehicles on the road. You should enter a freeway at or near the speed of traffic, unless the speed of traffic exceeds the legal speed limit.

options.text: 30 mph.

dmv_test_22.question: This sign means:

options.text: You are approaching the end of a divided highway.
You are approaching the beginning of a divided highway.
options.explanation: This sign indicates that a divided highway begins ahead. Keep to the right of the median divider.

options.text: The road will be slippery ahead.

dmv_test_22.question: When approaching an intersection that is controlled by a flashing red traffic signal, you must:

options.text: Come to a complete stop, yield to oncoming traffic or pedestrians, then proceed.
options.explanation: Treat a flashing red traffic signal the same as you would treat a stop sign. Come to a complete stop, yield to oncoming traffic or pedestrians, and proceed when the way is clear.

options.text: Reduce your speed and proceed with caution.
Come to a complete stop and remain stopped as long as the light is red.

dmv_test_22.question: You may legally block an intersection:

options.text: If you entered the intersection on the green light.
During rush hour traffic.
Under no circumstances.
options.explanation: Even if the light is green, you may not enter an intersection unless you can get completely across before the light turns red. If you block the intersection, you can be cited.

dmv_test_22.question: At dawn or dusk and in rain or snow, it can be hard to see and be seen. A good way to let other drivers know you are there is to turn:

options.text: Up the instrumental panel lights.
On your parking lights.
On your headlights.
options.explanation: You must use your headlights at any time when conditions prevent you from seeing other vehicles and when it may be difficult for other drivers to see you. Always use your low beam headlights if weather conditions require you to use your windshield wipers.

dmv_test_22.question: You must notify the DMV within five days if you:

options.text: Sell or transfer your vehicle.
options.explanation: If you sell or transfer a vehicle, you must report the sale or transfer to the DMV within five days.

options.text: Fail a smog test.
Get a new prescription for lenses or contacts.

dmv_test_22.question: Check your rearview mirrors:

options.text: Often to see how traffic is moving behind you.
options.explanation: When driving, do not develop a fixed stare. Frequently check your rearview mirrors so you know the positions of vehicles near you.

options.text: To see if a vehicle is in your blind spot.
Only when you are slowing down.

dmv_test_22.question: To see vehicles in your blind spots, you should check:

options.text: The inside rearview mirror.
The outside rearview mirror.
Over your shoulders.
options.explanation: By definition, blind spots are areas that cannot be seen using your mirrors. To check your blind spots, you should look over your shoulders.

dmv_test_22.question: To turn left from a multilane one-way street onto a one-way street, you should start your turn from:

options.text: Any lane (as long as it is safe).
The lane closest to the left curb.
options.explanation: When turning left from a one-way street onto another one-way street, you should begin the turn from the far left lane.

options.text: The lane in the center of the road.

dmv_test_22.question: Hydroplaning occurs when tires ride on a thin film of water instead of on the road. To prevent hydroplaning in wet weather, you should:

options.text: Put on your cruise control to maintain a constant speed.
Slow down.
options.explanation: Hydroplaning is caused by driving too fast on a wet road. Slow down when driving on wet pavement to prevent hydroplaning.

options.text: Move to the shoulder of the road as soon as it starts to rain.

dmv_test_22.question: Should you always drive more slowly than other traffic?

options.text: No, you can block traffic when you drive too slowly.
options.explanation: You must drive more slowly than usual when there is heavy traffic or bad weather. However, if you block the normal and reasonable movement of traffic by driving too slowly, you may be cited.

options.text: Yes, it is a good defensive driving technique.
Yes, it is always safer than driving faster than other traffic.

dmv_test_22.question: Safely backing your vehicle requires all of the following, except:

options.text: Looking over your right shoulder as you back up.
Checking your vehicle's surroundings.
Tapping your horn before you back up.
options.explanation: Backing up is always dangerous because it is hard to see behind your vehicle. Prior to entering your vehicle, check your surroundings to be aware of any potential hazards. When you are backing out of a parking space, look over your shoulder to maintain awareness of your surroundings.

dmv_test_22.question: To avoid glare from the headlights of an approaching car:

options.text: Look briefly toward the right side of the road.
options.explanation: You should avoid looking toward the bright lights of an oncoming vehicle by glancing toward the right side of the road. After looking briefly toward the side of the road, continue looking ahead to check on the position of the other vehicle.

options.text: Stay focused on the centerline on the road.
Flash your high beams.

dmv_test_22.question: When changing lanes:

options.text: Rely on the rearview mirror.
Look over your shoulder in the direction you plan to move.
options.explanation: When changing lanes, glance over your shoulder to check for traffic in your blind spot. You may need to look several times before changing lanes. You must keep track of what traffic is doing in front of you as well as what traffic is doing in the lane next to you.

options.text: Rely on the left side mirror.

dmv_test_22.question: This road sign means:

options.text: All traffic must turn right.
All traffic must go straight.
A side road intersects ahead.
options.explanation: Warning signs provide notice to road users of a situation that might not be readily apparent and are usually yellow with black markings. This warning sign tells drivers to be alert to an intersecting side road ahead.

dmv_test_22.question: When changing lanes on a freeway, you should:

options.text: Signal for at least five seconds.
options.explanation: Signal at least five seconds prior to a changing lanes on a freeway. Always signal when turning left or right, changing lanes, slowing down, or stopping to let other drivers, motorcyclists, bicyclists, and pedestrians know your intentions.

options.text: Slow down before you start to change lanes.
Assume there is enough space in the next lane for your vehicle, if you signal first.

dmv_test_22.question: Which of the following roadways freeze first when wet?

options.text: Bridges and overpasses
options.explanation: Bridges and overpasses tend to freeze before the rest of the road does.

options.text: Intersections
Tunnels

dmv_test_22.question: Which of these statements is true about roadwork zones?

options.text: Fines are the same for violations committed in work zones as they are under normal traffic conditions.
You must "Slow for the Cone Zone."
options.explanation: Reduce your speed and be prepared to slow down or stop for highway equipment. Driving carefully through work zones improves safety for drivers, pedestrians, bicyclists, and road workers.

options.text: Slow down only if you think workers are present.

dmv_test_22.question: While all of the following actions are dangerous to do while driving, which is also illegal?

options.text: Listening to music through a set of dual headphones.
options.explanation: Listening to music through a set of dual headphones is dangerous and illegal.

options.text: Adjusting your outside mirrors.
Reading a road map.

dmv_test_22.question: You are approaching an intersection at the posted speed limit when the signal turns yellow. You should:

options.text: Slow down and proceed through the intersection without caution.
Speed up to cross the intersection before the light turns red.
Stop before entering the intersection, if you can do so safely.
options.explanation: A solid yellow light means "caution" and signals that the light will soon turn red. You should stop at a solid yellow light if you can do so safely; otherwise, you should cautiously cross the intersection.

dmv_test_22.question: There are oncoming vehicles to your left and a row of parked vehicles to your right. You should steer:

options.text: Closer to the oncoming vehicles than the parked vehicles.
Closer to the parked vehicles than the oncoming vehicles.
A middle course between the oncoming and parked vehicles.
options.explanation: If there are oncoming vehicles to your left and a row of parked vehicles to your right, the best thing to do is to split the difference. Steer a middle course between the oncoming cars and the parked cars.

dmv_test_22.question: A solid yellow arrow on a traffic signal means:

options.text: You should speed up so you can make the turn before the light changes.
You do not need to signal to turn from the indicated lane.
You should prepare to stop and yield the right-of-way to oncoming traffic.
options.explanation: A solid yellow arrow means that the protection of a green arrow is ending. If you are turning in the direction of the arrow, you should prepare to stop and yield the right-of-way to oncoming traffic before turning.

dmv_test_22.question: You want to make a right turn at an upcoming intersection. You should slow down and:

options.text: Move toward the left side of your lane.
Avoid driving in the bicycle lane.
Signal for 100 feet before turning.
options.explanation: When making a right turn, you should begin signaling about 100 feet before the turn.

dmv_test_22.question: This road sign means:

options.text: You must travel through the intersection at the posted speed limit.
The maximum speed limit under ideal conditions is 55 mph.
options.explanation: Regulatory signs provide notice to road users of traffic laws that must be obeyed. This particular sign tells you the maximum speed limit for the stretch of highway where it is posted. You may drive more slowly than the posted speed limit, based on road conditions, but it is illegal to drive any faster than the posted speed limit.

options.text: You must not travel below the speed indicated.

dmv_test_22.question: If the rear of your vehicle is skidding to the left, you should:

options.text: Not turn your steering wheel.
Turn your steering wheel to the left to correct the skid.
options.explanation: If you begin to skid on a wet or icy road, take your foot off the accelerator, stay off the brakes, and turn your steering wheel in the direction of the skid. However, if you have anti-lock brakes, you should apply your brakes firmly and steer straight ahead.

options.text: Turn your steering wheel to the right to correct the skid.

dmv_test_22.question: As the percentage of alcohol (BAC) in your blood increases, you become:

options.text: More intoxicated.
options.explanation: Blood alcohol concentration (BAC) is a measure of the percentage of alcohol in a person's blood. The higher the BAC, the more impaired a person is.

options.text: More sober.
More coordinated.

dmv_test_22.question: This sign indicates that the road ahead:

options.text: Turns sharply right, then left.
Curves right, then left.
options.explanation: This sign warns of a reverse curve in which the road curves to the right, then to the left.

options.text: Curves right.

dmv_test_22.question: If a child is about to run into the street, you should:

options.text: Start to prepare to slow down.
Flash your headlights.
Sound a sharp blast of your horn.
options.explanation: If there is danger, you may need to sound a sharp blast on your horn. Do this when a child or any other pedestrian is about to enter into the street in front of your moving vehicle.

dmv_test_22.question: When you see a flashing yellow light at an intersection, you should:

options.text: Yield to all traffic before crossing the intersection.
Stop, then enter the intersection when it is safe to do so.
Slow down and cross the intersection carefully.
options.explanation: A flashing yellow light at an intersection indicates that drivers should slow to a safe and reasonable speed and proceed with caution.

dmv_test_22.question: This road sign means:

options.text: No right turn.
options.explanation: Regulatory signs provide notice to road users of traffic laws and must be obeyed. Where this sign is posted, making a right turn is prohibited.

options.text: No U-turns.
No left turn.

dmv_test_22.question: If you are riding in a vehicle equipped with a lap belt and a separate shoulder belt, you are:

options.text: Only required to use the lap belt.
Required to use both the lap and shoulder belts.
options.explanation: If your vehicle is equipped with a lap belt and a separate shoulder belt, you are required to use both.

options.text: Only required to use the shoulder belt.

dmv_test_22.question: This road sign means:

options.text: Road construction ahead.
The road ahead curves left then right.
The road ahead curves right then left.
options.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns drivers that the upcoming road will curve right, followed by a curve to the left. Drivers should adjust their speed to safely continue on the road.

dmv_test_22.question: Which of the following driving skills are affected by the use of alcohol and/or drugs?

options.text: Alertness and concentration.
Reaction time and coordination.
All of the above.
options.explanation: Any amount of alcohol acts as a depressant, slowing the function of the nervous system. It will reduce a person's alertness and ability to concentrate, increase their reaction time, and drastically reduce their coordination.

dmv_test_22.question: You must yield the right-of-way to an emergency vehicle that is using its siren and flashing lights by:

options.text: Driving as closely to the right edge of the road as possible and stopping.
options.explanation: You must yield the right-of-way to any emergency vehicle that is using its siren and flashing lights. Do this by driving to the right edge of the road and stopping, taking care not to stop in an intersection. You may move again after the emergency vehicle has passed.

options.text: Moving into the right lane and driving slowly until it has passed.
Stopping immediately, even if you are within an intersection.

dmv_test_22.question: This sign means:

options.text: Divided highway.
options.explanation: This sign indicates that a divided highway begins ahead.

options.text: Railroad warning.
No passing zone.

dmv_test_22.question: Signs with orange backgrounds are:

options.text: General warning signs.
Construction and maintenance warning signs.
options.explanation: The color orange is used only for construction and maintenance warning signs.

options.text: Regulatory signs.

dmv_test_22.question: If a tire blows out, you should:

options.text: Apply the brake and hold it.
Hold the steering wheel tightly and use the brakes lightly.
options.explanation: If a tire suddenly blows out while you are driving, hold the steering wheel tightly and keep the vehicle going straight.You should slow down gradually, taking your foot off the gas pedal and using the brakes lightly. Do not stop on the road if at all possible. Pull off the road in a safe place.

options.text: Pull over quickly.

dmv_test_23.question: If your vehicle begins to skid, you should:

options.text: Ease up on the gas pedal.
options.explanation: If your vehicle begins to skid, release the accelerator or brake pedal to regain vehicle balance. Steer in the direction of the skid to regain control of the vehicle.

options.text: Brake as hard as possible.
Turn off the ignition.

dmv_test_23.question: When passing another car, you have enough space to return to the driving lane:

options.text: If the other driver signals for you to re-enter the lane.
If you look over your shoulder and see the passed car behind you.
If you can see both of the passed vehicle's headlights in your rearview mirror.
options.explanation: Before you return to the driving lane when completing a pass, be sure there is a safe gap between your vehicle and the passed vehicle. When you can see both headlights of the vehicle in your rearview mirror, it is safe to return to the driving lane.

dmv_test_23.question: To avoid last-minute moves, you should be looking down the road to where your vehicle will be in about:

options.text: 5 to 10 seconds.
10 to 15 seconds.
options.explanation: To avoid last-minute moves, you should scan the road 10 to 15 seconds ahead of your vehicle. This allows you to see hazards before meeting them.

options.text: 15 to 20 seconds.

dmv_test_23.question: U-turns in business districts are:

options.text: Always illegal because they are dangerous.
Legal whenever oncoming vehicles are not a hazard.
Legal at intersections, unless a sign prohibits them.
options.explanation: In a business district, you may make a U-turn only at an intersection, unless a sign prohibits it, or where openings are provided for turns.

dmv_test_23.question: Roads are slippery after it first starts to rain. When the road is slippery, you should:

options.text: Avoid making turns and stops while driving at high speeds.
options.explanation: A wet, slippery road does not allow your tires the traction they need, so it is necessary to drive more slowly on a wet road than you would on a dry road. To reduce the risk of skidding, you should avoid fast turns or stops.

options.text: Test your tires' traction while going uphill.
Decrease the distance you look ahead of your vehicle.

dmv_test_23.question: Roads with double solid yellow line markings down the center indicate that passing is:

options.text: Allowed from both directions.
Allowed only from your direction of travel.
Not allowed from either direction.
options.explanation: A double solid yellow line down the center of a road indicates that traffic is moving in opposite directions and that passing is not allowed from either direction.

dmv_test_23.question: You are merging onto an interstate highway. You should:

options.text: Select a safe gap and merge into the lane of traffic.
options.explanation: Anytime you want to merge with other drivers, you need to find a gap large enough for you to safely enter into the flow of traffic. You should not stop on the entrance ramp to an interstate highway unless there are no gaps into which you may safely merge.

options.text: Merge across two lanes at once.
Always stop before entering the highway.

dmv_test_23.question: When can you drive in a bike lane?

options.text: 30 minutes after sunset or 30 minutes before sunrise
On foggy days when visibility is low
200 feet before making a turn
options.explanation: When you are making a right turn, you must enter the bicycle lane no more than 200 feet before the corner or driveway entrance. Do not drive in the bicycle lane at any other time

dmv_test_23.question: Blocking an intersection during "rush hour" traffic is not permitted:

options.text: Unless you entered the intersection on a green light.
Under any circumstances, even if your light is green.
options.explanation: Even if your light is green, you should not enter an intersection unless you can get completely across before the light turns red. You can be cited if you block the intersection.

options.text: Unless you have the right-of-way or a green light.

dmv_test_23.question: If you are involved in a traffic collision, you are required to complete and submit a written report to the DMV:

options.text: Only if you or the other driver is injured.
If there is property damage in excess of $1,000 or if there are any injuries.
options.explanation: If a collision results in death, any minor or major injury, or more than $1,000 in damage to anyone's property, each driver involved must file a report with the DMV within 10 days. In some cases, the driver's insurance agent, broker, or legal representative may file the report to represent the driver.

options.text: Only if you are at fault.

dmv_test_23.question: You must obey instructions from school crossing guards:

options.text: At all times.
options.explanation: Drivers should be alert to the presence of crossing guards when near a school and must always obey their instructions.

options.text: Only during school hours.
Unless you do not see any children present.

dmv_test_23.question: Two sets of solid double yellow lines that are two or more feet apart:

options.text: May be crossed to enter or exit a private driveway.
May not be crossed for any reason.
options.explanation: Two sets of solid double yellow lines spaced two or more feet apart are considered a barrier. You may not drive on or over this barrier, or make a left turn or U-turn across it, except at designated openings.

options.text: Should be treated as a separate traffic lane.

dmv_test_23.question: A flashing yellow light at an intersection means you should:

options.text: Slow down and proceed with caution.
options.explanation: When encountering a flashing yellow light at an intersection, you should slow down and proceed with caution. You do not need to come to a complete stop when approaching a flashing yellow light.

options.text: Come to a complete stop as quickly as possible.
Stop and proceed only when the intersection is clear.

dmv_test_23.question: You can drive off the road to pass another vehicle:

options.text: If the vehicle ahead is turning left.
If there are two or more lanes traveling in your direction.
Under no circumstances.
options.explanation: You may never drive off the paved or main-traveled portion of the road and onto the shoulder to pass another vehicle.

dmv_test_23.question: If you park facing uphill where there is no curb, set the parking brake and:

options.text: Turn your wheels toward the edge of the road.
options.explanation: When parking uphill on a road that does not have a curb, your front wheels should be turned to the right (toward the edge of the road). This will ensure that the vehicle will roll off of the road if the brakes fail.

options.text: Turn your wheels away from the edge of the road.
Keep your wheels facing straight.

dmv_test_23.question: When you approach an octagonal sign, you must:

options.text: Slow.
Stop.
options.explanation: An octagonal (eight-sided) sign always means "Stop." Come to a complete stop, yield to traffic and pedestrians that have the right-of-way, and proceed when the way is clear.

options.text: Turn.

dmv_test_23.question: Which of these statements is true about changing lanes?

options.text: You only need to turn and look over your right shoulder for lane changes to the right or left.
Look over your right shoulder for a right lane change and your left shoulder for a left lane change.
options.explanation: Before changing lanes, signal, look in all your mirrors, and look over your left or right shoulder to make sure the lane next to you is clear. Looking over your shoulder is a way to check your blind spot to be sure there is no vehicle, motorcycle, or bicycle traffic in the next lane.

options.text: Vehicles with two outside mirrors do not have blind spots.

dmv_test_23.question: This white sign means you:

options.text: May turn left only on a green arrow.
May turn left on a green light when it is safe.
options.explanation: A sign that says to "yield" means that you must slow down and be ready to stop to let any vehicle, bicyclist, or pedestrian pass before you proceed. After yielding, you may follow the remaining directions on the sign.

options.text: Must wait for the solid green light before you turn left.

dmv_test_23.question: A red arrow pointing to the right on a traffic light means you may:

options.text: Turn in that direction after slowing and checking for traffic.
Not turn in that direction until the light turns green.
options.explanation: A red arrow means "stop." You must remain stopped until a green light or green arrow appears. Do not turn against a red arrow.

options.text: Turn in that direction after you come to a complete stop.

dmv_test_23.question: When you see this yellow sign, you should:

options.text: Always stop at the crosswalk.
Stop at the crosswalk until a crossing guards signals for you to go.
Be prepared to stop if children are in the crosswalk.
options.explanation: A five-sided sign indicates that you are near a school. Be aware and stop if children are in the crosswalk.

dmv_test_23.question: This sign tells you that:

options.text: No turns are allowed on the road.
The road narrows ahead.
There is a series of curves ahead.
options.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. This sign warns drivers about an upcoming winding road.

dmv_test_23.question: Which of the following statements is true?

options.text: Driving too slowly is not an unsafe practice.
Driving too slowly on certain highways can be dangerous.
options.explanation: Driving too slowly can be dangerous because it may cause drivers behind you to become frustrated and make dangerous moves to pass you. It is safest to drive with the flow of traffic, within the legal speed limit.

options.text: The speed at which you drive a vehicle does not affect safety.

dmv_test_23.question: You are on the freeway and traffic is merging into your lane. You should:

options.text: Make room for the merging traffic, if possible.
options.explanation: When traffic permits, you should make room to allow vehicles to merge into your lane.

options.text: Assert your right-of-way by driving faster.
Always maintain your position.

dmv_test_23.question: At an intersection with a yield sign, you:

options.text: Must yield the right-of-way to cross traffic that is close enough to cause conflict.
options.explanation: When approaching a yield sign, drivers must give the right-of-way to traffic already in the lanes that they intend to enter or cross. Drivers should be prepared to stop when approaching a yield sign but may continue without stopping if there is no conflicting traffic.

options.text: Must yield to vehicles only on your right.
Should slow down but never stop.

dmv_test_23.question: You are driving on a freeway with a posted speed limit of 65 mph. Traffic is traveling at 70 mph. You may legally drive:

options.text: 70 mph or faster to keep up with the speed of traffic.
Between 65 mph and 70 mph.
No faster than 65 mph.
options.explanation: On most California highways, the maximum speed limit is 65 mph. You may drive at 70 mph only if the speed limit is posted as such.

dmv_test_23.question: On a freeway, you should look farther ahead than you would on a city street:

options.text: In order to see potential hazards early.
options.explanation: On the freeway, be ready for changes in traffic conditions. Watch for signals from other drivers. Expect merging vehicles at on-ramps and interchanges and be prepared for rapid changes in road conditions and traffic flow.

options.text: Because it takes a quarter of a mile to stop your vehicle completely.
Because it helps you keep up with traffic.

dmv_test_23.question: A white painted curb indicates a:

options.text: Loading zone for freight or passengers.
Loading zone for passengers or mail only.
options.explanation: At a white painted curb, you may stop only long enough to pick up or drop off passengers or mail.

options.text: Loading zone for freight only.

dmv_test_23.question: If a vehicle is equipped with airbags:

options.text: Seat belts should still be worn.
options.explanation: Airbags are important safety devices that provide protection in crashes. For best protection, a vehicle's lap and shoulder belts should be used in combination with airbags.

options.text: Seat belts do not need to be worn.
Seat belts should be worn behind the back.

dmv_test_23.question: A person may legally ride in the back of a pickup truck when:

options.text: The sides of the pickup bed are at least 24 inches high.
The back of the pickup is covered with a camper shell.
In a secured seat and while using an approved safety belt.
options.explanation: Do not allow a person to ride in the back of a pickup or other truck unless the vehicle is equipped with seats and the person uses both the seat and a safety belt.

dmv_test_23.question: A curb painted blue means parking is:

options.text: Allowed for no longer than 15 minutes.
Only allowed when picking up or dropping off passengers.
For disabled persons with a special placard or plate.
options.explanation: A blue curb indicates an area where parking is permitted only for a disabled person, or driver of a disabled person, who displays a placard or special license plate for disabled persons or disabled veterans.

dmv_test_23.question: If you see orange construction signs and cones on a freeway, you must:

options.text: Slow down because the lane ends ahead.
Be prepared for workers and equipment ahead.
options.explanation: As you enter a work zone, signs and message boards will warn you of workers, slow-moving equipment, and/or closed lanes ahead. You should reduce your speed and be prepared to slow down or stop.

options.text: Change lanes and maintain your current speed.

dmv_test_23.question: When using a roundabout, drivers should:

options.text: Stop in the middle of the roundabout.
Yield to traffic already in the roundabout.
options.explanation: A roundabout is a circular intersection that usually does not include a traffic signal and flows in a counterclockwise direction around a central island. Motorists must enter from the right, yielding to traffic already in the roundabout, and follow the circle to the right until the desired roadway is reached.

options.text: Yield to entering traffic.

dmv_test_23.question: This white sign means:

options.text: The railroad crossing is controlled. Continue at your regular speed.
Look, listen, and prepare to stop at the crossing if necessary.
options.explanation: When approaching a railroad crossing, you must look, listen, slow down, and prepare to stop. Let any trains pass before you proceed.

options.text: Stop at the railroad tracks and wait for a signal before crossing.

dmv_test_23.question: Which of these statements is true about drinking alcohol and driving?

options.text: If you can walk in a straight line after drinking, it is safe to drive.
If you are under the legal blood alcohol concentration limit, your driving isn't impaired.
Alcohol affects judgement, which is needed to drive safely.
options.explanation: Being under the influence of alcohol affects your judgment. Good judgement is necessary to react appropriately to things that you see or hear while on the road. Even if you are below the legal blood alcohol limit, consuming any amount of alcohol is likely to affect your ability to drive safely.

dmv_test_23.question: When merging onto the freeway, you should be driving:

options.text: At or near the speed of the freeway traffic.
options.explanation: You should enter a freeway at or near the speed of traffic, unless the speed of traffic exceeds the legal speed limit.

options.text: At the legal speed limit.
More slowly than the freeway traffic.

dmv_test_23.question: This road sign means:

options.text: Sharp turn to the right ahead.
Upcoming sharp left and right turns.
Winding road ahead.
options.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns the driver that there is an upcoming winding road. Speed should be adjusted appropriately.

dmv_test_24.question: You exit the freeway on a ramp that curves downhill. You should:

options.text: Slow to a safe speed before the curve.
options.explanation: You should always slow down before entering a curve. You may not be able to see hazards ahead and braking in a curve may cause your vehicle to skid.

options.text: Slow to the posted speed limit for the freeway.
Wait until you have entered the curve to begin braking.

dmv_test_24.question: When parking your vehicle on any hill:

options.text: One of your rear wheels should touch the curb.
Use your parking brake and leave the vehicle in "park."
options.explanation: When parking on a hill, you should always leave your vehicle in gear or in the "park" position. If there is no curb, you should turn your front wheels so that the vehicle will roll away from the center of the road if the brakes fail. If there is a curb, the front wheels should be turned toward it (if headed downhill) or away from and gently touching it (if headed uphill).

options.text: Your front wheels should be parallel to the road, if there is no curb.

dmv_test_24.question: You see pedestrians near the road. You should:

options.text: Sound your horn and maintain your speed.
Speed up to clear the area quickly.
Slow down and pass with caution.
options.explanation: Watch for any pedestrian who may cross your path. If you see pedestrians near the road where you are driving, slow down and be prepared to stop, if necessary.

dmv_test_24.question: You must stop at the intersection ahead. Just before the intersection, you have to cross railroad tracks. You should stop before crossing the railroad tracks when:

options.text: There isn't room on the other side for you to completely cross the tracks.
options.explanation: If you need to stop after crossing railroad tracks, wait until you can completely cross the tracks before proceeding. Make sure your vehicle clears the tracks before you stop.

options.text: The crossing is located in a city or town with frequent train traffic.
You are transporting two or more children in a passenger vehicle.

dmv_test_24.question: If you parallel park facing downward on a hill:

options.text: Turn your wheels sharply toward the side of the road.
options.explanation: When parking downhill, turn your front wheels toward the curb or edge of the road. When parking uphill on a road without a curb, turn your wheels toward the edge of the road. When parking uphill on a road with a curb, you must turn your front wheels away from the curb.

options.text: Turn your wheels away from the side of the road.
Keep your wheels straight.

dmv_test_24.question: If you want to enter the freeway but you don't see a gap in traffic, you should:

options.text: Maintain your speed and force the other drivers to create a gap.
Slow down on the ramp to wait for a gap.
options.explanation: If you want to enter the freeway but do not see a space for your vehicle in traffic, slow down on the ramp to wait for a gap. Do not drive to the end of the ramp and wait for a gap or you will not have enough room to accelerate to the speed of traffic before entering the roadway.

options.text: Stop at the end of the ramp to wait for a gap.

dmv_test_24.question: You want to make a right turn at the corner. A pedestrian with a guide dog is at the corner ready to cross the street in front of you. Before making your right turn, you should:

options.text: Turn off your engine until the person crosses the street.
Tell the pedestrian when to cross the street.
Wait until the person crosses the street.
options.explanation: Pedestrians using guide dogs or white canes (with or without a red tip) must be given the right-of-way at all times.

dmv_test_24.question: At an uncontrolled intersection where you cannot see cross traffic until you are just about to enter the intersection, the speed limit is:

options.text: 15 mph.
options.explanation: The speed limit for a blind intersection is 15 mph. An intersection is considered “blind” if there are no stop signs on any corner and you cannot see for 100 feet in either direction during the last 100 feet before crossing.

options.text: 25 mph.
20 mph.

dmv_test_24.question: You should turn on your headlights:

options.text: One half hour after sunset.
options.explanation: Headlights must be used one half hour after sunset until one half hour before sunrise, when windshield wipers are being used due to rain or snow, and in any other situation when visibility is less than 1,000 feet. They should be used when a car is being driven on a small country or mountain road, even in sunny weather.

options.text: When stopped at a railroad crossing.
When parked at a school.

dmv_test_24.question: A vehicle suddenly cuts in front of you, creating a hazard. What should you do first?

options.text: Honk and step on the brake firmly.
Take your foot off the gas pedal.
options.explanation: If a vehicle merges in front of you too closely, take your foot off of the accelerator. This will create space between you and the vehicle ahead without requiring you to slam on your brakes or swerve into another lane.

options.text: Swerve into the lane next to you.

dmv_test_24.question: When a pedestrian guided by a dog or carrying a white cane is crossing the street:

options.text: You must always yield the right-of-way.
options.explanation: Blind or partially blind pedestrians may carry a white cane or use the assistance of a guide dog. You must always yield the right-of-way to a pedestrian who is using a guide dog or carrying a white cane.

options.text: You must tell them where to cross the street.
You only have to yield the right-of-way if you are at a corner.

dmv_test_24.question: For which of the following traffic lights must you always stop your vehicle?

options.text: Solid red lights, flashing red lights, and blacked out traffic signals.
options.explanation: You must stop at a solid or flashing red light, or at a signal light that is blacked out (not working). A solid yellow light means that the signal is about to turn red and you must stop if you can do so safely; otherwise, proceed cautiously. A flashing yellow light means that you should proceed with caution, but you do not need to stop.

options.text: Solid red lights, red arrows, and flashing yellow lights.
Solid red lights, flashing red lights, and yellow lights.

dmv_test_24.question: To make a right turn at a corner, you:

options.text: May not enter the bicycle lane.
Should only merge into the bicycle lane if you stop before turning.
Must merge into the bicycle lane before turning.
options.explanation: When making a right turn where there is a bicycle lane, you must merge into the bicycle lane no more than 200 feet before the corner and then make the turn. Be sure there are no bicyclists in your path before merging.

dmv_test_24.question: You must yield to a pedestrian using a white cane or guide dog:

options.text: Only when the guide dog is leading the person across the street.
At all times.
options.explanation: Pedestrians who use guide dogs or white canes (with or without a red tip) must be given the right-of-way at all times.

options.text: Only if a crossing guard is present.

dmv_test_24.question: You are coming to an intersection with a flashing red light. You should:

options.text: Slow down and yield the right-of-way.
Slow down and drive carefully through the intersection.
Come to a complete stop, check the traffic, and go when it is safe to do so.
options.explanation: A flashing red traffic light means the same thing as a stop sign. You must come to a complete stop, yield to other traffic and pedestrians, and then proceed when it safe to do so.

dmv_test_24.question: This road sign means:

options.text: Do not enter.
No parking.
No U-turn.
options.explanation: This sign prohibits drivers from making a U-turn. You cannot turn around to go in the opposite direction at an intersection where this sign is posted.

dmv_test_24.question: Placard abuse will result in:

options.text: Placard revocation only.
Only a fine.
Placard revocation, a fine, and/or jail time.
options.explanation: Abuse of a disabled placard or plate is a misdemeanor. Placard abuse can result in the loss of special parking privileges, a fine of up to $1,000, and up to six months of jail time.

dmv_test_24.question: When can you drive in a bike lane?

options.text: During rush hour traffic if there are no bicyclists in the bike lane.
When you are within 200 feet of a cross street where you plan to turn right.
options.explanation: If there is a bike lane, drive into the bike lane no more than 200 feet before a turn. Watch for bicyclists or motorcyclists who may get between your vehicle and the curb.

options.text: When you want to pass a driver ahead of you who is turning right.

dmv_test_24.question: You want to turn left at an upcoming corner. Yield the right-of-way to:

options.text: Oncoming vehicles also turning left.
All approaching vehicles.
options.explanation: When making a left turn, you must yield to pedestrians, bicyclists, or other vehicles moving on their green light.

options.text: Pedestrians on the sidewalk waiting for a "Walk" signal.

dmv_test_24.question: When stopping on snow or ice, drivers who are operating vehicles equipped with an Anti-Lock Braking System (ABS) should:

options.text: Pump the brakes.
Press and hold the brake pedal firmly.
options.explanation: When driving a vehicle equipped with an Anti-Lock Braking System (ABS), a driver should press the brake pedal firmly when stopping on a snowy or icy surface. The ABS will pump the brakes more rapidly than a driver would be able to.

options.text: Stay off the brakes and wait for the car to drift to a stop.

dmv_test_24.question: When entering the interstate on a short entrance ramp where there is no acceleration lane, you should:

options.text: Immediately enter the far-right traffic lane on the interstate and speed up to match the flow of traffic.
Use the shoulder of the main road to get up to the speed of traffic.
Speed up and enter the interstate only after you have identified a gap in traffic.
options.explanation: When entering the interstate on a short entrance ramp where there is no acceleration lane, speed up only after you have identified a gap in traffic. In general, you should be stopped while waiting for a gap to appear.

dmv_test_24.question: You want to park downhill on a two-way road and there is no curb. Which way do you turn your front wheels?

options.text: Straight ahead
Right, toward the side of the road
options.explanation: When parking facing downhill on a road with or without a curb, or when facing uphill on a road without a curb, turn your front wheels toward the edge of the road so your vehicle will roll away from traffic if the brakes fail. However, when parking uphill on a road with a curb, turn your wheels toward the center of the road so the vehicle will roll into the curb if the brakes fail.

options.text: Left, toward the center of the road

dmv_test_24.question: You must notify the DMV within five days if you:

options.text: Are cited for a traffic violation.
Sell or transfer your vehicle.
options.explanation: You are required by law to contact the DMV within five calendar days from the date you sell or transfer the title of a vehicle to another owner. They must be notified of every title transfer.

options.text: Paint your vehicle a different color.

dmv_test_24.question: If you are involved in a traffic accident in California, you must file a report of the accident with the DMV when:

options.text: The collision causes $1,000 in damage.
options.explanation: If a collision results in death, any minor or major injury, or more than $1,000 in damage to anyone's property, each driver involved must file a report with the DMV within 10 days. In some cases, the driver's insurance agent, broker, or legal representative may file the report to represent the driver.

options.text: You plan on being out of the state for more than 30 days.
You refinance the remaining balance of your vehicle loan.

dmv_test_24.question: A flashing red traffic light at an intersection means:

options.text: The same thing as a yield sign.
The light is about to turn green.
The same thing as a stop sign.
options.explanation: A flashing red light at an intersection means drivers are required to come to a complete stop, yield to traffic and pedestrians, and proceed when the way is clear. The same is true at a stop sign.

dmv_test_24.question: Which of these vehicles must always stop before crossing railroad tracks?

options.text: Tank trucks with hazardous materials placards.
options.explanation: A diamond-shaped sign on a truck means that the load on the truck is potentially dangerous (containing gas, explosives, etc.). Vehicles displaying these signs are required to stop before crossing railroad tracks.

options.text: Motor homes or pickup trucks towing a boat trailer.
Sport utility vehicles carrying four or more persons.

dmv_test_24.question: When a bicyclist is making a left turn:

options.text: They may use the left lane.
options.explanation: You should expect to see bicyclists driving with traffic on the road. You should not be surprised to see a bicyclist using the left lane when turning.

options.text: They may cut through all lanes.
They may wait on the side of the road.

dmv_test_24.question: You may cross double yellow lines to pass another vehicle if the:

options.text: Vehicle in front of you moves to the right to let you pass.
Yellow line next to your side of the road is broken.
options.explanation: A broken yellow line in the center of the road indicates that traffic next to the broken yellow line may pass, if it is safe to do so.

options.text: Yellow line next to the opposite side of the road is broken.

dmv_test_24.question: When you are merging onto the freeway, you should be driving:

options.text: At or near the speed of traffic on the freeway.
options.explanation: When merging onto a freeway, you should enter at or near the speed of traffic.

options.text: Five to 10 mph slower than the speed of traffic on the freeway.
The posted speed limit for freeway traffic.

dmv_test_24.question: If there is no crosswalk and you see a pedestrian crossing your lane, you should:

options.text: Make sure the pedestrian can see you before proceeding.
Cautiously drive around the pedestrian.
Stop and let the pedestrian finish crossing.
options.explanation: Drivers must always yield the right-of-way to pedestrians in the roadway, even if there is not a marked crosswalk.

dmv_test_24.question: When approaching an intersection with a flashing red light, you must:

options.text: Come to a complete stop, yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians, then proceed.
options.explanation: A flashing red traffic light means the same thing as a stop sign. When arriving at an intersection with a flashing red light, you must come to a full stop and proceed when it is safe to do so.

options.text: Reduce your speed and proceed with caution.
Come to a complete stop and remain stopped as long as the light is red.

dmv_test_24.question: While driving at night, a vehicle coming toward you has its high beams on, making it hard for you to see the road ahead. You should:

options.text: Look ahead toward the left edge of your lane.
Look ahead toward the right edge of your lane.
options.explanation: If an oncoming driver fails to dim their high beams, you should avoid looking directly at the headlights. Instead, look toward the right edge of your lane and watch the oncoming vehicle out of the corner of your eye.

options.text: Look straight ahead in your lane.

dmv_test_24.question: Before stopping your vehicle at a traffic signal or sign, you should:

options.text: Press down hard on the accelerator.
Check your mirrors for surrounding traffic.
options.explanation: When stopping your vehicle on the roadway, first check your mirrors for traffic. Be aware of surrounding drivers as you release the accelerator and allow your vehicle to slow. Move your foot to the brake pedal and press with steady pressure for a smooth stop.

options.text: Set the parking brake.

dmv_test_24.question: You hit a parked vehicle and can't find the owner. What must you do?

options.text: Call your insurance company when you get home.
Wait for the owner to return.
Leave a note with your name and address on the parked vehicle.
options.explanation: If you hit a parked vehicle or other property, you must leave a note with your name, phone number, and address securely attached to the vehicle or property that you hit.

dmv_test_24.question: What is the only medically proven method of removing alcohol or other drug combinations from your system?

options.text: Breathe in some fresh air.
Give your body time.
options.explanation: Alcohol takes effect quickly and is slow to leave your system. Cold showers, black coffee, and exercise will do nothing to reduce a person's blood alcohol content (BAC). The only way to lower your BAC is to wait.

options.text: Drink coffee.

dmv_test_24.question: If the roadway is wet or icy, you should:

options.text: Reduce your speed.
options.explanation: Because your tires will not grip the road under wet, snowy, or icy conditions as well as they will under dry conditions, you should slow down if the roadway is wet or icy.

options.text: Drive at the posted speed.
Speed up.
